raw_meal: Cut the French bread in half lengthwise. Mix the two cheeses, garlic and mayonnaise
and spread onto the bread halves. Broil until cheese is bubbly and light golden brown.
'FISH MARKET' CHEESE BREAD.title: 'FISH MARKET' CHEESE BREAD
'FISH MARKET' CHEESE BREAD.instructions: Cut the French bread in half lengthwise. Mix the two cheeses, garlic and mayonnaise and spread onto the bread halves. Broil until cheese is bubbly and light golden brown.

raw_meal: Hard boil and peel the eggs. Melt about half of the butter in a deep sauce pan. When
the butter is medium hot, fry 3 to 5 whole eggs at a time (or as many as will fit in the
pan so each egg touches the bottom), rotating and stirring the eggs continuously until
golden brown. Remove from heat and add salt, pepper and cumin (if desired). Add the
rest of the butter to the pan and repeat until all eggs are fried. Serve either hot or cold.
BEID MEZAALEL.title: BEID MEZAALEL
BEID MEZAALEL.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Whole Fried Eggs)
BEID MEZAALEL.instructions: Hard boil and peel the eggs. Melt about half of the butter in a deep sauce pan. When the butter is medium hot, fry 3 to 5 whole eggs at a time (or as many as will fit in the pan so each egg touches the bottom), rotating and stirring the eggs continuously until golden brown. Remove from heat and add salt, pepper and cumin (if desired). Add the rest of the butter to the pan and repeat until all eggs are fried. Serve either hot or cold.

BITTINGAN BIL TOMM.title: BITTINGAN BIL TOMM
BITTINGAN BIL TOMM.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Eggplant with Garlic)
BITTINGAN BIL TOMM.instructions: With a vegetable peeler, peel eggplant. Cut into 1/2-inch rounds and lay on cookie sheet. Sprinkle lightly with salt on both sides, laying each on a paper towel. Let sit for 1/2 hour to pull out the bitterness. In a saute pan, heat the oil to medium heat. Fry each round in oil until golden brown. Turn and let brown on other side. Remove eggplant to a paper towl and let drain. Repeat until eggplant rounds are all fried. In same pan, add the garlic (adding 1 tsp. oil if needed) and saute for 1-2 minutes until light golden brown. (Do not over cook.) In a small sauce pan, bring the vinegar, salt, pepper and garlic (with oil) to simmer on medium heat. Simmer for 4-5 minutes, until slightly reduced. Lay half of the eggplant rounds on a flat serving dish and spoon half of the vinegar sauce over eggplant to cover. Lay the remaining eggplant on top and pour over remaining sauce. Cover eggplant completely. Cover with plastic and let sit for one day to pickle. Serve at room temperature.

raw_meal: Bake the eggplant in a 350 degree oven until soft, about 45-50 minutes. Remove the
skin, chop into medium size pieces, and set aside until you make the tahini dip.
Combine the tahini paste, water, parsley (set aside 2 T. for garnish), garlic, lime juice,
salt and pepper in a food processor and mix for about one minute. Add the eggplant
and mix for another 30 seconds. Pour mix onto a platter, top with some freshly ground
black pepper and a little fresh chopped parsley, and drizzle with a few tablespoons of
olive oil. Use as a dip with pieces of pita bread cut into triangles (toast until crisp, if
desired).
BABA GANOUSH.title: BABA GANOUSH
BABA GANOUSH.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Eggplant and Tahini Dip)
BABA GANOUSH.instructions: Bake the eggplant in a 350 degree oven until soft, about 45-50 minutes. Remove the skin, chop into medium size pieces, and set aside until you make the tahini dip. Combine the tahini paste, water, parsley (set aside 2 T. for garnish), garlic, lime juice, salt and pepper in a food processor and mix for about one minute. Add the eggplant and mix for another 30 seconds. Pour mix onto a platter, top with some freshly ground black pepper and a little fresh chopped parsley, and drizzle with a few tablespoons of olive oil. Use as a dip with pieces of pita bread cut into triangles (toast until crisp, if desired).

raw_meal: Cut the baguettes into 1 inch slices then place on a large cookie sheet. Drizzle olive
oil over rounds and bake in a 400 degree oven for 5 minutes until light brown.
Remove from oven and top each round with a small piece of cheese and a little honey.
Serve immediately. For a variation, this recipe can be made with Brie cheese instead
of the gorgonzola and warmed fig jam instead of the honey.
With a vegetable peeler, peel eggplant. Cut into 1/2-inch rounds and lay on cookie
sheet. Sprinkle lightly with salt on both sides, laying each on a paper towel. Let sit for
1/2 hour to pull out the bitterness. In a saute pan, heat the oil to medium heat. Fry
each round in oil until golden brown. Turn and let brown on other side. Remove
eggplant to a paper towl and let drain. Repeat until eggplant rounds are all fried. In
same pan, add the garlic (adding 1 tsp. oil if needed) and saute for 1-2 minutes until
light golden brown. (Do not over cook.) In a small sauce pan, bring the vinegar, salt,
pepper and garlic (with oil) to simmer on medium heat. Simmer for 4-5 minutes, until
slightly reduced. Lay half of the eggplant rounds on a flat serving dish and spoon half
of the vinegar sauce over eggplant to cover. Lay the remaining eggplant on top and
pour over remaining sauce. Cover eggplant completely. Cover with plastic and let sit
for one day to pickle. Serve at room temperature.
BAGUETTE ROUNDS WITH GORGONZOLA AND HONE.title: BAGUETTE ROUNDS WITH GORGONZOLA AND HONEY
BAGUETTE ROUNDS WITH GORGONZOLA AND HONE.instructions: Cut the baguettes into 1 inch slices then place on a large cookie sheet. Drizzle olive oil over rounds and bake in a 400 degree oven for 5 minutes until light brown. Remove from oven and top each round with a small piece of cheese and a little honey. Serve immediately. For a variation, this recipe can be made with Brie cheese instead of the gorgonzola and warmed fig jam instead of the honey. With a vegetable peeler, peel eggplant. Cut into 1/2-inch rounds and lay on cookie sheet. Sprinkle lightly with salt on both sides, laying each on a paper towel. Let sit for 1/2 hour to pull out the bitterness. In a saute pan, heat the oil to medium heat. Fry each round in oil until golden brown. Turn and let brown on other side. Remove eggplant to a paper towl and let drain. Repeat until eggplant rounds are all fried. In same pan, add the garlic (adding 1 tsp. oil if needed) and saute for 1-2 minutes until light golden brown. (Do not over cook.) In a small sauce pan, bring the vinegar, salt, pepper and garlic (with oil) to simmer on medium heat. Simmer for 4-5 minutes, until slightly reduced. Lay half of the eggplant rounds on a flat serving dish and spoon half of the vinegar sauce over eggplant to cover. Lay the remaining eggplant on top and pour over remaining sauce. Cover eggplant completely. Cover with plastic and let sit for one day to pickle. Serve at room temperature.

raw_meal: Cut the French bread loaf in half lengthwise. Mix the cheese with the mayonnaise and
onions. Spread the cheese mixture on the bread. Broil until bubbly and light brown.
CHEDDAR CHEESE BREAD.title: CHEDDAR CHEESE BREAD
CHEDDAR CHEESE BREAD.instructions: Cut the French bread loaf in half lengthwise. Mix the cheese with the mayonnaise and onions. Spread the cheese mixture on the bread. Broil until bubbly and light brown.

raw_meal: Arrange the chicken wings in a flat baking pan and dissolve the bullion in water and
pour over chicken. Mix together the remaining ingredients and pour evenly over
chicken. Bake chicken at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.
CHICKEN WINGS.title: CHICKEN WINGS
CHICKEN WINGS.instructions: Arrange the chicken wings in a flat baking pan and dissolve the bullion in water and pour over chicken. Mix together the remaining ingredients and pour evenly over chicken. Bake chicken at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

raw_meal: Thaw dough 30 minutes at room temperature. On a large working surface with a
lightly floured rolling pin, roll puff pastry to 14 inches square. Cut dough into 24
equal squares. Press pastry into mini-muffin pans. Coarsely chop pears and put a few
chunks into center of each pastry square. Cut curved crust off of cheese, and discard.
Cut cheese into small pieces, then put one piece into each pastry square. Top each
square with 3-4 cranberries. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Serve warm.
CRANBERRY BRIE PUFFS.title: CRANBERRY BRIE PUFFS
CRANBERRY BRIE PUFFS.instructions: Thaw dough 30 minutes at room temperature. On a large working surface with a lightly floured rolling pin, roll puff pastry to 14 inches square. Cut dough into 24 equal squares. Press pastry into mini-muffin pans. Coarsely chop pears and put a few chunks into center of each pastry square. Cut curved crust off of cheese, and discard. Cut cheese into small pieces, then put one piece into each pastry square. Top each square with 3-4 cranberries. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Serve warm.

raw_meal: In a food processor, pulse cranberries until finely ground. Transfer to a large mixing
bowl and combine with sugar and wine. Stir until sugar dissolves. Pour mixture into
clean canning jars and top with lid. Refrigerate for 22 days, then strain liqueur from
cranberries. Use cranberries over ice cream and liquor as an aperitif.
CRANBERRY CASSIS.title: CRANBERRY CASSIS
CRANBERRY CASSIS.instructions: In a food processor, pulse cranberries until finely ground. Transfer to a large mixing bowl and combine with sugar and wine. Stir until sugar dissolves. Pour mixture into clean canning jars and top with lid. Refrigerate for 22 days, then strain liqueur from cranberries. Use cranberries over ice cream and liquor as an aperitif.

raw_meal: Pour the herbs into a tall salad dressing cruet with lid or empty olive oil bottle with
cork. Fill the bottle up 1/4 of the way with the balsamic vinegar. Let herbs stand in
vinegar for 1/2 hour or longer. Fill the cruet or bottle the rest of the way with the olive
oil. To serve, shake well and pour around 1/4 cup into a small saucer or dipping bowl
and dip with French bread. Additional herbs, salt, pepper, garlic powder or more
vinegar may be added, if desired.
DIPPING OIL.title: DIPPING OIL
ingredients: 1 T. Herbs de Provence or Italian herbs
DIPPING OIL.instructions: Pour the herbs into a tall salad dressing cruet with lid or empty olive oil bottle with cork. Fill the bottle up 1/4 of the way with the balsamic vinegar. Let herbs stand in vinegar for 1/2 hour or longer. Fill the cruet or bottle the rest of the way with the olive oil. To serve, shake well and pour around 1/4 cup into a small saucer or dipping bowl and dip with French bread. Additional herbs, salt, pepper, garlic powder or more vinegar may be added, if desired.

raw_meal: Unfold the filo sheets and cut into strips about two inches wide. Cover with a clean
towel while preparing the cheese. In a mixing bowl mix the feta and cream cheeses
(cheeses should be room temperature). Add the egg and parsley. Beat with a mixer on
medium speed for about 3 minutes or until smooth. Place one teaspoonful of cheese
mixture on the end of one filo strip. Fold into a triangle shape, brushing with a little
melted butter every two or three folds. Place on a baking sheet and brush the top with
melted butter. Repeat until all the cheese and filo strips are done. Bake on at 350
degrees until pastry is puffed and beginning to brown, about 15 minutes (watch
carefully).
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE.title: FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pastry)
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE.instructions: Unfold the filo sheets and cut into strips about two inches wide. Cover with a clean towel while preparing the cheese. In a mixing bowl mix the feta and cream cheeses (cheeses should be room temperature). Add the egg and parsley. Beat with a mixer on medium speed for about 3 minutes or until smooth. Place one teaspoonful of cheese mixture on the end of one filo strip. Fold into a triangle shape, brushing with a little melted butter every two or three folds. Place on a baking sheet and brush the top with melted butter. Repeat until all the cheese and filo strips are done. Bake on at 350 degrees until pastry is puffed and beginning to brown, about 15 minutes (watch carefully).

raw_meal: In a sauce pan, melt the butter on medium-low heat. Mix in the flour and stir well
until smooth. Add the milk, salt and pepper and stir well for 2-3 minutes. Mix in the
spinach and eggs and cook on medium heat, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes.
Take off the heat and mix in the feta and cottage cheeses. Lay out the filo dough
sheets and cut lengthwise into strips about 3 inches wide. Take two of the strips and
place about 2 tablespoons of the cheese mix onto the edge of the filo. Fold into a
triangle shape, brushing the top with melted butter every 2 - 3 folds. Place on a baking
sheet and brush the top with butter. Repeat until all of the filo and cheese is used.
Bake at 350 degrees until pastry is puffed and beginning to brown, about 15 minutes
(watch carefully).
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE AND SPINACH.title: FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE AND SPINACH
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE AND SPINACH.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pastry)
FILO TRIANGLES WITH CHEESE AND SPINACH.instructions: In a sauce pan, melt the butter on medium-low heat. Mix in the flour and stir well until smooth. Add the milk, salt and pepper and stir well for 2-3 minutes. Mix in the spinach and eggs and cook on medium heat, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes. Take off the heat and mix in the feta and cottage cheeses. Lay out the filo dough sheets and cut lengthwise into strips about 3 inches wide. Take two of the strips and place about 2 tablespoons of the cheese mix onto the edge of the filo. Fold into a triangle shape, brushing the top with melted butter every 2 - 3 folds. Place on a baking sheet and brush the top with butter. Repeat until all of the filo and cheese is used. Bake at 350 degrees until pastry is puffed and beginning to brown, about 15 minutes (watch carefully).

raw_meal: Peel off half of the filo sheets and layer into the bottom of a rectangular baking pan,
brushing melted butter over every fourth sheet. In a mixing bowl, fold together all the
cheeses and lightly beaten egg yolks. Spread the cheese and egg mixture over the filo
in the pan. Top the mixture with the rest of the filo sheets, buttering every fourth
sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until light golden brown. Do not
over bake. Cut while hot into small squares. (An electric or serrated knife works best.)
Whisking constantly, heat the chocolate milk but do not boil. Stir in the vanilla and
pour the chocolate into mugs. Top with a dash of cinnamon and mini marshmallows,
if desired.
FILO WITH CHEESE.title: FILO WITH CHEESE
FILO WITH CHEESE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Baked Pastry)
FILO WITH CHEESE.instructions: Peel off half of the filo sheets and layer into the bottom of a rectangular baking pan, brushing melted butter over every fourth sheet. In a mixing bowl, fold together all the cheeses and lightly beaten egg yolks. Spread the cheese and egg mixture over the filo in the pan. Top the mixture with the rest of the filo sheets, buttering every fourth sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until light golden brown. Do not over bake. Cut while hot into small squares. (An electric or serrated knife works best.) Whisking constantly, heat the chocolate milk but do not boil. Stir in the vanilla and pour the chocolate into mugs. Top with a dash of cinnamon and mini marshmallows, if desired.

raw_meal: Brown and crumble the ground beef, adding salt and pepper to taste. Remove the fat
and set meat aside to cool. Brown the onion in a little butter and add to the meat. Add
the cheese to the meat on very low heat and mix it in really well, stirring frequently.
Unfold the filo sheets and place half of the sheets in the bottom of a rectangular 15 x
10 baking pan, buttering every fourth sheet. Spread the cream cheese & meat mixture
carefully over the filo. Cover the meat & cheese with the remaining filo sheets,
buttering every fourth sheet. In a small bowl, add the egg and milk and beat lightly,
then set aside. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 30 to 45 minutes. When filo just
begins to brown, remove from oven. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the hot filo.
Return the pan to the oven and bake until golden brown. Cut while hot into diamond
shapes using a sharp serrated or electric knife.
FILO WITH MEAT AND CHEESE.title: FILO WITH MEAT AND CHEESE
FILO WITH MEAT AND CHEESE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Meat and Pastry)
FILO WITH MEAT AND CHEESE.instructions: Brown and crumble the ground beef, adding salt and pepper to taste. Remove the fat and set meat aside to cool. Brown the onion in a little butter and add to the meat. Add the cheese to the meat on very low heat and mix it in really well, stirring frequently. Unfold the filo sheets and place half of the sheets in the bottom of a rectangular 15 x 10 baking pan, buttering every fourth sheet. Spread the cream cheese & meat mixture carefully over the filo. Cover the meat & cheese with the remaining filo sheets, buttering every fourth sheet. In a small bowl, add the egg and milk and beat lightly, then set aside. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 30 to 45 minutes. When filo just begins to brown, remove from oven. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the hot filo. Return the pan to the oven and bake until golden brown. Cut while hot into diamond shapes using a sharp serrated or electric knife.

raw_meal: In a food processor blend the chick peas until very smooth. Add the tahini paste,
water, parsley, garlic, lime, salt and pepper and blend until well mixed and smooth. If
too thick add a little water. To serve, pour mixture onto a dinner plate or deep serving
dish and drizzle with a little extra virgin olive oil. Serve with pita bread cut into
triangles (toasted if desired).
HUMMUS.title: HUMMUS
HUMMUS.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Chick Pea Dip)
HUMMUS.instructions: In a food processor blend the chick peas until very smooth. Add the tahini paste, water, parsley, garlic, lime, salt and pepper and blend until well mixed and smooth. If too thick add a little water. To serve, pour mixture onto a dinner plate or deep serving dish and drizzle with a little extra virgin olive oil. Serve with pita bread cut into triangles (toasted if desired).

raw_meal: In a large punch bowl, mix all ingredients in the order given. Makes 5 gallons.
ICE CREAM PUNCH.title: ICE CREAM PUNCH
ICE CREAM PUNCH.instructions: In a large punch bowl, mix all ingredients in the order given. Makes 5 gallons.

raw_meal: 1 can artichoke hearts (in water), chopped 3/4 c. parmesan cheese, grated
In a medium baking dish, mix all ingredients together. Bake in a 350 degree oven for
20-30 minutes until hot and bubbly. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.
HOT ARTICHOKE DIP.title: HOT ARTICHOKE DIP
ingredients: 1 c. light mayonnaise (or half mayo and
HOT ARTICHOKE DIP.instructions: 1 can artichoke hearts (in water), chopped 3/4 c. parmesan cheese, grated In a medium baking dish, mix all ingredients together. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-30 minutes until hot and bubbly. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.

raw_meal: Mix all ingredients in blender until chopped to desired consistency (large or small
chuncks). Serve with tortilla chips or as a side dish.
SALSA CRUDA.title: SALSA CRUDA
SALSA CRUDA.instructions: Mix all ingredients in blender until chopped to desired consistency (large or small chuncks). Serve with tortilla chips or as a side dish.

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan, stir together the cocoa, brown sugar, salt, and water over low
heat until mixture is a thick paste. In a separate sauce pan, heat the milk until just
about to boil, then remove from heat and add a little at a time to the cocoa mixture.
HOT CHOCOLATE.title: HOT CHOCOLATE
HOT CHOCOLATE.instructions: In a medium sauce pan, stir together the cocoa, brown sugar, salt, and water over low heat until mixture is a thick paste. In a separate sauce pan, heat the milk until just about to boil, then remove from heat and add a little at a time to the cocoa mixture.

raw_meal: Heat the soup from the can (do not add water) and stir in the cream cheese until
completely dissolved. Stir and mix until smooth. In a small bowl, dissolve gelatin in
about 2 T. water. Mix all ingredients together. Pour into Jello mold or flat baking
dish. Refrigerate overnight. Invert the mold onto a serving plate. Serve with crackers
or baguette slices.
half of the tortilla. Top with about 1/2 c. of the green mixture, spread over the cheese.
Fold the other half of the tortilla over the greens and cook until slightly browned on
the bottom. Turn over and brown the other side. Remove from heat and cut into four
pie-shaped wedges. Serve with sour cream and salsa. Vegetarian variation: Substitute
avocado slices for cheese and use margarine or oil instead of butter.
SHRIMP DIP.title: SHRIMP DIP
SHRIMP DIP.instructions: Heat the soup from the can (do not add water) and stir in the cream cheese until completely dissolved. Stir and mix until smooth. In a small bowl, dissolve gelatin in about 2 T. water. Mix all ingredients together. Pour into Jello mold or flat baking dish. Refrigerate overnight. Invert the mold onto a serving plate. Serve with crackers or baguette slices. half of the tortilla. Top with about 1/2 c. of the green mixture, spread over the cheese. Fold the other half of the tortilla over the greens and cook until slightly browned on the bottom. Turn over and brown the other side. Remove from heat and cut into four pie-shaped wedges. Serve with sour cream and salsa. Vegetarian variation: Substitute avocado slices for cheese and use margarine or oil instead of butter.

raw_meal: Thaw the spinach. Blend the soup mix and sour cream until soup is dissolved. Mix
together all ingredients. Prepare the dipping bowl by cutting off the top third of the
loaf of bread and hollowing out most of the bread. Chop up the bread into cubes. Pour
the spinach dip into the hollowed out loaf. Cut an additional baguette or french bread
load if more bread cubes are needed.
SPINACH DIP.title: SPINACH DIP
SPINACH DIP.instructions: Thaw the spinach. Blend the soup mix and sour cream until soup is dissolved. Mix together all ingredients. Prepare the dipping bowl by cutting off the top third of the loaf of bread and hollowing out most of the bread. Chop up the bread into cubes. Pour the spinach dip into the hollowed out loaf. Cut an additional baguette or french bread load if more bread cubes are needed.

raw_meal: Combine all ingredients in a food processor and mix for about one minute. If too
thick, add a little more water or lime juice. Pour mixture onto a platter and garnish
with a little chopped parsley. Serve well chilled. Use as a dip with pita bread cut into
triangles (toasted, if desired).
TAHINI DIP.title: TAHINI DIP
TAHINI DIP.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Sesame Dip)
TAHINI DIP.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor and mix for about one minute. If too thick, add a little more water or lime juice. Pour mixture onto a platter and garnish with a little chopped parsley. Serve well chilled. Use as a dip with pita bread cut into triangles (toasted, if desired).

raw_meal: Prepare the greens by washing and stripping off any hard stems. Steam in a small
amount of boiling water for 2-3 minutes, or until tender but not fully cooked. Remove
from heat and drain well. When cooled, chop the greens into 1 inch pieces, removing
any excess water. Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan and add the mushrooms and
onions. Cook until tender and slightly browned, then add the greens. Saute on
medium heat until greens and vegetables are well incorporated, about 5 minutes. On a
griddle or in a large flat saute pan, on medium heat, melt a little bit of the butter and
place the flour tortilla on the butter. Add 4-5 cheese slices evenly spaced over one
VEGETABLE QUESADILLA.title: VEGETABLE QUESADILLA
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, collard greens, spinach or
1 tsp. butter, margarine or olive oil
slices cheddar or monterey jack cheese
VEGETABLE QUESADILLA.instructions: Prepare the greens by washing and stripping off any hard stems. Steam in a small amount of boiling water for 2-3 minutes, or until tender but not fully cooked. Remove from heat and drain well. When cooled, chop the greens into 1 inch pieces, removing any excess water. Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan and add the mushrooms and onions. Cook until tender and slightly browned, then add the greens. Saute on medium heat until greens and vegetables are well incorporated, about 5 minutes. On a griddle or in a large flat saute pan, on medium heat, melt a little bit of the butter and place the flour tortilla on the butter. Add 4-5 cheese slices evenly spaced over one

raw_meal: Wash and dry the arugula leaves. To prepare the marinade for the shrimp: heat a small
saute pan and add the 3 T. oil, pepperoncini and chopped garlic. Saute for 2-3 minutes
on medium and then pour over the clean shrimp. Marinate for 1/2 hour or so. To make
the salad dressing: whisk together the lemon and salt, then the 1/3 c. olive oil until
emulsified. In a large salad bowl, place the arugula leaves, the sliced mushrooms, and
the parmesan (use a vegetable peeler to make small curls of cheese or use a grater
with the largest holes). Heat a grill and brush with a little oil. Place the shrimp on the
heated grill for 1-2 minutes then turn once. Cook for another minute or two then
remove from heat. Place the grilled shrimp on top of the arugula salad, pour over the
dresssing and serve immediately. Vegetarian variation: Omit the cheese.
ARUGULA AND GRILLED SHRIMP SALAD.title: ARUGULA AND GRILLED SHRIMP SALAD
ARUGULA AND GRILLED SHRIMP SALAD.instructions: Wash and dry the arugula leaves. To prepare the marinade for the shrimp: heat a small saute pan and add the 3 T. oil, pepperoncini and chopped garlic. Saute for 2-3 minutes on medium and then pour over the clean shrimp. Marinate for 1/2 hour or so. To make the salad dressing: whisk together the lemon and salt, then the 1/3 c. olive oil until emulsified. In a large salad bowl, place the arugula leaves, the sliced mushrooms, and the parmesan (use a vegetable peeler to make small curls of cheese or use a grater with the largest holes). Heat a grill and brush with a little oil. Place the shrimp on the heated grill for 1-2 minutes then turn once. Cook for another minute or two then remove from heat. Place the grilled shrimp on top of the arugula salad, pour over the dresssing and serve immediately. Vegetarian variation: Omit the cheese.

raw_meal: In a sauce pan, bring the lentils to a boil in the water. Cook the lentils on medium
until very soft, adding more water if needed. Remove from heat and cool. Push lentils
through a strainer then add 2 cups of soup or water. In a saute pan heat the oil and
brown the onions. Add the lentil mixture to the onions and season with salt, pepper
and cumin. Serve the lentils with a salad of fresh chopped tomatoes mixed with a little
fresh chopped garlic, or toast small triangles of pita bread and place lentils on top,
adding a squeeze of lemon.
ATTSATTSATTSATTS.title: ATTS
ATTSATTSATTSATTS.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Brown Lentils)
ATTSATTSATTSATTS.instructions: In a sauce pan, bring the lentils to a boil in the water. Cook the lentils on medium until very soft, adding more water if needed. Remove from heat and cool. Push lentils through a strainer then add 2 cups of soup or water. In a saute pan heat the oil and brown the onions. Add the lentil mixture to the onions and season with salt, pepper and cumin. Serve the lentils with a salad of fresh chopped tomatoes mixed with a little fresh chopped garlic, or toast small triangles of pita bread and place lentils on top, adding a squeeze of lemon.

raw_meal: Precook the squash in the microwave for 10 minutes, cool and remove skins. In a
large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in onions and garlic. Cook and stir until
lightly brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in carrots and celery. Cook until tender, about 5
minutes. Stir in squash and chicken broth, saving 1/4 c. broth for preparing jalapeno
sauce. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat and simmer 30 to 45 minutes, or until
vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Blend with an emersion
blender until smooth, or working in small batches, transfer mixture to a blender or
food processor and process until smooth. Return pureed soup to pot. Season to taste
with salt and pepper. Add 2 to 3 T. jalapeno sauce to soup and add 2 cups
half-and-half and reheat but do no boil. To make jalapeno sauce: Roast the peppers
over a flame on stove or under broiler until skins blacken evenly. Let cool. Peel off
black skin and remove core and seeds. Chop coarsely. In food processor blender,
puree peppers, adding 1/4 cup chicken stock until sauce consistency is obtained.
Vegetarian variation: Use vegetable stock and substitute a non-dairy cream for the
half-and-half.
BUTTERNUT SQUASH JALAPENO SOUP.title: BUTTERNUT SQUASH JALAPENO SOUP
BUTTERNUT SQUASH JALAPENO SOUP.instructions: Precook the squash in the microwave for 10 minutes, cool and remove skins. In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in onions and garlic. Cook and stir until lightly brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in carrots and celery. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in squash and chicken broth, saving 1/4 c. broth for preparing jalapeno sauce. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat and simmer 30 to 45 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Blend with an emersion blender until smooth, or working in small batches, transfer mixture to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Return pureed soup to pot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add 2 to 3 T. jalapeno sauce to soup and add 2 cups half-and-half and reheat but do no boil. To make jalapeno sauce: Roast the peppers over a flame on stove or under broiler until skins blacken evenly. Let cool. Peel off black skin and remove core and seeds. Chop coarsely. In food processor blender, puree peppers, adding 1/4 cup chicken stock until sauce consistency is obtained. Vegetarian variation: Use vegetable stock and substitute a non-dairy cream for the half-and-half.

raw_meal: In a large sauce pan over medium heat, cook the shallots in the butter until soft and
translucent. Add the carrots, broth, coriander, salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Turn
down to medium and let simmer 15 minutes, stirring every few minutes, until carrots
are soft. Transfer soup to a blender and puree the mixture. Pour pureed soup back into
sauce pan and let cool for 5 minutes. Add 1/3 c. sour cream and whisk until smooth.
Heat the soup on medium and serve immediately. Add a small spoon of sour cream to
each bowl and sprinkle with parsley to garnish.
CARROT SOUP.title: CARROT SOUP
ingredients: 1/3 c. sour cream, plus 2 T. for garnish
CARROT SOUP.instructions: In a large sauce pan over medium heat, cook the shallots in the butter until soft and translucent. Add the carrots, broth, coriander, salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Turn down to medium and let simmer 15 minutes, stirring every few minutes, until carrots are soft. Transfer soup to a blender and puree the mixture. Pour pureed soup back into sauce pan and let cool for 5 minutes. Add 1/3 c. sour cream and whisk until smooth. Heat the soup on medium and serve immediately. Add a small spoon of sour cream to each bowl and sprinkle with parsley to garnish.

raw_meal: Heat the grill and brush with a little olive oil. Pat the chicken dry and coat with 1 T.
oil, then sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper. Grill the chicken, turning over once
until cooked through, 14-16 minutes. In a blender, add the garlic, lemon juice,
mustard, anchovy and remaining salt and pepper and blend until smooth. While
running, stream in the olive oil until emulsified. Cool the chicken slightly, then cut
into 1/2 inch thick slices. Toss chicken in 2 T. of the dressing then add the lettuce and
the remaining dressing, cheese and croutons. To make croutons: Cut 4-5 slices of
Italian bread into 1/2-inch cubes and place on a flat baking sheet. Bake in a 350
degree oven for 8-10 minutes, or until bread is dried and slightly brown. Heat the
olive oil and 2 cloves of mashed garlic in a small pan. Remove from heat and pour
over the baked croutons. Mix to cover evenly and toss with salad.
Grind the dried porcini in a blender until powdery. Cook the onion in 1 T. of butter in
a 4-5 quart heavy pot, covered over medium heat, stirring, about 5 minutes. Add the
fresh mushrooms, porcini powder, salt, herbs, and pepper and cook about 5 minutes.
Add remaining butter, melt then sprinkle in flour and cook until thick and golden,
about 5 minutes. Whisk 1 c. broth until soup is smooth. Add remaining broth in a
small stream until smooth. Simmer; whisk in cream and sherry and simmer,
uncovered about 10 minutes. Garnish with chopped scallions and thinly sliced fresh
mushrooms.
CHICKEN CAESAR SALAD.title: CHICKEN CAESAR SALAD
CHICKEN CAESAR SALAD.instructions: Heat the grill and brush with a little olive oil. Pat the chicken dry and coat with 1 T. oil, then sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper. Grill the chicken, turning over once until cooked through, 14-16 minutes. In a blender, add the garlic, lemon juice, mustard, anchovy and remaining salt and pepper and blend until smooth. While running, stream in the olive oil until emulsified. Cool the chicken slightly, then cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. Toss chicken in 2 T. of the dressing then add the lettuce and the remaining dressing, cheese and croutons. To make croutons: Cut 4-5 slices of Italian bread into 1/2-inch cubes and place on a flat baking sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 8-10 minutes, or until bread is dried and slightly brown. Heat the olive oil and 2 cloves of mashed garlic in a small pan. Remove from heat and pour over the baked croutons. Mix to cover evenly and toss with salad. Grind the dried porcini in a blender until powdery. Cook the onion in 1 T. of butter in a 4-5 quart heavy pot, covered over medium heat, stirring, about 5 minutes. Add the fresh mushrooms, porcini powder, salt, herbs, and pepper and cook about 5 minutes. Add remaining butter, melt then sprinkle in flour and cook until thick and golden, about 5 minutes. Whisk 1 c. broth until soup is smooth. Add remaining broth in a small stream until smooth. Simmer; whisk in cream and sherry and simmer, uncovered about 10 minutes. Garnish with chopped scallions and thinly sliced fresh mushrooms.

raw_meal: In a large saucepan, combine the cauliflower, onion, celery, lemon juice, nutmeg and
stock. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer until quite soft. Place mixture in a blender or
food processor and mix until very smooth.
In a saucepan, make the roux by melting the butter and adding the flour. Stir and cook
on medium for about 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Keeping the heat low,
mix in the milk, beating with a wire whisk to prevent lumps. Add the vegetable
mixture, stirring constantly with the whisk. Let the soup cook on low heat until just
barely boiling, about 10 minutes. In a separate saucepan, heat 1 cup of heavy cream.
Add to the soup just before serving. Sprinkle the top of each bowl with a little parsley
or chopped chives.
CREAM OF CAULIFLOWER SOUP.title: CREAM OF CAULIFLOWER SOUP
CREAM OF CAULIFLOWER SOUP.instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the cauliflower, onion, celery, lemon juice, nutmeg and stock. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer until quite soft. Place mixture in a blender or food processor and mix until very smooth. In a saucepan, make the roux by melting the butter and adding the flour. Stir and cook on medium for about 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Keeping the heat low, mix in the milk, beating with a wire whisk to prevent lumps. Add the vegetable mixture, stirring constantly with the whisk. Let the soup cook on low heat until just barely boiling, about 10 minutes. In a separate saucepan, heat 1 cup of heavy cream. Add to the soup just before serving. Sprinkle the top of each bowl with a little parsley or chopped chives.

CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP.title: CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP
CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP.instructions: Grind the dried porcini in a blender until powdery. Cook the onion in 1 T. of butter in a 4-5 quart heavy pot, covered over medium heat, stirring, about 5 minutes. Add the fresh mushrooms, porcini powder, salt, herbs, and pepper and cook about 5 minutes. Add remaining butter, melt then sprinkle in flour and cook until thick and golden, about 5 minutes. Whisk 1 c. broth until soup is smooth. Add remaining broth in a small stream until smooth. Simmer; whisk in cream and sherry and simmer, uncovered about 10 minutes. Garnish with chopped scallions and thinly sliced fresh mushrooms.

raw_meal: Mix the yogurt, sour cream, mint leaves, salt and garlic. Add the cucumbers to the
yogurt mixture and stir to cover well. Chill until ready to serve.
CUCUMBER AND YOGURT SALAD.title: CUCUMBER AND YOGURT SALAD
CUCUMBER AND YOGURT SALAD.instructions: Mix the yogurt, sour cream, mint leaves, salt and garlic. Add the cucumbers to the yogurt mixture and stir to cover well. Chill until ready to serve.

raw_meal: Thinly slice cucumbers and in a large salad bowl, add onions and lemon juice. Season
with salt and pepper and marinate for a few hours. Drain the liquid. Mix in the sour
cream and sprinkle with dill or parsley, if desired.
CUCUMBERS IN SOUR CREAM.title: CUCUMBERS IN SOUR CREAM
CUCUMBERS IN SOUR CREAM.instructions: Thinly slice cucumbers and in a large salad bowl, add onions and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper and marinate for a few hours. Drain the liquid. Mix in the sour cream and sprinkle with dill or parsley, if desired.

raw_meal: In a small bowl, mix all ingredients except oil. With a wire whisk, slowly pour the oil
into the bowl and whisk several minutes. Set aside to add to salad before serving.
Place all the vegetables in a large salad bowl. Cut the bread in half or quarters and
separate layers. Place directly on oven rack and bake at 300 degrees for 5 - 10
minutes, until bread is golden and crispy. Break bread into bite-size pieces. When
ready to serve, pour dressing over salad and toss. If desired, fold bread pieces into
salad or serve on the side.
FATTOUSH.title: FATTOUSH
FATTOUSH.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Fresh Vegetable Salad)
ingredients: 1/4 c. fresh mint, finely chopped or,
FATTOUSH.instructions: In a small bowl, mix all ingredients except oil. With a wire whisk, slowly pour the oil into the bowl and whisk several minutes. Set aside to add to salad before serving. Place all the vegetables in a large salad bowl. Cut the bread in half or quarters and separate layers. Place directly on oven rack and bake at 300 degrees for 5 - 10 minutes, until bread is golden and crispy. Break bread into bite-size pieces. When ready to serve, pour dressing over salad and toss. If desired, fold bread pieces into salad or serve on the side.

raw_meal: Saute the onions in the butter and oil until golden brown. Transfer the onions to a
crockpot, leaving the fat in frying pan. Stir the flour into the oil on medium heat for
2-3 minutes, then add the beef broth to make a thin sauce. (Whisk a bit to remove
most of the lumps.) Pour the broth and flour mixture over the onions in the crockpot.
Add the salt and pepper to the crockpot (adjust amount of salt if the beef broth is very
salty--you can add the salt at the end testing the soup before adding). In a clean, small
sauce pan add the sugar and cook on high heat stirring frequently. When the sugar
melts, let it brown to a golden or dark brown color, being careful that it does not burn.
Add the hot water to the sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves in the water. Add the
browned sugar water to the crockpot. Cover and cook on the low setting for 6-8 hours,
then on high for 3-4 hours. When ready to serve, test for salt before putting in bowls.
On a cookie sheet, place the baguette slices with a little cheese on each one and broil
a few minutes until bubbly and golden brown. To serve, put one slice of the cheesy
baguette in each bowl and spoon the soup over to fill the bowl.
FRENCH ONION SOUP.title: FRENCH ONION SOUP
FRENCH ONION SOUP.subtitle: (For the Crockpot)
FRENCH ONION SOUP.instructions: Saute the onions in the butter and oil until golden brown. Transfer the onions to a crockpot, leaving the fat in frying pan. Stir the flour into the oil on medium heat for 2-3 minutes, then add the beef broth to make a thin sauce. (Whisk a bit to remove most of the lumps.) Pour the broth and flour mixture over the onions in the crockpot. Add the salt and pepper to the crockpot (adjust amount of salt if the beef broth is very salty--you can add the salt at the end testing the soup before adding). In a clean, small sauce pan add the sugar and cook on high heat stirring frequently. When the sugar melts, let it brown to a golden or dark brown color, being careful that it does not burn. Add the hot water to the sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves in the water. Add the browned sugar water to the crockpot. Cover and cook on the low setting for 6-8 hours, then on high for 3-4 hours. When ready to serve, test for salt before putting in bowls. On a cookie sheet, place the baguette slices with a little cheese on each one and broil a few minutes until bubbly and golden brown. To serve, put one slice of the cheesy baguette in each bowl and spoon the soup over to fill the bowl.

raw_meal: In a large heavy pot, cook the onions, thyme, bay and salt in butter over medium heat
uncovered stirring frequently for about 45 minutes, or until onions are very soft and
deep golden brown. Add the flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in the wine
and cook 2 minutes. Stir in the broth, water and pepper and simmer about 30 minutes.
If soup gets too thick, add a little water. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. On a large
baking sheet arrange bread slices and toast, turning over once, about 15 minutes.
Remove the toast from oven and preheat broiler. Put oven-proof crocks (or soup
bowls) in a shallow baking pan. Remove the thyme and bay from the soup and spoon
into the crocks. Put one piece of toast in the middle of each crock. Place 2-3 of the
cheese slices on top of each crock letting some hang over the edges. Sprinkle with
parmesan cheese. Broil 4-5 inches from heat for 1-2 minutes.
FRENCH ONION SOUP #2.title: FRENCH ONION SOUP #2
FRENCH ONION SOUP #2.subtitle: (Classic)
FRENCH ONION SOUP #2.instructions: In a large heavy pot, cook the onions, thyme, bay and salt in butter over medium heat uncovered stirring frequently for about 45 minutes, or until onions are very soft and deep golden brown. Add the flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in the wine and cook 2 minutes. Stir in the broth, water and pepper and simmer about 30 minutes. If soup gets too thick, add a little water. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. On a large baking sheet arrange bread slices and toast, turning over once, about 15 minutes. Remove the toast from oven and preheat broiler. Put oven-proof crocks (or soup bowls) in a shallow baking pan. Remove the thyme and bay from the soup and spoon into the crocks. Put one piece of toast in the middle of each crock. Place 2-3 of the cheese slices on top of each crock letting some hang over the edges. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Broil 4-5 inches from heat for 1-2 minutes.

raw_meal: In a large saucepan simmer the potatoes, leeks, chicken stock, salt and pepper
partially covered for 45-50 minutes. Force the soup through a sieve or process in a
food processor for a few minutes until smooth, then return to saucepan. Check
seasoning, add cream and stir until blended. Before serving, bring to a simmer. Serve
with a pinch of chives or parsley in each bowl. Vegetarian variation: Use the
vegetable stock and omit the heavy cream or substitue with non-dairy cream.
LEEK AND POTATO SOUP.title: LEEK AND POTATO SOUP
ingredients: 3 c. leeks, thoroughly cleaned and sliced
LEEK AND POTATO SOUP.instructions: In a large saucepan simmer the potatoes, leeks, chicken stock, salt and pepper partially covered for 45-50 minutes. Force the soup through a sieve or process in a food processor for a few minutes until smooth, then return to saucepan. Check seasoning, add cream and stir until blended. Before serving, bring to a simmer. Serve with a pinch of chives or parsley in each bowl. Vegetarian variation: Use the vegetable stock and omit the heavy cream or substitue with non-dairy cream.

raw_meal: Saute the green pepper strips in a small amount of oil. Cook pasta according to the
package directions, drain. Combine the vegetables, pasta and cheese. Make dressing
by combining all ingredients in a jar and shake. Add dressing to pasta salad. Serve
warm or chilled. Vegetarian variation: Omit cheese.
MEDITERRANEAN PASTA SALAD.title: MEDITERRANEAN PASTA SALAD
ingredients: 2 large green peppers, sliced into strips
MEDITERRANEAN PASTA SALAD.instructions: Saute the green pepper strips in a small amount of oil. Cook pasta according to the package directions, drain. Combine the vegetables, pasta and cheese. Make dressing by combining all ingredients in a jar and shake. Add dressing to pasta salad. Serve warm or chilled. Vegetarian variation: Omit cheese.

raw_meal: Make the beef stock by bringing the meat, water, onion, cardamom pods, salt, pepper,
and bullion to a boil. Turn the heat down to low, cover the pot and let it simmer for 30
to 45 minutes (or longer if desired). Meanwhile, prepare the mouluhea leaves. If fresh,
pick the leaves off the stems and wash and dry thoroughly. Place a handful of leaves
into a food processor and pulse for 4-5 seconds, just until the leaves are finely
chopped but not pureed. Process all the leaves and place in a bowl until soup is ready.
If the mouluhea is frozen, defrost and reserve until soup is ready. When the meat is
done, remove from the stock and keep warm in a covered bowl on the side. Remove
the onion and cardamom pods from the soup stock. In a small frying pan, melt the
butter and saute the garlic just until tender (do not brown or garlic will be bitter).
Crushed garlic may be added directly to soup without frying, if desired. Add the
garlic to the soup and cook for 5 more minutes. Take the soup off the fire and add the
fresh chopped mouluhea leaves. The heat from the soup will cook the leaves. If using
frozen leaves, let them cook for three or four more minutes before removing from the
fire. Serve immediately. Note: Frozen, chopped Mouluhea can be found in Middle
Eastern food stores and is sometimes called Jews Mellow (be sure to buy the chopped
or minced). It may be found in some Asian markets and is called "Salluot." The leaves
resemble the size and shape of fresh basil leaves.
MOULUHEA.title: MOULUHEA
MOULUHEA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Green Leaf Soup)
ingredients: 1 pkg. frozen mouluhea (if fresh is not
MOULUHEA.instructions: Make the beef stock by bringing the meat, water, onion, cardamom pods, salt, pepper, and bullion to a boil. Turn the heat down to low, cover the pot and let it simmer for 30 to 45 minutes (or longer if desired). Meanwhile, prepare the mouluhea leaves. If fresh, pick the leaves off the stems and wash and dry thoroughly. Place a handful of leaves into a food processor and pulse for 4-5 seconds, just until the leaves are finely chopped but not pureed. Process all the leaves and place in a bowl until soup is ready. If the mouluhea is frozen, defrost and reserve until soup is ready. When the meat is done, remove from the stock and keep warm in a covered bowl on the side. Remove the onion and cardamom pods from the soup stock. In a small frying pan, melt the butter and saute the garlic just until tender (do not brown or garlic will be bitter). Crushed garlic may be added directly to soup without frying, if desired. Add the garlic to the soup and cook for 5 more minutes. Take the soup off the fire and add the fresh chopped mouluhea leaves. The heat from the soup will cook the leaves. If using frozen leaves, let them cook for three or four more minutes before removing from the fire. Serve immediately. Note: Frozen, chopped Mouluhea can be found in Middle Eastern food stores and is sometimes called Jews Mellow (be sure to buy the chopped or minced). It may be found in some Asian markets and is called "Salluot." The leaves resemble the size and shape of fresh basil leaves.

raw_meal: In a food processor or blender, pulse the basil, pine nuts, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix
until smooth. While machine is running, add a fine stream of olive oil until mix
becomes emulsified and thick. (Do not add too much oil as it will separate and
become oily.) Mix a few more seconds. Transfer to mixing bowl and stir in the
parmesan. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until salad is ready.
Bring a full pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 6-8 minutes or until
al dente. Remove pasta from hot water and let cool. In a large salad bowl, add the
pasta and the remaining ingredients and mix. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of the pesto
sauce to the pasta and stir. Serve cold. Vegetarian variation: Omit mayonnaise.
PESTO PASTA SALAD.title: PESTO PASTA SALAD
ingredients: 3 c. fresh basil leaves, stemmed and clean
1 lb. macaroni, rotini or other pasta
PESTO PASTA SALAD.instructions: In a food processor or blender, pulse the basil, pine nuts, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix until smooth. While machine is running, add a fine stream of olive oil until mix becomes emulsified and thick. (Do not add too much oil as it will separate and become oily.) Mix a few more seconds. Transfer to mixing bowl and stir in the parmesan. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until salad is ready. Bring a full pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 6-8 minutes or until al dente. Remove pasta from hot water and let cool. In a large salad bowl, add the pasta and the remaining ingredients and mix. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of the pesto sauce to the pasta and stir. Serve cold. Vegetarian variation: Omit mayonnaise.

raw_meal: Peel and chop the potatoes into pieces. Boil until soft. In a large bowl, mash the
potatoes (leaving some large chunks). Add the onions, parsley, oil, cumin, garlic
powder, vinegar, lime or lemon juice, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place in a serving
bowl, smoothing the top flat. Garnish with olives, egg slices, and a little fresh parsley.
Vegetarian variation: Omit eggs.
POTATO SALAD.title: POTATO SALAD
POTATO SALAD.instructions: Peel and chop the potatoes into pieces. Boil until soft. In a large bowl, mash the potatoes (leaving some large chunks). Add the onions, parsley, oil, cumin, garlic powder, vinegar, lime or lemon juice, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place in a serving bowl, smoothing the top flat. Garnish with olives, egg slices, and a little fresh parsley. Vegetarian variation: Omit eggs.

raw_meal: Wash the turkey thoroughly, inside and out. Place giblets inside turkey. Sprinkle with
salt and pepper. Place turkey in large stock pot. Add water to cover turkey plus 1 inch.
Add the cardamom, bullion, and onion. Bring soup to a boil. Turn down and simmer
on medium for 15 minutes. Turn turkey over in pot, and simmer for 15 more minutes.
Remove the turkey, set aside and keep warm until ready to serve. Remove cardamom
pods and onion. Use turkey stock for Feta (bread side dish).
SHORBA DIKRUMI.title: SHORBA DIKRUMI
SHORBA DIKRUMI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Turkey Soup Stock)
SHORBA DIKRUMI.instructions: Wash the turkey thoroughly, inside and out. Place giblets inside turkey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place turkey in large stock pot. Add water to cover turkey plus 1 inch. Add the cardamom, bullion, and onion. Bring soup to a boil. Turn down and simmer on medium for 15 minutes. Turn turkey over in pot, and simmer for 15 more minutes. Remove the turkey, set aside and keep warm until ready to serve. Remove cardamom pods and onion. Use turkey stock for Feta (bread side dish).

raw_meal: Bring the chicken, water, onion, bouillon, cardamom pods, salt and pepper to a boil.
Cover and reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 35-45 minutes or until chicken is
done. Remove the chicken and the onion and set aside. Remove the cardamom pod
and discard. In a small frying pan, melt the butter and brown the noodles until
medium golden brown. Add the browned noodles to the soup and boil on medium for
10-15 more minutes. To serve the chicken, cut into pieces, brush with a little olive oil
or butter, and brown under the broiler or in a frying pan for a few minutes. Serve the
soup with a squeeze of lime.
SHORBA FAREK.title: SHORBA FAREK
SHORBA FAREK.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Chicken Soup)
ingredients: 1/2 c. thin small noodles or alphabet
SHORBA FAREK.instructions: Bring the chicken, water, onion, bouillon, cardamom pods, salt and pepper to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 35-45 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove the chicken and the onion and set aside. Remove the cardamom pod and discard. In a small frying pan, melt the butter and brown the noodles until medium golden brown. Add the browned noodles to the soup and boil on medium for 10-15 more minutes. To serve the chicken, cut into pieces, brush with a little olive oil or butter, and brown under the broiler or in a frying pan for a few minutes. Serve the soup with a squeeze of lime.

raw_meal: Mix all ingredients together and serve cold.
Remove the stems from the parsley and mince the tops. In a large salad bowl add the
parsley and the chopped vegetables and mix together. In a small bowl, mix the mint,
cinnamon, salt, pepper, and lemon juice, then with a wire whisk, mix in the oil until
incorporated. Pour dressing over salad and mix well. Serve immediately.
SHRIMP SALAD.title: SHRIMP SALAD
SHRIMP SALAD.instructions: Mix all ingredients together and serve cold. Remove the stems from the parsley and mince the tops. In a large salad bowl add the parsley and the chopped vegetables and mix together. In a small bowl, mix the mint, cinnamon, salt, pepper, and lemon juice, then with a wire whisk, mix in the oil until incorporated. Pour dressing over salad and mix well. Serve immediately.

raw_meal: Reserve the Ramen seasoning packet for the dressing. To make the salad, in a large
salad bowl, mix all ingredients in the order given. Add chunks of chicken or turkey,
for a variation.
TOP RAMEN CABBAGE SALAD.title: TOP RAMEN CABBAGE SALAD
TOP RAMEN CABBAGE SALAD.instructions: Reserve the Ramen seasoning packet for the dressing. To make the salad, in a large salad bowl, mix all ingredients in the order given. Add chunks of chicken or turkey, for a variation.

raw_meal: In a large bowl, toss together salad ingredients. In a dressing cruet or deep bowl, mix
together the dressing ingredients except oil. With a wire whisk, stir a few minutes to
dissolve salt and sugar, then whisk in oil in a fine stream until incorporated. Dress
salad and serve immediately.
To make the dressing, in a cruit, mix the Ramen seasoning, salt, vinegar, sugar and
pepper until dissolved. Add the oil and shake well. Pour a small amount of the
dressing over the cabbage salad and toss well to coat.
SPINACH SALAD.title: SPINACH SALAD
ingredients: 1/2 c. light olive or canola oil
SPINACH SALAD.instructions: In a large bowl, toss together salad ingredients. In a dressing cruet or deep bowl, mix together the dressing ingredients except oil. With a wire whisk, stir a few minutes to dissolve salt and sugar, then whisk in oil in a fine stream until incorporated. Dress salad and serve immediately. To make the dressing, in a cruit, mix the Ramen seasoning, salt, vinegar, sugar and pepper until dissolved. Add the oil and shake well. Pour a small amount of the dressing over the cabbage salad and toss well to coat.

TABBOULEH.title: TABBOULEH
TABBOULEH.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Parsley Salad)
ingredients: 1 1/2 c. bulgur wheat, fine #1, soaked in
TABBOULEH.instructions: Remove the stems from the parsley and mince the tops. In a large salad bowl add the parsley and the chopped vegetables and mix together. In a small bowl, mix the mint, cinnamon, salt, pepper, and lemon juice, then with a wire whisk, mix in the oil until incorporated. Pour dressing over salad and mix well. Serve immediately.

raw_meal: Saute the onion in the butter until light golden brown. Add the garlic and saute for one
more minute. Add the tomato sauce and lemon or lime juice and 1/2 cup of water and
bring to a boil. Wash and prepare the okra by cutting around the top, but not cutting it
off completely. Add the prepared okra, salt and pepper to the tomato mixture and let
boil on high for 3 minutes, then simmer on low for about 20 minutes or until tender.
Serve over rice.
BAMIA BIL UTA.title: BAMIA BIL UTA
BAMIA BIL UTA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Okra)
BAMIA BIL UTA.instructions: Saute the onion in the butter until light golden brown. Add the garlic and saute for one more minute. Add the tomato sauce and lemon or lime juice and 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil. Wash and prepare the okra by cutting around the top, but not cutting it off completely. Add the prepared okra, salt and pepper to the tomato mixture and let boil on high for 3 minutes, then simmer on low for about 20 minutes or until tender. Serve over rice.

raw_meal: Place sliced carrots with 1/4 c. water in microwave safe bowl and cover with lid.
Cook on high for 4-5 minutes or until carrots are tender. Place cooked carrots in a
buttered casserole dish. Stir in onions, sprinkle cheese over top. Top with potato
chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
CARROT CASSEROLE.title: CARROT CASSEROLE
CARROT CASSEROLE.instructions: Place sliced carrots with 1/4 c. water in microwave safe bowl and cover with lid. Cook on high for 4-5 minutes or until carrots are tender. Place cooked carrots in a buttered casserole dish. Stir in onions, sprinkle cheese over top. Top with potato chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

raw_meal: Split the pita bread in half. Spread pita pieces onto cookie sheets. Bake the bread in a
250 degree oven until very dry and hard, turning over once or twice. In a stock pot,
break the dry pita into small pieces. Boil the soup stock and add to the bread, covering
plus one inch. Melt the butter and pour over bread. Mix the butter, bread and stock
once, cover and let stand. Check to see if you need a bit more stock. Soup should be
completely incorporated into the bread pieces. It should be soft, but not too mushy
and not dry.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium saucepan, bring the soup, milk, butter, salt
and pepper to a boil, stirring constantly. Add the rice and bring back to a boil, stirring
for 3-4 more minutes. Transfer rice to a deep baking dish and bake uncovered for
about 10 minutes, or until milk is bubbling and the top is slighly brown. Turn down to
300 degrees and bake for another 40-45 minutes. Top should be golden brown and the
rice tender. Serve by first placing a spoon of the feta on plate then a spoon of rice on
top.
FETA WE ROZ BRAHM.title: FETA WE ROZ BRAHM
FETA WE ROZ BRAHM.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Bread and Rice Dish)
ingredients: 1 qt. soup stock (turkey, chicken or beef)
FETA WE ROZ BRAHM.instructions: Split the pita bread in half. Spread pita pieces onto cookie sheets. Bake the bread in a 250 degree oven until very dry and hard, turning over once or twice. In a stock pot, break the dry pita into small pieces. Boil the soup stock and add to the bread, covering plus one inch. Melt the butter and pour over bread. Mix the butter, bread and stock once, cover and let stand. Check to see if you need a bit more stock. Soup should be completely incorporated into the bread pieces. It should be soft, but not too mushy and not dry. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium saucepan, bring the soup, milk, butter, salt and pepper to a boil, stirring constantly. Add the rice and bring back to a boil, stirring for 3-4 more minutes. Transfer rice to a deep baking dish and bake uncovered for about 10 minutes, or until milk is bubbling and the top is slighly brown. Turn down to 300 degrees and bake for another 40-45 minutes. Top should be golden brown and the rice tender. Serve by first placing a spoon of the feta on plate then a spoon of rice on top.

raw_meal: In a frying pan on medium-high heat, add the oil and brown the onions until very soft
and dark brown. Set aside on a paper towel and let cool. In a medium sauce pan, over
medium heat, mix the yogurt, milk and flour, stirring. Gradually add the chicken broth
and continue stirring until well mixed. Place pan over medium heat and bring to boil.
Lower heat and cook for about 15 minutes or until very thick and creamy, stirring
occasionally. Add salt, pepper and half of the fried onions into the sauce. Place in a
serving dish and garnish with remaining fried onions. Serve warm or cold with pita
bread.
KISHK.title: KISHK
KISHK.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Creamy Dip)
KISHK.instructions: In a frying pan on medium-high heat, add the oil and brown the onions until very soft and dark brown. Set aside on a paper towel and let cool. In a medium sauce pan, over medium heat, mix the yogurt, milk and flour, stirring. Gradually add the chicken broth and continue stirring until well mixed. Place pan over medium heat and bring to boil. Lower heat and cook for about 15 minutes or until very thick and creamy, stirring occasionally. Add salt, pepper and half of the fried onions into the sauce. Place in a serving dish and garnish with remaining fried onions. Serve warm or cold with pita bread.

raw_meal: Heat the water to boiling. Add the bullion cubes and dissolve. Add the noodles and
bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer approximately 15-20 minutes
until the water is absorbed. Remove from heat. Add the milk, cheese, eggs, salt and
pepper. Put the mixture in a buttered 9 x 12 inch glass baking pan. Sprinkle the top
with the crumbs and bake at 350 degrees for approximately 30-45 minutes, until top
begins to brown.
MACARONA FEEL FORNE.title: MACARONA FEEL FORNE
MACARONA FEEL FORNE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Baked Pasta)
MACARONA FEEL FORNE.instructions: Heat the water to boiling. Add the bullion cubes and dissolve. Add the noodles and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer approximately 15-20 minutes until the water is absorbed. Remove from heat. Add the milk, cheese, eggs, salt and pepper. Put the mixture in a buttered 9 x 12 inch glass baking pan. Sprinkle the top with the crumbs and bake at 350 degrees for approximately 30-45 minutes, until top begins to brown.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place chopped or julienned vegetables on a large baking
sheet and sprinkle top with olive oil, salt, pepper and Herbs de Provence. Mix until
herbs and oil cover the vegetables. Roast vegetables for 15 minutes, stirring once or
twice to keep from browning too much. In the meantime, bring a large pot of water to
boil and add 2 tablespoons of salt. Boil the pasta in salted water for 6-8 minutes, until
al dente. When done, drain water and mix the pasta with the mozzarella and fontina
cheeses, tomato sauce, and roasted vegetables. Place pasta mixture in a large
rectangular baking dish and top with the parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for
15-2 minutes. Vegetarian variation: omit cheeses.
PASTA WITH ROASTED VEGETABLES.title: PASTA WITH ROASTED VEGETABLES
ingredients: 1 lb. penne pasta (or other tubular pasta)
PASTA WITH ROASTED VEGETABLES.instructions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place chopped or julienned vegetables on a large baking sheet and sprinkle top with olive oil, salt, pepper and Herbs de Provence. Mix until herbs and oil cover the vegetables. Roast vegetables for 15 minutes, stirring once or twice to keep from browning too much. In the meantime, bring a large pot of water to boil and add 2 tablespoons of salt. Boil the pasta in salted water for 6-8 minutes, until al dente. When done, drain water and mix the pasta with the mozzarella and fontina cheeses, tomato sauce, and roasted vegetables. Place pasta mixture in a large rectangular baking dish and top with the parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-2 minutes. Vegetarian variation: omit cheeses.

raw_meal: In a medium saucepan, melt the butter or oil and saute the pasta until medium golden
brown. Add the rice and saute together about 2 more minutes. Add the water, salt and
pepper and cover. Bring to a boil, then turn down to low and let cook for
approximately 25 minutes. Toast the pine nuts by spreading out on a large baking
sheet and baking in oven on 400 for 5 minutes (keep a close eye on nuts as they
brown). Sprinkle over the rice before serving. Vegetarian variation: Use oil instead of
butter.
ROZ BIL SHA'RIYA.title: ROZ BIL SHA'RIYA
ROZ BIL SHA'RIYA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Rice with Small Pasta)
ingredients: 1/2 c. orzo, alphabet or other very small
ROZ BIL SHA'RIYA.instructions: In a medium saucepan, melt the butter or oil and saute the pasta until medium golden brown. Add the rice and saute together about 2 more minutes. Add the water, salt and pepper and cover. Bring to a boil, then turn down to low and let cook for approximately 25 minutes. Toast the pine nuts by spreading out on a large baking sheet and baking in oven on 400 for 5 minutes (keep a close eye on nuts as they brown). Sprinkle over the rice before serving. Vegetarian variation: Use oil instead of butter.

raw_meal: Remove the hard stems from the greens and wash thoroughly. Steam in a small
amount of water for a few minutes until just tender but not fully cooked. In a large
saute pan on medium heat, melt the butter or oil and saute the onions until tender and
translucent, then add mushrooms (if desired) and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook
one more minute. Remove greens from steamer, squeeze out some of the water, chop
into 1-inch pieces, and add to the hot saute pan. Add salt and pepper and cook, stirring
frequently for 3-4 minutes. Add vinegar or lemon juice and cook 1-2 more minutes.
Vegetarian variation: Use oil instead of butter.
SAUTEED GREENS.title: SAUTEED GREENS
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, spinach, collard or mustard
SAUTEED GREENS.instructions: Remove the hard stems from the greens and wash thoroughly. Steam in a small amount of water for a few minutes until just tender but not fully cooked. In a large saute pan on medium heat, melt the butter or oil and saute the onions until tender and translucent, then add mushrooms (if desired) and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook one more minute. Remove greens from steamer, squeeze out some of the water, chop into 1-inch pieces, and add to the hot saute pan. Add salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently for 3-4 minutes. Add vinegar or lemon juice and cook 1-2 more minutes. Vegetarian variation: Use oil instead of butter.

raw_meal: In a large saute pan, melt 2 T. of the butter and saute the mushrooms until deep
golden brown. Add half of the sliced garlic cloves and cook 1-2 more minutes.
Transfer mushrooms to a small mixing bowl. In the meantime, bring a medium sauce
pan with water to a boil, add peas and cook for 3-4 minutes or until peas are tender
(but not overly soft). Drain the peas. In the same saute pan, melt the remaining butter
and add the peas. Saute for 3-4 minutes, then add the remaining sliced garlic and saute
one or two more minutes. Add the mushrooms to the peas, and add the salt, pepper
and oregano. Saute a few more minutes, stirring. Serve immediately. Vegetarian
variation: Use oil instead of butter.
SAUTEED PEAS.title: SAUTEED PEAS
SAUTEED PEAS.instructions: In a large saute pan, melt 2 T. of the butter and saute the mushrooms until deep golden brown. Add half of the sliced garlic cloves and cook 1-2 more minutes. Transfer mushrooms to a small mixing bowl. In the meantime, bring a medium sauce pan with water to a boil, add peas and cook for 3-4 minutes or until peas are tender (but not overly soft). Drain the peas. In the same saute pan, melt the remaining butter and add the peas. Saute for 3-4 minutes, then add the remaining sliced garlic and saute one or two more minutes. Add the mushrooms to the peas, and add the salt, pepper and oregano. Saute a few more minutes, stirring. Serve immediately. Vegetarian variation: Use oil instead of butter.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, mix the zucchini, onions, eggs, and sour cream. Add half of
the cheese, salt and pepper. Butter the bottom of a shallow baking dish. Pour in the
zucchini mixture. Mix the bread crumbs with the remaining cheese and sprinkle
evenly over the top of the zucchini. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until
mixture is set, light golden brown and top is slightly bubbly.
ZUCCHINI CASSEROLE.title: ZUCCHINI CASSEROLE
ZUCCHINI CASSEROLE.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mix the zucchini, onions, eggs, and sour cream. Add half of the cheese, salt and pepper. Butter the bottom of a shallow baking dish. Pour in the zucchini mixture. Mix the bread crumbs with the remaining cheese and sprinkle evenly over the top of the zucchini. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until mixture is set, light golden brown and top is slightly bubbly.

raw_meal: In a little of the butter, saute the onion until light golden brown. Add the ground beef
and brown. Remove excess fat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Par boil the cauliflower
for 1 minute adding the cumin to the water. Drain. In a large, deep sauce pan melt a
few tablespoons of the butter and at a medium high or high heat, brown the
cauliflower pieces a few at a time until very dark, but don't over cook the cauliflower
so it becomes mushy. Fry all the flowerettes, adding butter to the pan as needed so the
cauliflower browns but does not burn. (As an alternative to frying in butter, place all
the flowerettes on a large baking sheet, sprinkle with a little olive oil and cumin, and
place in the oven at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes, stirring once or twice until
brown.) As they are browned, put the flowerets into the bottom of a 9 x 9 baking dish.
When the bottom is filled, layer the ground beef on top of the cauliflower. Then top
with the rest of the browned cauliflower. Pour the tomato sauce and 1/2 cup of water
(or just enough to cover) over the cauliflower and meat. Bake at 350 degrees for one
hour or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve over rice. Vegetarian variation: Omit
the ground beef and use oil instead of butter.
ARNABEET.title: ARNABEET
ARNABEET.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Cauliflower Casserole)
ARNABEET.instructions: In a little of the butter, saute the onion until light golden brown. Add the ground beef and brown. Remove excess fat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Par boil the cauliflower for 1 minute adding the cumin to the water. Drain. In a large, deep sauce pan melt a few tablespoons of the butter and at a medium high or high heat, brown the cauliflower pieces a few at a time until very dark, but don't over cook the cauliflower so it becomes mushy. Fry all the flowerettes, adding butter to the pan as needed so the cauliflower browns but does not burn. (As an alternative to frying in butter, place all the flowerettes on a large baking sheet, sprinkle with a little olive oil and cumin, and place in the oven at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes, stirring once or twice until brown.) As they are browned, put the flowerets into the bottom of a 9 x 9 baking dish. When the bottom is filled, layer the ground beef on top of the cauliflower. Then top with the rest of the browned cauliflower. Pour the tomato sauce and 1/2 cup of water (or just enough to cover) over the cauliflower and meat. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve over rice. Vegetarian variation: Omit the ground beef and use oil instead of butter.

raw_meal: In a flat baking dish, brush the bottom with a little olive oil. Place the salmon filet in
the pan (skin side down). Sprinkle with the rosemary, thyme, oregano, garlic and
olive oil. Top with slices of lemon and the lemon or lime juice. Bake in a 350 degree
oven for 35 minutes or until salmon is done (flaky but not dry).
BAKED HERB SALMON.title: BAKED HERB SALMON
ingredients: 1 T. fresh or dry thyme, crushed
1 T. fresh or dry oregano, crushed
BAKED HERB SALMON.instructions: In a flat baking dish, brush the bottom with a little olive oil. Place the salmon filet in the pan (skin side down). Sprinkle with the rosemary, thyme, oregano, garlic and olive oil. Top with slices of lemon and the lemon or lime juice. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 minutes or until salmon is done (flaky but not dry).

raw_meal: Cut the butter into small pieces and place in the bottom of a 10 x 13 inch baking dish.
Salt and pepper the lamb pieces and place them on top of the butter in the pan. Layer
the garlic, onion and potatoes over the meat, sprinkling with a little salt and pepper on
each layer. Place the tomatoes in a last layer over the top. Pour the tomato sauce
evenly over the top of the pan and fill to the level of the potatoes with water. Place in
a 375 degree oven and cook uncovered for 1 hour until the potatoes are tender and the
top is golden brown and bubbling.
BATATESS FEEL FORNE.title: BATATESS FEEL FORNE
BATATESS FEEL FORNE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Potatoes and Lamb in the Oven)
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb. lamb chops or boneless lamb pieces
BATATESS FEEL FORNE.instructions: Cut the butter into small pieces and place in the bottom of a 10 x 13 inch baking dish. Salt and pepper the lamb pieces and place them on top of the butter in the pan. Layer the garlic, onion and potatoes over the meat, sprinkling with a little salt and pepper on each layer. Place the tomatoes in a last layer over the top. Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the top of the pan and fill to the level of the potatoes with water. Place in a 375 degree oven and cook uncovered for 1 hour until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown and bubbling.

raw_meal: Brown the ground beef until well cooked. When done, place the beef in a mixing
bowl. In the still hot pan, remove some of the fat and add the onion, stir and let cook
until golden brown. Remove the onion and mix with the beef. In a large sauce pan,
add the water, milk, salt, pepper and butter and bring to a boil. Once it boils,
immediately remove from the heat and add the potato flakes a little a time, stirring
well with a fork. (Additional butter may be added for a richer dish.) If the mixture is
too thick to spread, add a little bit of milk and stir until a nice consistency. (Or, follow
the directions on the mashed potato box to make 6 cups of cooked potatoes.) In a 10 x
13 deep baking dish, butter the bottom and sides. Divide the potatoes in half and
spread half on the bottom of the baking dish, smoothing it out with the back of a
spoon or your hands. Spread the meat evenly over the potatoes covering the entire
surface. Spread the remaining potatoes over the meat. With a sharp knife, mark the
top of the potatoes into 3 inch squares. Top with a thin layer of Italian bread crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until top is golden brown and the meat is
a little bubbly.
BATATESS PUREE.title: BATATESS PUREE
BATATESS PUREE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Mashed Potatoes with Meat)
BATATESS PUREE.instructions: Brown the ground beef until well cooked. When done, place the beef in a mixing bowl. In the still hot pan, remove some of the fat and add the onion, stir and let cook until golden brown. Remove the onion and mix with the beef. In a large sauce pan, add the water, milk, salt, pepper and butter and bring to a boil. Once it boils, immediately remove from the heat and add the potato flakes a little a time, stirring well with a fork. (Additional butter may be added for a richer dish.) If the mixture is too thick to spread, add a little bit of milk and stir until a nice consistency. (Or, follow the directions on the mashed potato box to make 6 cups of cooked potatoes.) In a 10 x 13 deep baking dish, butter the bottom and sides. Divide the potatoes in half and spread half on the bottom of the baking dish, smoothing it out with the back of a spoon or your hands. Spread the meat evenly over the potatoes covering the entire surface. Spread the remaining potatoes over the meat. With a sharp knife, mark the top of the potatoes into 3 inch squares. Top with a thin layer of Italian bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until top is golden brown and the meat is a little bubbly.

raw_meal: To prepare eggplant, cut tops off each eggplant and hollow out as much of the meat as
possible down to the skin, being careful not to puncture the skin. Soak eggplant skins
in cold water for several hours. To prepare stuffing: In a food processor, chop the
onion and tomato. In a large mixing bowl, mix the raw ground beef, 1/2 of the
eggplant meat (optional); use the remaining eggplant meat for another dish), rice,
chopped onion and tomato, salt, pepper and melted butter. Stuff each of the eggplant
skins with the meat mixture and lay in a large baking pan. Lay one eggplant next the
other until pan is full. Pour the tomato sauce over the stuffed eggplants and cover with
water until almost to the top of the pan. Bake eggplants in a 350 degree oven for 45
minutes, until bubbly and slightly brown around the edges. This recipe can be used
with small zucchini's instead of eggplants, except do not hollow out as much of the
zucchini meat and omit the tomato.
BITTINGAN MAHSHI.title: BITTINGAN MAHSHI
BITTINGAN MAHSHI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Stuffed Eggplant)
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb. lamb chops or boneless lamb
BITTINGAN MAHSHI.instructions: To prepare eggplant, cut tops off each eggplant and hollow out as much of the meat as possible down to the skin, being careful not to puncture the skin. Soak eggplant skins in cold water for several hours. To prepare stuffing: In a food processor, chop the onion and tomato. In a large mixing bowl, mix the raw ground beef, 1/2 of the eggplant meat (optional); use the remaining eggplant meat for another dish), rice, chopped onion and tomato, salt, pepper and melted butter. Stuff each of the eggplant skins with the meat mixture and lay in a large baking pan. Lay one eggplant next the other until pan is full. Pour the tomato sauce over the stuffed eggplants and cover with water until almost to the top of the pan. Bake eggplants in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes, until bubbly and slightly brown around the edges. This recipe can be used with small zucchini's instead of eggplants, except do not hollow out as much of the zucchini meat and omit the tomato.

raw_meal: Marinate the beef in the grated onion and its juice for several hours. One by one, salt
and pepper and thoroughly coat the slices of beef first in the bread crumbs, then in the
beaten egg. In a frying pan (or electric skillet), melt about 2 tablespoons of butter or
the oil on medium-high heat (do not burn). Fry several pieces of the beef in the butter
until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn over once, cook about 1-2 more minutes.
Remove from pan and lay on a platter. Keep warm while frying the rest of the beef.
Add more butter to the pan as needed while frying.
BOOFTEK.title: BOOFTEK
BOOFTEK.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Breaded Beef Steak)
ingredients: 1 lb. tender beef, sliced very thinly
BOOFTEK.instructions: Marinate the beef in the grated onion and its juice for several hours. One by one, salt and pepper and thoroughly coat the slices of beef first in the bread crumbs, then in the beaten egg. In a frying pan (or electric skillet), melt about 2 tablespoons of butter or the oil on medium-high heat (do not burn).
