Fry several pieces of the beef in the butter until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn over once, cook about 1-2 more minutes. Remove from pan and lay on a platter. Keep warm while frying the rest of the beef. Add more butter to the pan as needed while frying.

raw_meal: Cut the fish into small bite-size pieces and place in a sealable baggie or container.
Add the lemon or lime juice to the fish (should cover fish completely) and marinate at
least 6 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Strain out the lemon or lime juice and
discard. In a serving bowl, mix the marinated fish and all other ingredients (add the
avocado just before serving), stirring gently. Serve with tostadas or white crackers.
CEVICHE.title: CEVICHE
CEVICHE.instructions: Cut the fish into small bite-size pieces and place in a sealable baggie or container. Add the lemon or lime juice to the fish (should cover fish completely) and marinate at least 6 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Strain out the lemon or lime juice and discard. In a serving bowl, mix the marinated fish and all other ingredients (add the avocado just before serving), stirring gently. Serve with tostadas or white crackers.

raw_meal: In a medium mixing bowl, mix together the olive oil, rosemary, thyme, and parsley.
Cut the chicken breasts in half down the middle to make two cutlets from each breast.
Sprinkle each breast with salt and pepper on both sides. Dip each breast into the olive
oil and herb mixture to coat. Put chicken pieces in a large deep bowl, pour over
remaining oil and herb mixture, cover and marinate for 1/2 to 1 hour in refrigerator.
Heat a large saute pan and add 2 T. olive oil or butter. When hot, add 2-3 of the
chicken breasts to pan and sear each side until golden brown, about 4 minutes each
side, then place chicken pieces in a large flat baking dish. (Chicken will be half
cooked.) Sear all pieces a few at a time, putting them in the baking dish when done.
Spoon the marinara sauced over each breast, and pour tomato sauce around the
chicken to fill the dish. Top each piece with mozzarella and a little parmesan cheeses.
Bake in 450 degree oven for 15 minutes until bubbly and brown and chicken is
cooked through.
CHICKEN PARMESAN.title: CHICKEN PARMESAN
ingredients: 1 T. flat leaf Italian parsley, finely
CHICKEN PARMESAN.instructions: In a medium mixing bowl, mix together the olive oil, rosemary, thyme, and parsley. Cut the chicken breasts in half down the middle to make two cutlets from each breast. Sprinkle each breast with salt and pepper on both sides. Dip each breast into the olive oil and herb mixture to coat. Put chicken pieces in a large deep bowl, pour over remaining oil and herb mixture, cover and marinate for 1/2 to 1 hour in refrigerator. Heat a large saute pan and add 2 T. olive oil or butter. When hot, add 2-3 of the chicken breasts to pan and sear each side until golden brown, about 4 minutes each side, then place chicken pieces in a large flat baking dish. (Chicken will be half cooked.) Sear all pieces a few at a time, putting them in the baking dish when done. Spoon the marinara sauced over each breast, and pour tomato sauce around the chicken to fill the dish. Top each piece with mozzarella and a little parmesan cheeses. Bake in 450 degree oven for 15 minutes until bubbly and brown and chicken is cooked through.

raw_meal: In a saute pan, heat the oil and add the vegetables and seasonings. Saute together for
3-4 minutes. Add the chicken and continue sauteing for several more minutes.
CHICKEN WITH CURRY.title: CHICKEN WITH CURRY
CHICKEN WITH CURRY.instructions: In a saute pan, heat the oil and add the vegetables and seasonings. Saute together for 3-4 minutes. Add the chicken and continue sauteing for several more minutes.

raw_meal: Lay the chicken breasts in a baking dish. Mix together the sour cream, mustard and
salt. Pour over chicken and bake in 350 degree oven for 20-30 minutes.
CHICKEN WITH SOUR CREAM.title: CHICKEN WITH SOUR CREAM
CHICKEN WITH SOUR CREAM.instructions: Lay the chicken breasts in a baking dish. Mix together the sour cream, mustard and salt. Pour over chicken and bake in 350 degree oven for 20-30 minutes.

raw_meal: In a frying pan, heat the butter and saute the vegetables until tender, adding salt to
taste. Bone and chop the chicken into small pieces. Add the chicken to the vegetables
and cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, mix and cook for a few more minutes.
CHICKEN WITH SOY SAUCE.title: CHICKEN WITH SOY SAUCE
CHICKEN WITH SOY SAUCE.instructions: In a frying pan, heat the butter and saute the vegetables until tender, adding salt to taste. Bone and chop the chicken into small pieces. Add the chicken to the vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, mix and cook for a few more minutes.

raw_meal: Roast fresh chiles under broiler on each side until outer skin is black. Put hot chiles
into a paper bag and let sweat for a few minutes. Remove from bag and remove
blackened skin from chiles. Cut one side of each chile and remove seeds and inside
pulp. Insert 2 slices of cheese (or enough to fill inside). Dip each stuffed chile into
flour to coat. In a small bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff. Add the egg yolk to the
whites and stir. Dip each chile into the egg batter and fry in hot butter or oil for 2-3
minutes on each side. Remove from fry pan and set aside on a paper towel. In the fry
pan on medium-high heat, add the onion and brown. Add the tomato sauce, one can of
water, and salt. Bring to a simmer and cook for 4-5 minutes until slightly thick. Place
chiles into a serving dish and pour tomato mixture over top.
CHILE RELLE\u00d1OS.title: CHILE RELLEÑOS
CHILE RELLE\u00d1OS.subtitle: (Stuffed Chiles)
CHILE RELLE\u00d1OS.instructions: Roast fresh chiles under broiler on each side until outer skin is black. Put hot chiles into a paper bag and let sweat for a few minutes. Remove from bag and remove blackened skin from chiles. Cut one side of each chile and remove seeds and inside pulp. Insert 2 slices of cheese (or enough to fill inside). Dip each stuffed chile into flour to coat. In a small bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff. Add the egg yolk to the whites and stir. Dip each chile into the egg batter and fry in hot butter or oil for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove from fry pan and set aside on a paper towel. In the fry pan on medium-high heat, add the onion and brown. Add the tomato sauce, one can of water, and salt. Bring to a simmer and cook for 4-5 minutes until slightly thick. Place chiles into a serving dish and pour tomato mixture over top.

raw_meal: 2-3 Dungeness crabs, cooked and cracked 1 (8-oz.) can tomato puree
In a large saute pan, heat the olive oil to medium and cook the onion until medium
brown. Add the green onions and the garlic and cook 2-3 more minutes, stirring. Add
all remaining ingredients to the saute pan and bring to a rolling boil. Cook for 2 hours,
stirring frequently. Layer the seafood in a large soup pot (crabs, peeled shrimp,
scallops, then clams). Pour the tomato mixture over the seafood and bring to a boil.
Cook until clams open up. Serve with French bread, green salad, red wine and lots of
napkins. Note: Plan on ½ crab per person. Purchase them at the fish counter already
cooked and, if possible, have the grocer crack the crab for you.
CIOPPINO.title: CIOPPINO
CIOPPINO.subtitle: (Italian Seafood Stew)
CIOPPINO.instructions: 2-3 Dungeness crabs, cooked and cracked 1 (8-oz.) can tomato puree In a large saute pan, heat the olive oil to medium and cook the onion until medium brown. Add the green onions and the garlic and cook 2-3 more minutes, stirring. Add all remaining ingredients to the saute pan and bring to a rolling boil. Cook for 2 hours, stirring frequently. Layer the seafood in a large soup pot (crabs, peeled shrimp, scallops, then clams). Pour the tomato mixture over the seafood and bring to a boil. Cook until clams open up. Serve with French bread, green salad, red wine and lots of napkins. Note: Plan on ½ crab per person. Purchase them at the fish counter already cooked and, if possible, have the grocer crack the crab for you.

raw_meal: Wash then soak the garbanzo beans for 6-7 hours. Drain and rinse. In a food
processor, combine the beans, green onions and parsley, and process until very finely
ground. Add the cumin, coriander, garlic, yellow onion, pepper and baking powder
and mix for 1 more minute. When the falafel is ready to fry, stir in the baking soda. In
a deep frying or sauce pan, heat the oil to about 375° F. Form 2 T. of the mixture into
a small patty and gently drop into the oil. Fry until medium to dark brown, turning
over once. Fry several patties as a time, until the mixture is gone. (Do not add too
many patties to oil at once or the temperature will drop.) Place 2-3 hot patties in pita
bread halves with fresh lettuce, tomato, and cucumber to fill. Add a spoon of Tahini
sauce on top (see Tahini dip recipe).
FALAFEL.title: FALAFEL
FALAFEL.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Vegetarian Burger)
ingredients: pita bread rounds, cut into halves
FALAFEL.instructions: Wash then soak the garbanzo beans for 6-7 hours. Drain and rinse. In a food processor, combine the beans, green onions and parsley, and process until very finely ground. Add the cumin, coriander, garlic, yellow onion, pepper and baking powder and mix for 1 more minute. When the falafel is ready to fry, stir in the baking soda. In a deep frying or sauce pan, heat the oil to about 375° F. Form 2 T. of the mixture into a small patty and gently drop into the oil. Fry until medium to dark brown, turning over once. Fry several patties as a time, until the mixture is gone. (Do not add too many patties to oil at once or the temperature will drop.) Place 2-3 hot patties in pita bread halves with fresh lettuce, tomato, and cucumber to fill. Add a spoon of Tahini sauce on top (see Tahini dip recipe).

raw_meal: Saute the onion in the butter until soft. Add the meat cubes and saute until brown.
Add the garlic to the meat, stirring to incorporate. Add the tomato sauce, turn down to
low and let simmer for 10-15 minutes. Split the fresh green beans vertically in
quarters (Frenched) or buy French style cut frozen green beans. Steam the green
beans until almost done. Add the green beans to the meat and add enough water to
just cover. Bring to a boil then turn down to low and let simmer for another 20-30
minutes until beans are tender. Serve with rice. You can substitute peas (bissella) or
okra (bamia) for the green beans.
FASSOLIA.title: FASSOLIA
FASSOLIA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Green Bean Stew)
ingredients: 1 lb. tender beef, cut into stew sized
FASSOLIA.instructions: Saute the onion in the butter until soft. Add the meat cubes and saute until brown. Add the garlic to the meat, stirring to incorporate. Add the tomato sauce, turn down to low and let simmer for 10-15 minutes. Split the fresh green beans vertically in quarters (Frenched) or buy French style cut frozen green beans. Steam the green beans until almost done. Add the green beans to the meat and add enough water to just cover. Bring to a boil then turn down to low and let simmer for another 20-30 minutes until beans are tender. Serve with rice. You can substitute peas (bissella) or okra (bamia) for the green beans.

raw_meal: In a medium saucepan, bring the beans to a boil and cook for approximately 2
minutes. Drain most but not all of the juice. Place the beans in a mixing bowl and add
the fresh garlic or garlic powder, tomato, onion, chilies (optional), oil, salt, pepper,
cumin and lime. Mix the ingredients into the beans and mash with a fork or potato
masher. Serve with pita bread. Note: Canned foul beans can be found in Middle
Eastern food stores.
FOUL MEDAMESS.title: FOUL MEDAMESS
FOUL MEDAMESS.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Red Beans)
ingredients: 1 clove garlic, chopped very finely or
FOUL MEDAMESS.instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring the beans to a boil and cook for approximately 2 minutes. Drain most but not all of the juice. Place the beans in a mixing bowl and add the fresh garlic or garlic powder, tomato, onion, chilies (optional), oil, salt, pepper, cumin and lime. Mix the ingredients into the beans and mash with a fork or potato masher. Serve with pita bread. Note: Canned foul beans can be found in Middle Eastern food stores.

raw_meal: Lay the chicken pieces in a flat baking pan. Sprinkle a little of the dry salad dressing
mix and the pepper over the chicken (additional herbs and spices may be added, such
as garlic powder, paprika, parsley or rosemary). In a medium mixing bowl, mix the
rest of the dressing mix with the bread crumbs and roll each chicken piece in the
crumbs until well covered. Place back in baking pan and dot each piece with a small
amount of butter or olive oil. Bake at 375 degrees for about 40 minutes or until
bubbly and golden brown.
GOOD SEASON'S CHICKEN.title: GOOD SEASON'S CHICKEN
GOOD SEASON'S CHICKEN.instructions: Lay the chicken pieces in a flat baking pan. Sprinkle a little of the dry salad dressing mix and the pepper over the chicken (additional herbs and spices may be added, such as garlic powder, paprika, parsley or rosemary). In a medium mixing bowl, mix the rest of the dressing mix with the bread crumbs and roll each chicken piece in the crumbs until well covered. Place back in baking pan and dot each piece with a small amount of butter or olive oil. Bake at 375 degrees for about 40 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

raw_meal: Saute the onions in the butter until clear and soft. Stir in the meat and fry until
browned. Remove the fat. Stir in the garlic, flour, salt, pepper, paprika and
mushrooms. Saute until the mushrooms are done, about 10 minutes. Add the soup and
about 1/2 can of water and cook on medium-low (just bubbling) for about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and when slightly cooled stir in the sour cream. Serve over rice or
mashed potatoes, topped with a pinch of fresh parsley.
HAMBURGER STROGANOFF.title: HAMBURGER STROGANOFF
HAMBURGER STROGANOFF.instructions: Saute the onions in the butter until clear and soft. Stir in the meat and fry until browned. Remove the fat. Stir in the garlic, flour, salt, pepper, paprika and mushrooms. Saute until the mushrooms are done, about 10 minutes. Add the soup and about 1/2 can of water and cook on medium-low (just bubbling) for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and when slightly cooled stir in the sour cream. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes, topped with a pinch of fresh parsley.

raw_meal: Mix together all ingredients except the tortillas and oil. Lay out one tortilla half and
spoon 1 or 2 large spoons of meat mixture in middle. Fold in points of tortilla and
tuck so it forms a pocket. Repeat until all tortillas are filled (or meat is used). Place
Hawawshi pockets onto oiled cookie sheet and brush a little oil onto each one. Bake
in preheated 375 degree oven for about 30 minutes.
HAWAWSHI.title: HAWAWSHI
HAWAWSHI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Meat Pies)
ingredients: 5 lg. flour tortillas, cut in half
HAWAWSHI.instructions: Mix together all ingredients except the tortillas and oil. Lay out one tortilla half and spoon 1 or 2 large spoons of meat mixture in middle. Fold in points of tortilla and tuck so it forms a pocket. Repeat until all tortillas are filled (or meat is used). Place Hawawshi pockets onto oiled cookie sheet and brush a little oil onto each one. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for about 30 minutes.

raw_meal: Pre-cook the sliced potatoes until just tender (can be done in microwave or in boiling
water). Place the onions, potatoes and hot dogs in a covered casserole dish. Mix the
other ingredients together and pour over the potatoes. Stir slightly to coat the potatoes.
Bake covered at 350 degrees until heated thoroughly (15-20 minutes).
HOT POTATO SALAD.title: HOT POTATO SALAD
ingredients: 1 pkg. hot dogs, polish dogs, or garlic
HOT POTATO SALAD.instructions: Pre-cook the sliced potatoes until just tender (can be done in microwave or in boiling water). Place the onions, potatoes and hot dogs in a covered casserole dish. Mix the other ingredients together and pour over the potatoes. Stir slightly to coat the potatoes. Bake covered at 350 degrees until heated thoroughly (15-20 minutes).

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan, melt the butter and add the beef chunks, onion slices, salt and
pepper. Add cumin, if desired. Bring to a high heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring
constantly. Reduce heat, cover pan and let simmer on medium-low for 45 minutes or
until the meat is tender and the onions have cooked into a rich sauce. Stir
occasionally.
KEBAB HALLA.title: KEBAB HALLA
KEBAB HALLA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Meat Stew)
ingredients: 1 lb. beef sirloin steak, cut into bite-sized
KEBAB HALLA.instructions: In a medium sauce pan, melt the butter and add the beef chunks, onion slices, salt and pepper. Add cumin, if desired. Bring to a high heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. Reduce heat, cover pan and let simmer on medium-low for 45 minutes or until the meat is tender and the onions have cooked into a rich sauce. Stir occasionally.

raw_meal: Cut the kidney and liver into bite-sized pieces. In a medium sauce pan combine all
ingredients and cook on medium-high for 5 minutes, stirring. Turn heat down to low
and cook covered for 60 minutes, stirring occasionally until onion has completely
cooked and incorporated into the meat juices, making a rich sauce.
KEBDA WE KALAWEE.title: KEBDA WE KALAWEE
KEBDA WE KALAWEE.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Liver and Kidney Stew)
KEBDA WE KALAWEE.instructions: Cut the kidney and liver into bite-sized pieces. In a medium sauce pan combine all ingredients and cook on medium-high for 5 minutes, stirring. Turn heat down to low and cook covered for 60 minutes, stirring occasionally until onion has completely cooked and incorporated into the meat juices, making a rich sauce.

raw_meal: Soak bulgar in 4 cups water overnight. Thoroughly rinse bulgar and drain well. Mix
the bulgar with remaining ingredients, cover and refrigerate while preparing the
filling.
In a large skillet, melt the butter and brown the lamb, onion and remaining
ingredients. To assemble the dish, divide the bulgar mixture in half and spread on the
bottom of a in a 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle the lamb filling evenly over the mixture. Spread
the remaining bulgar mixture over the top of the filling, patting down so top is flat.
With a sharp knife, cut the kobeba into diamond shapes approximately 3 inches by 2
inches. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
KOBEBA SHAMI.title: KOBEBA SHAMI
KOBEBA SHAMI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Ground Lamb with Bulgar)
KOBEBA SHAMI.instructions: Soak bulgar in 4 cups water overnight. Thoroughly rinse bulgar and drain well. Mix the bulgar with remaining ingredients, cover and refrigerate while preparing the filling. In a large skillet, melt the butter and brown the lamb, onion and remaining ingredients. To assemble the dish, divide the bulgar mixture in half and spread on the bottom of a in a 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle the lamb filling evenly over the mixture. Spread the remaining bulgar mixture over the top of the filling, patting down so top is flat. With a sharp knife, cut the kobeba into diamond shapes approximately 3 inches by 2 inches. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

raw_meal: Mix the beef and lamb together in a large mixing bowl. In a food processor, blend the
onion, parsley, tomato, hot pepper, salt and pepper until well blended. Add the
mixture to the meat and mix until well incorporated. Create the Kofta by taking 2-3
tablespoons of the meat mixture and making a sausage-shaped meat ball with your
hands (approximately 3-4 inches by 1 inch). Place two Kofta on each skewer and
bar-b-q or broil in the oven, turning several times, until done. Or, pan fry the kofta
(without the skewers) in a few tablespoons of butter or oil.
KOFTA #1.title: KOFTA #1
KOFTA #1.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Ground Beef Kabobs)
KOFTA #1.instructions: Mix the beef and lamb together in a large mixing bowl. In a food processor, blend the onion, parsley, tomato, hot pepper, salt and pepper until well blended. Add the mixture to the meat and mix until well incorporated. Create the Kofta by taking 2-3 tablespoons of the meat mixture and making a sausage-shaped meat ball with your hands (approximately 3-4 inches by 1 inch). Place two Kofta on each skewer and bar-b-q or broil in the oven, turning several times, until done. Or, pan fry the kofta (without the skewers) in a few tablespoons of butter or oil.

raw_meal: Grate the onion and mix with the beef, salt and pepper. Take about 1 tablespoon of
the meat mixture and form a small patty. Coat the patties with the bread crumbs and
set aside. In a frying pan (or electric skillet), heat some of the butter or oil on
medium-high heat (do not burn). One by one, dip the patties into the egg mixture and
then into the frying pan. Cook 2-3 minutes until dark golden brown, then turn once.
Cook about 1 more minute or until the meat is cooked through. Remove from pan, set
aside on a platter and keep warm until all the patties are cooked. Add more butter or
oil as needed for frying.
KOFTA #2.title: KOFTA #2
KOFTA #2.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Breaded Beef Patties)
KOFTA #2.instructions: Grate the onion and mix with the beef, salt and pepper. Take about 1 tablespoon of the meat mixture and form a small patty. Coat the patties with the bread crumbs and set aside. In a frying pan (or electric skillet), heat some of the butter or oil on medium-high heat (do not burn). One by one, dip the patties into the egg mixture and then into the frying pan. Cook 2-3 minutes until dark golden brown, then turn once. Cook about 1 more minute or until the meat is cooked through. Remove from pan, set aside on a platter and keep warm until all the patties are cooked. Add more butter or oil as needed for frying.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. Take about 3
tablespoons of the meat mixture and wrap around a skewer to form rolls about 6
inches long and 3/4 inches thick. Barbeque over hot coals or under a grill in the oven.
Pull off the skewers with pita bread.
KOFTA #3.title: KOFTA #3
KOFTA #3.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Beef Patties)
ingredients: 2 lbs. ground beef (or half beef, half
KOFTA #3.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. Take about 3 tablespoons of the meat mixture and wrap around a skewer to form rolls about 6 inches long and 3/4 inches thick. Barbeque over hot coals or under a grill in the oven. Pull off the skewers with pita bread.

raw_meal: Fry the onions in oil on medium-high heat, stiring frequently, until dark brown.
Remove onions from oil and drain on paper towel. Retain oil in small bowl. In a large
pot, boil the macaroni in 2 quarts well salted water until tender, 6-8 minutes. Drain
water and stir in a little margarine or oil and set aside. In a large sauce pan, bring 6
cups water to boil and mix in lentils. Turn down to medium and simmer for 15
minutes. Stir in the rice, then bring back to boil. Turn down to low and let cook
covered for 25 minutes, until tender. In a small sauce pan combine the remaining oil
(from the onions), the Tabasco, the chili pepper, the garlic, salt and pepper and fry on
medium heat for a few minutes. Turn down and add the tomato sauce and water, then
simmer on medium-low for about 10 minutes, or until slightly thick. When all
ingredients are ready, assemble one serving of Koshari by layering a large spoon of
the macaroni, rice, and lentils on a plate. Or, using a small mixing bowl as a mold,
layer the lentils in the bottom, then the rice, then the macaroni and turn out onto a
single serving plate. Sprinkle with the fried onions and several spoons of hot sauce.
KOSHARI.title: KOSHARI
KOSHARI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Macaroni, Lentils and Rice)
KOSHARI.instructions: Fry the onions in oil on medium-high heat, stiring frequently, until dark brown. Remove onions from oil and drain on paper towel. Retain oil in small bowl. In a large pot, boil the macaroni in 2 quarts well salted water until tender, 6-8 minutes. Drain water and stir in a little margarine or oil and set aside. In a large sauce pan, bring 6 cups water to boil and mix in lentils. Turn down to medium and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the rice, then bring back to boil. Turn down to low and let cook covered for 25 minutes, until tender. In a small sauce pan combine the remaining oil (from the onions), the Tabasco, the chili pepper, the garlic, salt and pepper and fry on medium heat for a few minutes. Turn down and add the tomato sauce and water, then simmer on medium-low for about 10 minutes, or until slightly thick. When all ingredients are ready, assemble one serving of Koshari by layering a large spoon of the macaroni, rice, and lentils on a plate. Or, using a small mixing bowl as a mold, layer the lentils in the bottom, then the rice, then the macaroni and turn out onto a single serving plate. Sprinkle with the fried onions and several spoons of hot sauce.

raw_meal: Steam the lamb shanks 45 minutes to 1 hour. Make the marinade by mixing the oil,
vinegar, rosemary, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, garlic, salt and pepper in a large
bowl. Marinate the steamed shanks in the sauce for two hours. Barbeque or broil the
meat while basting with the remaining sauce.
LAMB SHANKS.title: LAMB SHANKS
LAMB SHANKS.subtitle: (Old German Recipe)
LAMB SHANKS.instructions: Steam the lamb shanks 45 minutes to 1 hour. Make the marinade by mixing the oil, vinegar, rosemary, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Marinate the steamed shanks in the sauce for two hours. Barbeque or broil the meat while basting with the remaining sauce.

raw_meal: Prepare the meat by sauteing beef and onions in a saute pan until brown. Drain the fat.
Add the tomato sauce and simmer for about 10 minutes. Let cool. Prepare the
bechamel sauce by melting 1 cube of butter in a deep sauce pan. Add the flour and stir
until mixed then cook on medium until light brown. Slowly add the milk to the flour
mixture and beat with an immersion mixer or wire whisk. Beat until thick and set
aside to cool. In a bowl, beat 4 eggs and add salt and pepper. Add to the flour mixture.
In a large pot, bring about 6-8 cups of water to a boil and add the chicken bullion and
1 cube of butter. Add the noodles and add enough water to just cover the noodles.
Simmer on low until all the water is incorporated into the noodles (add a little water if
needed). In a 10 x 13 greased baking dish, mix half of the cooked noodles with half of
the bechamel sauce and layer into the bottom of the dish. Add all of the meat on top,
then mix the rest of the noodles with the remaining bechamel sauce and layer over the
meat. With a sharp knife, cut into 3 inch squares. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes
to one hour.
MACARONA BECHAMEL.title: MACARONA BECHAMEL
MACARONA BECHAMEL.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pasta with Meat)
MACARONA BECHAMEL.instructions: Prepare the meat by sauteing beef and onions in a saute pan until brown. Drain the fat. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for about 10 minutes. Let cool. Prepare the bechamel sauce by melting 1 cube of butter in a deep sauce pan. Add the flour and stir until mixed then cook on medium until light brown. Slowly add the milk to the flour mixture and beat with an immersion mixer or wire whisk. Beat until thick and set aside to cool. In a bowl, beat 4 eggs and add salt and pepper. Add to the flour mixture. In a large pot, bring about 6-8 cups of water to a boil and add the chicken bullion and 1 cube of butter. Add the noodles and add enough water to just cover the noodles. Simmer on low until all the water is incorporated into the noodles (add a little water if needed). In a 10 x 13 greased baking dish, mix half of the cooked noodles with half of the bechamel sauce and layer into the bottom of the dish. Add all of the meat on top, then mix the rest of the noodles with the remaining bechamel sauce and layer over the meat. With a sharp knife, cut into 3 inch squares. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to one hour.

raw_meal: In a microwave-safe casserole dish (with lid), mix all ingredients except meats. Mix
in ground beef and lamb until all ingredients are thoroughly incorporated. Smooth the
top and edges of loaf with fork. Cook on high in microwave for 10-12 minutes or until
meat is completely cooked. Let cool slightly, then top with sliced cheddar cheese.
Variation: add 1/4 c. of any frozen or chopped vegitables like carrots, mushrooms,
peas, corn, or celery.
MEAT LOAF.title: MEAT LOAF
MEAT LOAF.subtitle: (Microwave)
MEAT LOAF.instructions: In a microwave-safe casserole dish (with lid), mix all ingredients except meats. Mix in ground beef and lamb until all ingredients are thoroughly incorporated. Smooth the top and edges of loaf with fork. Cook on high in microwave for 10-12 minutes or until meat is completely cooked. Let cool slightly, then top with sliced cheddar cheese. Variation: add 1/4 c. of any frozen or chopped vegitables like carrots, mushrooms, peas, corn, or celery.

raw_meal: Saute the onion in a little butter until soft. Add the chopped garlic and saute one more
minute. Stir in the browned meat, salt, pepper, coriander and allspice. Add the tomato
paste with a little water and let simmer on medium for about 5 minutes. In the
meantime, sprinkle the eggplant with a little salt and let sit until dry. Brush with a
little oil on each slice and bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Make the Bechamel sauce
and prepare the dish as directed.
In a medium saucepan melt the butter. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for
about 5 minutes with a whisk. Add the milk one cup at a time and the salt, pepper and
nutmeg and let cook for another 5 minutes. Stir the mixture often until thick. Brush
the bottom of a 9 x 12 inch baking pan with a little oil. Place the eggplant slices and
meat in layers, starting and ending with eggplant. Pour the Bechamel sauce over the
top, sprinkle with small pats of butter or olive oil, and bake in a 350 degree oven for
45 minutes, until the top is golden brown and bubbling.
MIS'AA.title: MIS'AA
MIS'AA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Eggplant Casserole)
MIS'AA.instructions: Saute the onion in a little butter until soft. Add the chopped garlic and saute one more minute. Stir in the browned meat, salt, pepper, coriander and allspice. Add the tomato paste with a little water and let simmer on medium for about 5 minutes. In the meantime, sprinkle the eggplant with a little salt and let sit until dry. Brush with a little oil on each slice and bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Make the Bechamel sauce and prepare the dish as directed. In a medium saucepan melt the butter. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for about 5 minutes with a whisk. Add the milk one cup at a time and the salt, pepper and nutmeg and let cook for another 5 minutes. Stir the mixture often until thick. Brush the bottom of a 9 x 12 inch baking pan with a little oil. Place the eggplant slices and meat in layers, starting and ending with eggplant. Pour the Bechamel sauce over the top, sprinkle with small pats of butter or olive oil, and bake in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes, until the top is golden brown and bubbling.

raw_meal: Brown the beef and the onion, drain the fat. Stir in the eggplant, tomatoes,
mushrooms, and seasonings. Cook uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring
occasionally. Put mixture into a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2 inch baking dish. Place eggs, cheese
and yogurt into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour on top of meat and bake at 350
degrees for about 25 minutes or until top is set.
MOUSSAKA.title: MOUSSAKA
MOUSSAKA.subtitle: (Eggplant Casserole)
MOUSSAKA.instructions: Brown the beef and the onion, drain the fat. Stir in the eggplant, tomatoes, mushrooms, and seasonings. Cook uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Put mixture into a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2 inch baking dish. Place eggs, cheese and yogurt into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour on top of meat and bake at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes or until top is set.

raw_meal: Boil the macaroni until tender (about 8 minutes) stirring every few minutes to keep
from sticking together. Drain and keep warm until sauce is ready. To make sauce,
melt the butter in a small saucepan. Add the flour and cook till bubbly. Add 2/3 of the
hot milk and stir with a wire whisk, then add the rest of the milk gradually. Cook,
stirring constantly, until thick. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To assemble,
butter the bottom of a deep casserole dish and layer with half of the macaroni, then
half of the sauce, and half of the cheese. Layer the remaining ingredients, ending with
the cheese on top. Dot with a few pats of butter. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 to
20 minutes, until hot through and bubbly on the edges.
OLD FASHIONED MACARONI AND CHEESE.title: OLD FASHIONED MACARONI AND CHEESE
OLD FASHIONED MACARONI AND CHEESE.instructions: Boil the macaroni until tender (about 8 minutes) stirring every few minutes to keep from sticking together. Drain and keep warm until sauce is ready. To make sauce, melt the butter in a small saucepan. Add the flour and cook till bubbly. Add 2/3 of the hot milk and stir with a wire whisk, then add the rest of the milk gradually. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To assemble, butter the bottom of a deep casserole dish and layer with half of the macaroni, then half of the sauce, and half of the cheese. Layer the remaining ingredients, ending with the cheese on top. Dot with a few pats of butter. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes, until hot through and bubbly on the edges.

raw_meal: Cover the ollass with the lime juice to keep from turning brown and defrost
completely. Set aside until stew is ready. Make the beef stock by bringing to a boil the
steak, water, onion, cardamom pods, salt, pepper, and bullion. Turn the heat down to
medium-low, cover pot and let simmer for about 30 minutes. When the meat is done,
remove the meat, onion and cardamom pods (discard pods) from the soup stock. Add
the ollass to the soup stock and cook for about 20 minutes, or until very tender. In a
small frying pan, melt the butter and saute the garlic and small packet of greens
(collards) from the frozen ollass package just until tender and almost dry. When the
ollass is ready, mix the greens with the soup and cook a few more minutes. Add the
meat back to the ollass or serve along side the stew. Note: The frozen ollass with
packet of greens can be found at Middle Eastern food stores.
OLLASS.title: OLLASS
OLLASS.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Taro Root Stew)
ingredients: 1 pkg. frozen ollass (taro root) and pkt. of
1 lb. beef sirloin steak or other tender
OLLASS.instructions: Cover the ollass with the lime juice to keep from turning brown and defrost completely. Set aside until stew is ready. Make the beef stock by bringing to a boil the steak, water, onion, cardamom pods, salt, pepper, and bullion. Turn the heat down to medium-low, cover pot and let simmer for about 30 minutes. When the meat is done, remove the meat, onion and cardamom pods (discard pods) from the soup stock. Add the ollass to the soup stock and cook for about 20 minutes, or until very tender. In a small frying pan, melt the butter and saute the garlic and small packet of greens (collards) from the frozen ollass package just until tender and almost dry. When the ollass is ready, mix the greens with the soup and cook a few more minutes. Add the meat back to the ollass or serve along side the stew. Note: The frozen ollass with packet of greens can be found at Middle Eastern food stores.

raw_meal: Pour water in small bowl. Add sugar and sprinkle yeast over the top. Let sit in warm
water until the mix is bubbly and active, about 8 minutes. Combine flour and salt in
the bowl of a food processor with a metal blade, pulse to combine. Add yeast-water
mixture and pulse to combine; scrape down sides with spatula. Add olive oil and
continue pulsing until the dough forms a ball. Transfer dough to a floured surface and
kneed 10-12 times with hands until dough is no longer sticky and appears smooth and
elastic. Shape dough into a ball. Transfer dough into a large bowl coated with olive
oil. Cover with plastic wrap and leave in a warm place until dough has doubled in
size, about 1 hour. Punch dough down and knead 3-4 times. Make pizza as directed
below, or split dough into two pieces. Make a flat disk and wrap in plastic. Can be
frozen for up to 3 weeks. Whole wheat variation: substitute 1 cup of white flour for 1
cup whole wheat flour.
Preheat oven to 500 degrees. On a clean surface, sprinkle flour or corn meal and roll
out one ball of dough (1/2 dough recipe) to an 11-inch square. Transfer to a pizza pan
brushed lighly with olive oil. Sprinkle 1/2 of the parmesan cheese on the dough and
arrange the sliced tomatoes evenly over the pizza. Sprinkle the mozzarella on the
tomatoes, then top with the basil. Top with the remaining parmesan and drizzle with
olive oil. Transfer pizza to oven and bake until crust is golden brown and cheese is
bubbly, 16-18 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; slice and serve hot. Vegetarian
variation: Omit the cheeses and substitute with additional vegetables (onions,
zucchini, mushrooms, olives, artichoke heart, or pineapple).
PIZZA MARGARITA.title: PIZZA MARGARITA
PIZZA MARGARITA.subtitle: (Tomatoes, Basil and Mozzarella)
ingredients: 3 c. all-purpose flour, plus more for
PIZZA MARGARITA.instructions: Pour water in small bowl. Add sugar and sprinkle yeast over the top. Let sit in warm water until the mix is bubbly and active, about 8 minutes. Combine flour and salt in the bowl of a food processor with a metal blade, pulse to combine. Add yeast-water mixture and pulse to combine; scrape down sides with spatula. Add olive oil and continue pulsing until the dough forms a ball. Transfer dough to a floured surface and kneed 10-12 times with hands until dough is no longer sticky and appears smooth and elastic. Shape dough into a ball. Transfer dough into a large bowl coated with olive oil. Cover with plastic wrap and leave in a warm place until dough has doubled in size, about 1 hour. Punch dough down and knead 3-4 times. Make pizza as directed below, or split dough into two pieces. Make a flat disk and wrap in plastic. Can be frozen for up to 3 weeks. Whole wheat variation: substitute 1 cup of white flour for 1 cup whole wheat flour. Preheat oven to 500 degrees. On a clean surface, sprinkle flour or corn meal and roll out one ball of dough (1/2 dough recipe) to an 11-inch square. Transfer to a pizza pan brushed lighly with olive oil. Sprinkle 1/2 of the parmesan cheese on the dough and arrange the sliced tomatoes evenly over the pizza. Sprinkle the mozzarella on the tomatoes, then top with the basil. Top with the remaining parmesan and drizzle with olive oil. Transfer pizza to oven and bake until crust is golden brown and cheese is bubbly, 16-18 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; slice and serve hot. Vegetarian variation: Omit the cheeses and substitute with additional vegetables (onions, zucchini, mushrooms, olives, artichoke heart, or pineapple).

raw_meal: Purchase or make pie shell. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Fry the bacon pieces until
crisp, then remove from pan and lay on a paper towel. Sprinkle bacon into bottom of
pie shell, then sprinkle cheese over bacon. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs for 1-2
minutes with a whisk, then add half-and-half or milk and other ingredients and mix
gently. Place pie shell into oven and pour egg mixture into pie shell. Bake 45-50
minutes until firm and light golden brown on top. Variations: Other ingredients may
be substituted for bacon, such as chopped cooked spinach, broccoli, squash, onions,
ham, pancetta or prosciutto. Cheddar or other cheeses may be substituted for Swiss
cheese.
QUICHE LORRAINE.title: QUICHE LORRAINE
ingredients: 1 pie shell (see recipe in This and That)
QUICHE LORRAINE.instructions: Purchase or make pie shell. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Fry the bacon pieces until crisp, then remove from pan and lay on a paper towel. Sprinkle bacon into bottom of pie shell, then sprinkle cheese over bacon. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs for 1-2 minutes with a whisk, then add half-and-half or milk and other ingredients and mix gently. Place pie shell into oven and pour egg mixture into pie shell. Bake 45-50 minutes until firm and light golden brown on top. Variations: Other ingredients may be substituted for bacon, such as chopped cooked spinach, broccoli, squash, onions, ham, pancetta or prosciutto. Cheddar or other cheeses may be substituted for Swiss cheese.

raw_meal: With a long, sharp knife, cut a hole lenthwise down the center of the eye round.
Sprinkle some salt and pepper onto the garlic. Push the garlic cloves into the hole
until filled from end to end. Sprinkle with salt and pepper on outside of roast. Place in
a roasting pan, top with a small piece of butter in the shape of a cross. Cover and bake
in 350 degree oven for 3 hours. Cool slightly then slice thinly crosswise. Serve hot or
cold.
ROAST BEEF.title: ROAST BEEF
ROAST BEEF.instructions: With a long, sharp knife, cut a hole lenthwise down the center of the eye round. Sprinkle some salt and pepper onto the garlic. Push the garlic cloves into the hole until filled from end to end. Sprinkle with salt and pepper on outside of roast. Place in a roasting pan, top with a small piece of butter in the shape of a cross. Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 3 hours. Cool slightly then slice thinly crosswise. Serve hot or cold.

raw_meal: In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. To make pizzas, roll out one ball of dough
to about 8 inches in diameter and place on a baking sheet. Spoon some of the filling
over the dough. Drizzle top with a little olive oil. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 15-20
minutes, or until dough is cooked and topping is bubbly.
SAFEEHA.title: SAFEEHA
SAFEEHA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Flat Bread Pizzas)
SAFEEHA.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the semolina and white flours. (If using the garbanzo bean flour, reduce white flour to 3/4 cups.) In a small bowl, combine the yeast with 1/4 c. warm water and the sugar. Add the yeast mixture to the flour, along with the water and olive oil. Mix well and turn out onto a floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth. Set aside to rise for 1/2 hour. Cut the dough into four equal pieces and make into a smooth ball then flatten with fingers. Set aside on a floured surface for 15 minutes to rise. In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. To make pizzas, roll out one ball of dough to about 8 inches in diameter and place on a baking sheet. Spoon some of the filling over the dough. Drizzle top with a little olive oil. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until dough is cooked and topping is bubbly.

raw_meal: Lay the salmon filet in a lightly greased baking pan. Mix all ingredients together and
place on top of salmon. Bake in 350 degree oven for 35-40 minutes.
SALMON WITH VEGETABLES.title: SALMON WITH VEGETABLES
SALMON WITH VEGETABLES.instructions: Lay the salmon filet in a lightly greased baking pan. Mix all ingredients together and place on top of salmon. Bake in 350 degree oven for 35-40 minutes.

raw_meal: In a 9 x 12 inch baking dish combine all the ingredients except the fish and mix well.
Cover the fish in the tomato spice mix and arrange in the bottom of the baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until fish is flaky and tender. Serve hot
over steamed rice.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the semolina and white flours. (If using the garbanzo
bean flour, reduce white flour to 3/4 cups.) In a small bowl, combine the yeast with
1/4 c. warm water and the sugar. Add the yeast mixture to the flour, along with the
water and olive oil. Mix well and turn out onto a floured surface. Knead until dough is
smooth. Set aside to rise for 1/2 hour. Cut the dough into four equal pieces and make
into a smooth ball then flatten with fingers. Set aside on a floured surface for 15
minutes to rise.
SAMAK BIL CAMUN.title: SAMAK BIL CAMUN
SAMAK BIL CAMUN.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Fish Fillet With Cumin)
ingredients: 1 lb. fresh fish fillets (cod, red snapper or
SAMAK BIL CAMUN.instructions: In a 9 x 12 inch baking dish combine all the ingredients except the fish and mix well. Cover the fish in the tomato spice mix and arrange in the bottom of the baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until fish is flaky and tender. Serve hot over steamed rice. In a large mixing bowl, combine the semolina and white flours. (If using the garbanzo bean flour, reduce white flour to 3/4 cups.) In a small bowl, combine the yeast with 1/4 c. warm water and the sugar. Add the yeast mixture to the flour, along with the water and olive oil. Mix well and turn out onto a floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth. Set aside to rise for 1/2 hour. Cut the dough into four equal pieces and make into a smooth ball then flatten with fingers. Set aside on a floured surface for 15 minutes to rise.

raw_meal: Cut the sausage into 1/4 inch pieces. In a hot frying pan, add a little olive oil and saute
the sausage until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the sausage to a bowl
and set aside. To the hot pan, add a little more olive oil and all other ingredients
except wine, saute until tender, stirring frequently. Add the sausage to the vegetables
and cook together on medium hot for another 5 minutes, then add wine and place lid
on pan. Saute for a few more minutes, stirring once or twice. Serve over steamed rice
or lentils.
SAUSAGE SAUTE.title: SAUSAGE SAUTE
SAUSAGE SAUTE.instructions: Cut the sausage into 1/4 inch pieces. In a hot frying pan, add a little olive oil and saute the sausage until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the sausage to a bowl and set aside. To the hot pan, add a little more olive oil and all other ingredients except wine, saute until tender, stirring frequently. Add the sausage to the vegetables and cook together on medium hot for another 5 minutes, then add wine and place lid on pan. Saute for a few more minutes, stirring once or twice. Serve over steamed rice or lentils.

raw_meal: Brown the ground beef and onion until well cooked. Add the salt and pepper and
tomato sauce and simmer for about 5-6 minutes. Defrost the spinach . Drain well and
then squeeze out the water. In a separate saute pan, melt the butter and add the garlic.
Cook the garlic for about a minute, then add the spinach. Saute on medium-high,
stirring, until the mixture is very dry. When done, add the spinach to the meat and
mix.mix.mix.mix.
In a medium sauce pan, melt the butter. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for
2-3 minutes. Add the milk, salt and pepper and let cook for about five minutes. Stir
the mixture often until thick. In a large deep baking dish, put the meat and spinach
mixture in the bottom. Pour the béchamel sauce over the meat, sprinkle with small
pats of butter or olive oil, and bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Top should be golden
brown.
SPINACH B\u00c9CHAMEL.title: SPINACH BÉCHAMEL
SPINACH B\u00c9CHAMEL.instructions: Brown the ground beef and onion until well cooked. Add the salt and pepper and tomato sauce and simmer for about 5-6 minutes. Defrost the spinach . Drain well and then squeeze out the water. In a separate saute pan, melt the butter and add the garlic. Cook the garlic for about a minute, then add the spinach. Saute on medium-high, stirring, until the mixture is very dry. When done, add the spinach to the meat and mix.mix.mix.mix. In a medium sauce pan, melt the butter. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for 2-3 minutes. Add the milk, salt and pepper and let cook for about five minutes. Stir the mixture often until thick. In a large deep baking dish, put the meat and spinach mixture in the bottom. Pour the béchamel sauce over the meat, sprinkle with small pats of butter or olive oil, and bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Top should be golden brown.

raw_meal: Mix the marinade in a food processor. Add the salt, pepper, red pepper, ginger, and
garlic and whirl 10-15 seconds. Add the soy sauce and olive oil and whirl until mixed
with the other ingredients. Cover the meat with the marinade mixture and place in a
plastic bag in the refrigerator and let sit over night. To cook, preheat the oven to 450
degrees and place the meat and the marinade in an uncovered roasting pan in the oven
for 15 minutes. Turn the meat on the other side for another 15 minutes. Reduce heat
to 325 degrees, and cover meat with the lid or foil. Cook for another 1 hour (to 1 1/2
hours depending on how well you prefer your meat).
TRI-TIP ROAST.title: TRI-TIP ROAST
TRI-TIP ROAST.subtitle: (Marinated)
ingredients: 1 tsp. crushed red pepper (or to taste)
1-2 T. fresh ginger, pealed and chopped
TRI-TIP ROAST.instructions: Mix the marinade in a food processor. Add the salt, pepper, red pepper, ginger, and garlic and whirl 10-15 seconds. Add the soy sauce and olive oil and whirl until mixed with the other ingredients. Cover the meat with the marinade mixture and place in a plastic bag in the refrigerator and let sit over night. To cook, preheat the oven to 450 degrees and place the meat and the marinade in an uncovered roasting pan in the oven for 15 minutes. Turn the meat on the other side for another 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees, and cover meat with the lid or foil. Cook for another 1 hour (to 1 1/2 hours depending on how well you prefer your meat).

raw_meal: In a saute pan, heat the oil and add the vegetables and seasonings. Saute together for
3-4 minutes. Add the tuna and continue sauteing for several more minutes. Serve hot
with pita bread.
TUNA WITH CURRY.title: TUNA WITH CURRY
ingredients: 2 cans albacore or other high quality tuna
TUNA WITH CURRY.instructions: In a saute pan, heat the oil and add the vegetables and seasonings. Saute together for 3-4 minutes. Add the tuna and continue sauteing for several more minutes. Serve hot with pita bread.

raw_meal: In a large bowl, mix the ground meat, onion, rice, 1/2 cube melted butter (this can be
omitted, if desired), salt and pepper. Take the grape leaves out of the jar and lay flat in
a colander which is sitting in another larger bowl. Boil some water and pour over the
grape leaves to loosen. Let grape leaves sit for 1-2 minutes then drain the water.
Gently pull apart the grape leaves, working with one or two at a time. Lay a grape leaf
(with the ruff side up) on the table and snip off the stem at the base. Take 1-2 T. of the
beef mixture and with your hands, roll the meat to make a small roll about 2 inches
long (adjust the amount of meat depending on the size of the grape leaf). Place the
meat across the wide part of the leaf just where the stem was. Roll the leaf up like a
burrito, folding in the sides and keeping it as tight as possible. Place the rolls in a
large deep sauce pan, packed one next to the other. When the bottom of the pan is
filled, sprinkle several sliced pieces of the garlic and some small pats of butter over
the layer, then start a new layer of rolls. When all of the grape leaves are rolled,
dissolve the bullion in 2-3 cups of boiling water (or just enough to cover the grape
leaves) and pour over the grape leaves. Cover the pan, bring to a boil, then
immediately turn down to very low and let simmer one hour or until tender. **For
extra flavor if desired, lamb bones can be placed in the bottom of the pan before
putting the grape leaves in.
WARA EINAB #1.title: WARA EINAB #1
WARA EINAB #1.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Stuffed Grape Leaves)
ingredients: 1 lb. ground beef (or mixture of ground
WARA EINAB #1.instructions: In a large bowl, mix the ground meat, onion, rice, 1/2 cube melted butter (this can be omitted, if desired), salt and pepper. Take the grape leaves out of the jar and lay flat in a colander which is sitting in another larger bowl. Boil some water and pour over the grape leaves to loosen. Let grape leaves sit for 1-2 minutes then drain the water. Gently pull apart the grape leaves, working with one or two at a time. Lay a grape leaf (with the ruff side up) on the table and snip off the stem at the base. Take 1-2 T. of the beef mixture and with your hands, roll the meat to make a small roll about 2 inches long (adjust the amount of meat depending on the size of the grape leaf). Place the meat across the wide part of the leaf just where the stem was. Roll the leaf up like a burrito, folding in the sides and keeping it as tight as possible. Place the rolls in a large deep sauce pan, packed one next to the other. When the bottom of the pan is filled, sprinkle several sliced pieces of the garlic and some small pats of butter over the layer, then start a new layer of rolls. When all of the grape leaves are rolled, dissolve the bullion in 2-3 cups of boiling water (or just enough to cover the grape leaves) and pour over the grape leaves. Cover the pan, bring to a boil, then immediately turn down to very low and let simmer one hour or until tender. **For extra flavor if desired, lamb bones can be placed in the bottom of the pan before putting the grape leaves in.

raw_meal: For the stuffing, thoroughly mix the beef, onions, rice (all uncooked), tomato sauce,
salt and pepper. Prepare the grape leaves by removing them from the jar and placing
in a colander that is sitting in another, larger bowl. Pour about 2 cups (or enough to
cover) of boiling water over the leaves and let them sit in the water for a few minutes.
Drain the water and gently pull apart the leaves one by one. To stuff the leaves, place
one leaf on a clean working surface with the rough side up and the stem toward you.
Pinch off the stem at the base. Place about 1 tablespoon of meat mixture on the leaf
near the stem side. Roll the leaf over the stuffing, then fold in the sides, and finish
rolling the leaf until completely rolled around the stuffing. Keep the roll tight. Set the
rolled leaves in a large soup kettle side by side snugly so that the leaves do not unroll
during cooking. After each layer, place a few pats of butter over the top and continue
with the next layer until all the leaves are placed in the pan. Add the broth and lime
juice to the pan and bring to a boil. Immediately turn down to low and let simmer for
45-60 minutes until tender.
WARA EINAB #2.title: WARA EINAB #2
WARA EINAB #2.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Stuffed Grape Leaves)
WARA EINAB #2.instructions: For the stuffing, thoroughly mix the beef, onions, rice (all uncooked), tomato sauce, salt and pepper. Prepare the grape leaves by removing them from the jar and placing in a colander that is sitting in another, larger bowl. Pour about 2 cups (or enough to cover) of boiling water over the leaves and let them sit in the water for a few minutes. Drain the water and gently pull apart the leaves one by one. To stuff the leaves, place one leaf on a clean working surface with the rough side up and the stem toward you. Pinch off the stem at the base. Place about 1 tablespoon of meat mixture on the leaf near the stem side. Roll the leaf over the stuffing, then fold in the sides, and finish rolling the leaf until completely rolled around the stuffing. Keep the roll tight. Set the rolled leaves in a large soup kettle side by side snugly so that the leaves do not unroll during cooking. After each layer, place a few pats of butter over the top and continue with the next layer until all the leaves are placed in the pan. Add the broth and lime juice to the pan and bring to a boil. Immediately turn down to low and let simmer for 45-60 minutes until tender.

raw_meal: In a mixing bowl, mix together 1 1/4 cups of the flour and the yeast. In a saucepan
heat the water, butter, and salt until warm and the butter just begins to melt. Add to
the flour and yeast mixture. With an electric mixer, beat on low for about 30 seconds,
scraping bowl. Beat on high for another 3 minutes. Using a spoon, add the remaining
flour a little at a time, mixing as much as you can. Turn out onto a floured board and
knead in remaining flour. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic (about 3-5
minutes). Cover and let rise in a warm place for 15 minutes. Divide the dough into 12
equal portions. Working with well floured hands, take one piece at a time and make a
very smooth ball. Cover the balls with plastic wrap and let sit for 10 minutes. Gently
flatten balls with your fingers, making sure not to crease dough. Cover and let sit for
10 minutes. Keep covered until ready to use. On a floured surface, lightly roll one
dough ball into a 5- to 7-inch round, turning dough over once while rolling. Do not
stretch, puncture or crease dough. Repeat rolling with another ball. Keep surface well
floured. Place two dough rounds on a preheated ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a
450 degree oven about 3 minutes or until bread is puffed. Turn over with a wide
spatula. Bake about 2 more minutes or until bread begins to lightly brown. Cool
slightly on a wire rack. While still warm, place bread in a paper bag to keep it soft and
moist. Repeat with remaining dough balls.
AESH BALADY.title: AESH BALADY
AESH BALADY.subtitle: (Pita Bread)
AESH BALADY.instructions: In a mixing bowl, mix together 1 1/4 cups of the flour and the yeast. In a saucepan heat the water, butter, and salt until warm and the butter just begins to melt. Add to the flour and yeast mixture. With an electric mixer, beat on low for about 30 seconds, scraping bowl. Beat on high for another 3 minutes. Using a spoon, add the remaining flour a little at a time, mixing as much as you can. Turn out onto a floured board and knead in remaining flour. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic (about 3-5 minutes). Cover and let rise in a warm place for 15 minutes. Divide the dough into 12 equal portions. Working with well floured hands, take one piece at a time and make a very smooth ball. Cover the balls with plastic wrap and let sit for 10 minutes. Gently flatten balls with your fingers, making sure not to crease dough. Cover and let sit for 10 minutes. Keep covered until ready to use. On a floured surface, lightly roll one dough ball into a 5- to 7-inch round, turning dough over once while rolling. Do not stretch, puncture or crease dough. Repeat rolling with another ball. Keep surface well floured. Place two dough rounds on a preheated ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a 450 degree oven about 3 minutes or until bread is puffed. Turn over with a wide spatula. Bake about 2 more minutes or until bread begins to lightly brown. Cool slightly on a wire rack. While still warm, place bread in a paper bag to keep it soft and moist. Repeat with remaining dough balls.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, mix all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl or stand mixer,
slightly beat the eggs, then add the oil and banana and mix well. Add the flour
mixture to the banana mixture a little at a time and mix until well incorporated. Turn
into a greased bread pan or cupcake tin. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.
BANANA BREAD.title: BANANA BREAD
ingredients: 1/3 c. vegetable or light olive oil
BANANA BREAD.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mix all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl or stand mixer, slightly beat the eggs, then add the oil and banana and mix well. Add the flour mixture to the banana mixture a little at a time and mix until well incorporated. Turn into a greased bread pan or cupcake tin. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.

raw_meal: In a stand mixer on low, mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and shortening. Add the
milk and beat just until batter is mixed and sticks to beaters. Turn dough out onto a
floured surface and knead well until smooth, about 20 times. Pat or roll dough to
1/2-inch thickness, then cut with floured 2-inch biscuit cutter. Place on a greased
baking sheet and brush with melted butter, if desired. Bake at 450 degrees for 12 to 15
minutes. Serve hot. Vegetarian variation: Use shortening instead of butter and water
instead of milk. Omit melted butter.
BISCUITS.title: BISCUITS
BISCUITS.instructions: In a stand mixer on low, mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and shortening. Add the milk and beat just until batter is mixed and sticks to beaters. Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead well until smooth, about 20 times. Pat or roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness, then cut with floured 2-inch biscuit cutter. Place on a greased baking sheet and brush with melted butter, if desired. Bake at 450 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Serve hot. Vegetarian variation: Use shortening instead of butter and water instead of milk. Omit melted butter.

raw_meal: Mix the dry ingredients and sift 5 or 6 times. In a separate bowl, whip the eggs and
then add to the buttermilk. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry, then add the butter,
stirring until incorporated. Chill in refrigerator for 1/2 hour. Heat griddle then spread
lightly with oil or butter. Drop about 1/4 c. to 1/3 c. of batter onto griddle. Cook on
one side until light golden brown on bottom, then flip. Cook until golden brown.
BUTTERMILK PANCAKES.title: BUTTERMILK PANCAKES
BUTTERMILK PANCAKES.instructions: Mix the dry ingredients and sift 5 or 6 times. In a separate bowl, whip the eggs and then add to the buttermilk. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry, then add the butter, stirring until incorporated. Chill in refrigerator for 1/2 hour. Heat griddle then spread lightly with oil or butter. Drop about 1/4 c. to 1/3 c. of batter onto griddle. Cook on one side until light golden brown on bottom, then flip. Cook until golden brown.

raw_meal: Make 1 recipe of white bread (see this section). After letting dough rise, punch down
and divide into 24 equal pieces. Form each piece into a ball and place in a greased
muffin tin. With scissors, cut each piece in half, then into quarters. Let dough rise in a
warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Bake rolls at 400 degrees for 25 to 30
minutes or until golden brown. After 15 minutes, brush each roll with lightly beaten
egg, then return to oven until done.
DINNER ROLLS.title: DINNER ROLLS
DINNER ROLLS.instructions: Make 1 recipe of white bread (see this section). After letting dough rise, punch down and divide into 24 equal pieces. Form each piece into a ball and place in a greased muffin tin. With scissors, cut each piece in half, then into quarters. Let dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Bake rolls at 400 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. After 15 minutes, brush each roll with lightly beaten egg, then return to oven until done.

raw_meal: 4 tsp. active dry yeast (two 1/4 oz.
Simmer the raisins in the Marsala in a small sauce pan for 2 minutes. Remove from
heat and let stand until cooled. Meanwhile, stir together the warm milk and 2 tsp. of
sugar in a bowl of a mixer. Sprinkle yeast over mixture and let stand until foamy,
about 5 minutes. (If yeast doesn't foam, discard and start over again with new yeast.)
Add 1/4 cup flour and beat at medium speed until combined. Add whole eggs, yolk,
zest, lemon juice, salt, and remaining 2/3 c. sugar and beat until incorporated.
Reduced speed to low, then mix in remaining 3 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time. Increase
speed to medium-high, then gradually beat in butter, a few pieces at a time, and
continue to beat until dough is shiny and forms strands from paddle to bowl, 4 to 6
minutes. Drain raisins, discarding Marsala, then add to dough along with the apricots
or candied citron and mix at low speed until incorporated. Scrape dough into a lightly
oiled bowl and cover bowl with plastic wrap. Let dough rise in a draft-free place at
warm room temperature until doubled in size, 2 to 3 hours. While dough rises, prepare
2 parchment paper pans (available at specialty stores) by spraying the inside lightly
with cooking spray. If using 2 coffee cans, spray inside of cans and line bottom and
side of each with parchment (use a round for bottom and a rectangle for side). Punch
down dough with lightly floured hands and turn out onto a lightly floured surface.
Halve dough and scoop 1 half into each pan or coffee can, tapping or pressing down
gently to expel any air bubbles. Loosely cover with lightly buttered plastic wrap. Let
dough rise in a warm place until dough reaches top, 2 to 3 hours. Put oven rack in
lower third of oven and preheat over to 375 degrees. When dough has risen, in a small
bowl, beat together the yolk and water and lightly brush top of dough with egg wash.
Bake until tops are deep golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer loaves to a rack.
Can be served warm or cold, or sliced and toasted.
PANETTONE.title: PANETTONE
PANETTONE.subtitle: (Italian Holiday Bread)
ingredients: 1 stick unsalted butter, cut into 8 pieces
1 c. diced dried apricots or candied citron
PANETTONE.instructions: 4 tsp. active dry yeast (two 1/4 oz. Simmer the raisins in the Marsala in a small sauce pan for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand until cooled. Meanwhile, stir together the warm milk and 2 tsp. of sugar in a bowl of a mixer. Sprinkle yeast over mixture and let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. (If yeast doesn't foam, discard and start over again with new yeast.) Add 1/4 cup flour and beat at medium speed until combined. Add whole eggs, yolk, zest, lemon juice, salt, and remaining 2/3 c. sugar and beat until incorporated. Reduced speed to low, then mix in remaining 3 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time. Increase speed to medium-high, then gradually beat in butter, a few pieces at a time, and continue to beat until dough is shiny and forms strands from paddle to bowl, 4 to 6 minutes. Drain raisins, discarding Marsala, then add to dough along with the apricots or candied citron and mix at low speed until incorporated. Scrape dough into a lightly oiled bowl and cover bowl with plastic wrap. Let dough rise in a draft-free place at warm room temperature until doubled in size, 2 to 3 hours. While dough rises, prepare 2 parchment paper pans (available at specialty stores) by spraying the inside lightly with cooking spray. If using 2 coffee cans, spray inside of cans and line bottom and side of each with parchment (use a round for bottom and a rectangle for side). Punch down dough with lightly floured hands and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Halve dough and scoop 1 half into each pan or coffee can, tapping or pressing down gently to expel any air bubbles. Loosely cover with lightly buttered plastic wrap. Let dough rise in a warm place until dough reaches top, 2 to 3 hours. Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat over to 375 degrees. When dough has risen, in a small bowl, beat together the yolk and water and lightly brush top of dough with egg wash. Bake until tops are deep golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer loaves to a rack. Can be served warm or cold, or sliced and toasted.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, mix the dry ingredients (except fruit and nuts). With your
hands, mix in the butter pieces quickly until completely incorporated into the flour.
Mix in the fruit and nuts then add the milk, stirring with a fork. Turn out onto a lightly
floured surface and knead a few times until the dough forms into a ball. With hands or
rolling pin make a 1/2 inch thick round and cut into wedges or cut with biscuit cutter.
Place each piece on a cookie sheet, keeping about 1/2 inch between, and bake at 375
degrees for 15-20 minutes or until medium brown. Remove from oven and cool
slightly. Sprinkle with a little powdered sugar. Vegetarian variation: Use the
margarine or shortening instead of butter, and water instead of milk.
SCONES.title: SCONES
ingredients: 1/4 c. cold butter, cube margarine, or
1/2 c. raisins, dried cranberries, or apricot
SCONES.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mix the dry ingredients (except fruit and nuts). With your hands, mix in the butter pieces quickly until completely incorporated into the flour. Mix in the fruit and nuts then add the milk, stirring with a fork. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead a few times until the dough forms into a ball. With hands or rolling pin make a 1/2 inch thick round and cut into wedges or cut with biscuit cutter. Place each piece on a cookie sheet, keeping about 1/2 inch between, and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until medium brown. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Sprinkle with a little powdered sugar. Vegetarian variation: Use the margarine or shortening instead of butter, and water instead of milk.

raw_meal: black pepper, crushed rosemary, coarse ground fennel seeds, garlic powder, or
black pepper, crushed rosemary, coarse ground fennel seeds, garlic powder, or
crushed dried oregano.
Place all dry ingredients except sugar in a medium bowl and mix. In a large bowl,
cream the butter and sugar and add egg yolks and vanilla and mix well. In a separate
bowl, whip the egg whites until stiff. Alternate adding the strawberries and the dry
ingredients to the egg mixture. Mix well. Fold in the stiff egg whites and fold in the
nuts. Divide the dough between two greased bread pans. Bake at 325 degrees for 50
minutes until toothpick comes out clean.
STRAWBERRY BREAD.title: STRAWBERRY BREAD
STRAWBERRY BREAD.instructions: Place all dry ingredients except sugar in a medium bowl and mix. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar and add egg yolks and vanilla and mix well. In a separate bowl, whip the egg whites until stiff. Alternate adding the strawberries and the dry ingredients to the egg mixture. Mix well. Fold in the stiff egg whites and fold in the nuts. Divide the dough between two greased bread pans. Bake at 325 degrees for 50 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.

raw_meal: In a small sauce pan, place the milk, sugar, salt and butter and heat over low heat until
butter melts and sugar dissolves. Cool to lukewarm. Dissolve yeast in warm water and
let sit for 5 minutes until bubbles form. Add yeast to the warm milk mixture and add 4
c. flour 1 cup at a time, stirring well between cups. With last 1 cup of flour, use hands
or a stand mixer with a dough-hook attached to kneed dough for 1-2 minutes.
Continue kneading and add remaining flour until dough is thick. (Dough will be
slightly sticky.) Place dough into a greased bowl, turning to grease the top. Cover and
let rise in a warm place about 1 hour, or until doubled in size. Punch dough down and
divide in half. Shape each half into a loaf by first rolling out on a lightly floured
surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 9 by12-inch rectangle. From the short
end, roll dough onto itself and tuck in ends. Place into a greased bread loaf pan
seam-side down. Cover and let rise in a warm place about 1 hour or until doubled in
bulk. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pans
immediately and cool on wire racks.
WHITE BREAD.title: WHITE BREAD
WHITE BREAD.instructions: In a small sauce pan, place the milk, sugar, salt and butter and heat over low heat until butter melts and sugar dissolves. Cool to lukewarm. Dissolve yeast in warm water and let sit for 5 minutes until bubbles form. Add yeast to the warm milk mixture and add 4 c. flour 1 cup at a time, stirring well between cups. With last 1 cup of flour, use hands or a stand mixer with a dough-hook attached to kneed dough for 1-2 minutes. Continue kneading and add remaining flour until dough is thick. (Dough will be slightly sticky.) Place dough into a greased bowl, turning to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place about 1 hour, or until doubled in size. Punch dough down and divide in half. Shape each half into a loaf by first rolling out on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 9 by12-inch rectangle. From the short end, roll dough onto itself and tuck in ends. Place into a greased bread loaf pan seam-side down. Cover and let rise in a warm place about 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pans immediately and cool on wire racks.

raw_meal: In a food processor, mix the flour, 1/2 tsp. salt, and sugar. Cut in the butter until the
mix resembles a course powder. Add the milk and mix a few more minutes. Turn out
onto a floured board and kneed several times. Roll out to 1/8 inch thickness. With a
floured round cookie cutter, cut out crackers and place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle
with a little sea salt before baking. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes, until
light golden brown. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine or olive oil instead of butter,
and water instead of milk. Flavor variations: To flour add 1-2 tsp. course ground
WHITE CRACKERS.title: WHITE CRACKERS
ingredients: 1 T. butter, margarine or extra virgin
1/3 c. plus 1 T. milk or water
WHITE CRACKERS.instructions: In a food processor, mix the flour, 1/2 tsp. salt, and sugar. Cut in the butter until the mix resembles a course powder. Add the milk and mix a few more minutes. Turn out onto a floured board and kneed several times. Roll out to 1/8 inch thickness. With a floured round cookie cutter, cut out crackers and place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with a little sea salt before baking. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes, until light golden brown. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine or olive oil instead of butter, and water instead of milk. Flavor variations: To flour add 1-2 tsp. course ground black pepper, crushed rosemary, coarse ground fennel seeds, garlic powder, or crushed dried oregano.

raw_meal: Cut the baguettes into 1/2 to 3/4 inch-thick rounds. To make the syrup, combine the
water, sugar and lemon juice in a heavy sauce pan until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a
boil and let cook stirring constantly for about 10minutes or until slightly thickened.
Set aside on low to keep warm. Pour milk in a mixing bowl. In a frying skillet, melt 1
T. of butter at a time until hot and slightly browned. Dip 4-5 of the bread rounds in
the milk until soaked. Gently squeeze excess milk out of each bread round and place
in the hot butter. Fry until deep golden brown, then turn over once and cook until
golden brown. Remove each bread round and drop into syrup until lightly covered.
Remove and plate. Whip the cream until thick. Top each "aesh" piece with a
tablespoon of whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Serve immediately while
hot.hot.hot.hot.
AESH SARAYA.title: AESH SARAYA
AESH SARAYA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Fried Bread)
AESH SARAYA.instructions: Cut the baguettes into 1/2 to 3/4 inch-thick rounds. To make the syrup, combine the water, sugar and lemon juice in a heavy sauce pan until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil and let cook stirring constantly for about 10minutes or until slightly thickened. Set aside on low to keep warm. Pour milk in a mixing bowl. In a frying skillet, melt 1 T. of butter at a time until hot and slightly browned. Dip 4-5 of the bread rounds in the milk until soaked. Gently squeeze excess milk out of each bread round and place in the hot butter. Fry until deep golden brown, then turn over once and cook until golden brown. Remove each bread round and drop into syrup until lightly covered. Remove and plate. Whip the cream until thick. Top each "aesh" piece with a tablespoon of whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Serve immediately while hot.hot.hot.hot.

raw_meal: In a 9 x 13-inch baking pan, place the sliced apples evenly in the pan (careful not to
fill the pan to top). Sprinkle with sugar and the spices, then dot with butter pieces
evenly over top.
Mix the sugar, baking powder and flour. Cut in the butter and add the egg. The
consistency will be like a pie dough, but crumbly. Sprinkle the topping mixture
evenly over the apples. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 35 to 40 minutes.
Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter and substitute 1/4 c. apple sauce
for the egg.
APPLE STRUDEL.title: APPLE STRUDEL
APPLE STRUDEL.instructions: In a 9 x 13-inch baking pan, place the sliced apples evenly in the pan (careful not to fill the pan to top). Sprinkle with sugar and the spices, then dot with butter pieces evenly over top. Mix the sugar, baking powder and flour. Cut in the butter and add the egg. The consistency will be like a pie dough, but crumbly. Sprinkle the topping mixture evenly over the apples. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 35 to 40 minutes. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter and substitute 1/4 c. apple sauce for the egg.

raw_meal: To make the syrup, in a small sauce pan combine the sugar and the water. Sir until the
sugar is dissolved. Bring it to a boil and add the lemon juice. Keep stirring and bring
to a boil and boil, stirring frequently, until it is somewhat thickened (but not too
thick). Set the syrup aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix the coconut,
raisins, and chopped nuts together in a small bowl. Brush a cookie sheet with a little
melted butter as your working surface. Lay two sheets of the filo dough on the pan
and brush with butter. Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the nut mixture onto the long
edge of the filo dough sheets. Working from the edge with the nuts, roll the filo dough
very tightly, folding the edges in just slightly to help keep the ingredients from falling
out. Set the roll aside on another cookie sheet. Repeat this until all the filo sheets (two
at a time) and the nuts are gone. After all the filo is rolled, cut it into 2-3 inch lengths.
(This works best with an electric knife or a sharp serated bread knife.) Place all the
small baklava rolls one right next to the other into a 9 x 1 2 inch rectangular baking
dish and brush with the remaining butter. Bake for 30-45 minutes until golden brown.
When just out of the oven, pour the completely cooled syrup over the hot baklava. Let
cool in the pan and serve. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.
BAKLAVA #1.title: BAKLAVA #1
BAKLAVA #1.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Sweet Pastry)
BAKLAVA #1.instructions: To make the syrup, in a small sauce pan combine the sugar and the water. Sir until the sugar is dissolved. Bring it to a boil and add the lemon juice. Keep stirring and bring to a boil and boil, stirring frequently, until it is somewhat thickened (but not too thick). Set the syrup aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix the coconut, raisins, and chopped nuts together in a small bowl. Brush a cookie sheet with a little melted butter as your working surface. Lay two sheets of the filo dough on the pan and brush with butter. Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the nut mixture onto the long edge of the filo dough sheets. Working from the edge with the nuts, roll the filo dough very tightly, folding the edges in just slightly to help keep the ingredients from falling out. Set the roll aside on another cookie sheet. Repeat this until all the filo sheets (two at a time) and the nuts are gone. After all the filo is rolled, cut it into 2-3 inch lengths. (This works best with an electric knife or a sharp serated bread knife.) Place all the small baklava rolls one right next to the other into a 9 x 1 2 inch rectangular baking dish and brush with the remaining butter. Bake for 30-45 minutes until golden brown. When just out of the oven, pour the completely cooled syrup over the hot baklava. Let cool in the pan and serve. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.

raw_meal: In a mixing bowl, combine the nuts, sugar, coconut, cinnamon and vanilla. Brush a
cookie tray with a little melted butter. Using another tray to roll the filo, place two filo
sheets on the tray and brush with melted butter. Cover with another two filo sheets
and brush with a little melted butter (making four sheets all together). Put a line of the
nut mixture on the long edge of the filo. Roll the filo over the nuts until the whole
