sheet is rolled. Cut the roll into 5 equal pieces. Move the cut rolls to the baking tray
and brush each with a little melted butter. Repeat until all the filo and nuts are rolled.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour or until golden brown.
While the pastry is baking, in a small saucepan, dissolve the sugar in the water and
add the lime and vanilla. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer
for about 20 minutes, stirring often until slightly thickened. Set aside to cool
completely. Remove the pastry from the oven when done and spoon a little cold syrup
over each roll. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.
While the cake is baking, in a small sauce pan, mix the sugar, water, lemon and
vanilla and cook on medium-low heat for about 10 minutes. Stir constantly until
slightly thickened. Remove from heat and cool. After the cake is removed from oven
and cut, but still hot, pour cooled syrup over cake and let soak in. Serve warm or cold.
BAKLAVA #2.title: BAKLAVA #2
BAKLAVA #2.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pastry)
ingredients: 3/4 lb. hazel nuts, toasted and finely
BAKLAVA #2.instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the nuts, sugar, coconut, cinnamon and vanilla. Brush a cookie tray with a little melted butter. Using another tray to roll the filo, place two filo sheets on the tray and brush with melted butter. Cover with another two filo sheets and brush with a little melted butter (making four sheets all together). Put a line of the nut mixture on the long edge of the filo. Roll the filo over the nuts until the whole sheet is rolled. Cut the roll into 5 equal pieces. Move the cut rolls to the baking tray and brush each with a little melted butter. Repeat until all the filo and nuts are rolled. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour or until golden brown. While the pastry is baking, in a small saucepan, dissolve the sugar in the water and add the lime and vanilla. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring often until slightly thickened. Set aside to cool completely. Remove the pastry from the oven when done and spoon a little cold syrup over each roll. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.

CARAMEL PUMPKIN PIE.title: CARAMEL PUMPKIN PIE
ingredients: 1 Pastry dough for single pie crust (see recipe in This and That)
CARAMEL PUMPKIN PIE.instructions: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 14-inch round, then fit into quiche pan, being careful not to stretch the dough. Trim excess dough flush with rim of pan. Chill until firm, about 30 minutes. Lightly prick bottom of pie shell all over with a fork, then line with foil and fill with pie weights or uncooked rice or beans. Put quiche pan on a baking sheet and bake pie shell until side is set and edge is pale golden, 18 to 20 minutes. Carefully remove weights and foil and bake shell until bottom is golden, about 10 minutes more. Cool completely in pan on a rack, about 30 minutes. To make filling, bring sugar and water to a boil in a large heavy sauce pan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Boil syrup gently swirling pan (do not stir) until mixture is a deep golden caramel, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to moderate and carefully add 1 cup cream (mixture will bubble), stirring until caramel is dissolved. Stir in remaining cup cream and turn down to a simmer. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, spices, and salt. Whisk in hot cream mixture, then add eggs, whisking until combined well. Pour filling into cooled crust and bake until center is just set, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool in pan on a rack, about 2 hours. Remove sides of pan before serving.

raw_meal: Mix the yogurt or sour cream, butter and sugar until very creamy. In a separate bowl,
mix the semolina flour and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the cream
mixture and incorporate with a wooden spoon until it makes a smooth batter. Place
cake batter in a 9 x 12 inch rectangular baking dish and bake 35 minutes at 350
degrees.
To make the syrup, in a small sauce pan dissolve the sugar in the water on medium
heat. Add the butter and melt, stirring. Bring the mixture to a boil stirring constantly.
Boil for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. When cake is done and cooled,
drip the syrup over the cake until all incorporated and soaked in.
BASSBOUSSA.title: BASSBOUSSA
BASSBOUSSA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Syrup Cake)
ingredients: 1 c. plain yogurt or sour cream
BASSBOUSSA.instructions: Mix the yogurt or sour cream, butter and sugar until very creamy. In a separate bowl, mix the semolina flour and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the cream mixture and incorporate with a wooden spoon until it makes a smooth batter. Place cake batter in a 9 x 12 inch rectangular baking dish and bake 35 minutes at 350 degrees. To make the syrup, in a small sauce pan dissolve the sugar in the water on medium heat. Add the butter and melt, stirring. Bring the mixture to a boil stirring constantly. Boil for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. When cake is done and cooled, drip the syrup over the cake until all incorporated and soaked in.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, yogurt and vanilla and mix with a wooden
spoon until smooth. In a separate bowl, stir together the remaining ingredients, then
mix into the butter mixture, stirring until smooth. Let mixture sit for one hour (this
will let the Cream of Wheat soften). Grease the bottom of a 9 x 12-inch baking pan.
Pour the cake mixture in the pan and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes.
Remove the cake from the oven and cut into 2- or 3-inch squares while hot.
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out dough on
a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 14-inch round, then fit
into quiche pan, being careful not to stretch the dough. Trim excess dough flush with
rim of pan. Chill until firm, about 30 minutes. Lightly prick bottom of pie shell all
over with a fork, then line with foil and fill with pie weights or uncooked rice or
beans. Put quiche pan on a baking sheet and bake pie shell until side is set and edge is
pale golden, 18 to 20 minutes. Carefully remove weights and foil and bake shell until
bottom is golden, about 10 minutes more. Cool completely in pan on a rack, about 30
minutes.
To make filling, bring sugar and water to a boil in a large heavy sauce pan, stirring
until sugar is dissolved. Boil syrup gently swirling pan (do not stir) until mixture is a
deep golden caramel, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to moderate and carefully add 1
cup cream (mixture will bubble), stirring until caramel is dissolved. Stir in remaining
cup cream and turn down to a simmer. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the
pumpkin puree, spices, and salt. Whisk in hot cream mixture, then add eggs, whisking
until combined well. Pour filling into cooled crust and bake until center is just set, 55
to 60 minutes. Cool in pan on a rack, about 2 hours. Remove sides of pan before
serving.
BASSBOUSSA GOZ EL HIND.title: BASSBOUSSA GOZ EL HIND
BASSBOUSSA GOZ EL HIND.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Cake with Coconut)
BASSBOUSSA GOZ EL HIND.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, yogurt and vanilla and mix with a wooden spoon until smooth. In a separate bowl, stir together the remaining ingredients, then mix into the butter mixture, stirring until smooth. Let mixture sit for one hour (this will let the Cream of Wheat soften). Grease the bottom of a 9 x 12-inch baking pan. Pour the cake mixture in the pan and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes. Remove the cake from the oven and cut into 2- or 3-inch squares while hot. While the cake is baking, in a small sauce pan, mix the sugar, water, lemon and vanilla and cook on medium-low heat for about 10 minutes. Stir constantly until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and cool. After the cake is removed from oven and cut, but still hot, pour cooled syrup over cake and let soak in. Serve warm or cold.

raw_meal: Cream the sugar and butter until fluffy and add the eggs one at a time, beating well.
Add the flour and lemon and mix well. Pour batter into a well greased 15 x 10 x 1
inch jelly role pan. With a knife, lightly mark off 20 equal squares. Place one heaping
tablespoon pie filling in the middle of each square. Bake at 350 degrees for 25
minutes. While warm, sift powdered sugar over cake. Cool and cut into squares as
marked.
CHERRY SQUARES.title: CHERRY SQUARES
CHERRY SQUARES.instructions: Cream the sugar and butter until fluffy and add the eggs one at a time, beating well. Add the flour and lemon and mix well. Pour batter into a well greased 15 x 10 x 1 inch jelly role pan. With a knife, lightly mark off 20 equal squares. Place one heaping tablespoon pie filling in the middle of each square. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. While warm, sift powdered sugar over cake. Cool and cut into squares as marked.

raw_meal: Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, beat the eggs slightly,
add the salt and the sugar, and stir until dissolved. Making sure the milk is not too hot,
pour milk gradually into egg mixture. (Add a pinch of nutmeg or 1/2 tsp. of vanilla,
lemon, almond or other flavoring, if desired.) Set the milk and egg mixture aside. To
caramelize the sugar, put 1/2 c. sugar into a small sauce pan and melt on medium-high
heat, stirring constantly until it reaches a medium brown color. Do not let burn as
sugar will quickly get very hot. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the caramelized sugar
into the bottom of each custard cup (or pour all into a medium-size round baking
dish). Place the cups into a 10 x 13-inch pan of shallow hot water. Fill each cup about
3/4 full with the milk and egg mixture. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 30 minutes.
Remove the custard cups and let cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes. With a knife,
gently loosen the sides of the cups and invert onto a dessert plate or bowl.
CREME CARAMEL.title: CREME CARAMEL
CREME CARAMEL.subtitle: (Flan)
CREME CARAMEL.instructions: Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, beat the eggs slightly, add the salt and the sugar, and stir until dissolved. Making sure the milk is not too hot, pour milk gradually into egg mixture. (Add a pinch of nutmeg or 1/2 tsp. of vanilla, lemon, almond or other flavoring, if desired.) Set the milk and egg mixture aside. To caramelize the sugar, put 1/2 c. sugar into a small sauce pan and melt on medium-high heat, stirring constantly until it reaches a medium brown color. Do not let burn as sugar will quickly get very hot. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the caramelized sugar into the bottom of each custard cup (or pour all into a medium-size round baking dish). Place the cups into a 10 x 13-inch pan of shallow hot water. Fill each cup about 3/4 full with the milk and egg mixture. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 30 minutes. Remove the custard cups and let cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes. With a knife, gently loosen the sides of the cups and invert onto a dessert plate or bowl.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 9-inch square baking pan. Sift dry
ingredients together in a mixing bowl. Add the egg, sugar and molasses and mix well.
Add the boiling water and the oil to mixture. Stir thoroughly until smooth. Pour batter
into the prepared pan. Bake 35 to 40 minutes, or until top springs back when touched
and the edges have pulled away slightly from the sides of the pan. While cake is still
hot, pour lemon glaze over top and cool in the pan, set on a wire rack. Vegetarian
variation: Substitute 1/4 c. apple sauce for the egg.
Sift the powdered sugar into a bowl and add the lemon juice. Mix well and pour over
gingerbread cake.
GINGERBREAD CAKE.title: GINGERBREAD CAKE
GINGERBREAD CAKE.subtitle: (with Lemon Glaze)
GINGERBREAD CAKE.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 9-inch square baking pan. Sift dry ingredients together in a mixing bowl. Add the egg, sugar and molasses and mix well. Add the boiling water and the oil to mixture. Stir thoroughly until smooth. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake 35 to 40 minutes, or until top springs back when touched and the edges have pulled away slightly from the sides of the pan. While cake is still hot, pour lemon glaze over top and cool in the pan, set on a wire rack. Vegetarian variation: Substitute 1/4 c. apple sauce for the egg. Sift the powdered sugar into a bowl and add the lemon juice. Mix well and pour over gingerbread cake.

raw_meal: In a food processor, pulse the cookies into coarse crumbs, not a powder. Set aside. In
a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter, eggs and vanilla until creamy.
Add the powdered sugar and then the cocoa powder, a little at a time, and mix well.
Remove 1/3 of the cake batter from the mixer and set aside. To the mixer, add the
cookie crumbs and mix on low until incorporated. Remove the batter with the crumbs
(should be very thick) and place onto a deep dinner plate or serving dish. Spread the
batter to the edge of the plate and flatten the top and sides. Frost the cake with the
remaining batter. Top the cake with the strips of chocolate bar, making a decoration.
Refrigerate or freeze the cake for several hours before serving. (Note: Pregnant
ICED CHOCOLATE CAKE.title: ICED CHOCOLATE CAKE
ingredients: 2 Hershey's chocolate bars, cut into small
women should not each foods with raw egg.)
ICED CHOCOLATE CAKE.instructions: In a food processor, pulse the cookies into coarse crumbs, not a powder. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter, eggs and vanilla until creamy. Add the powdered sugar and then the cocoa powder, a little at a time, and mix well. Remove 1/3 of the cake batter from the mixer and set aside. To the mixer, add the cookie crumbs and mix on low until incorporated. Remove the batter with the crumbs (should be very thick) and place onto a deep dinner plate or serving dish. Spread the batter to the edge of the plate and flatten the top and sides. Frost the cake with the remaining batter. Top the cake with the strips of chocolate bar, making a decoration. Refrigerate or freeze the cake for several hours before serving. (Note: Pregnant

raw_meal: To make cakes: Mix together the nuts, raisins, sugar and cinnamon. Set aside. In a
mixing bowl, stir remaining ingredients together, adding water 1/2 cup at a time until
it is the consistency of pancake batter (can be poured but is not too thin). Heat a flat
griddle and brush with a little vegetable oil or butter. Pour batter to form 5-inch
diameter pancakes and cook until light golden brown. Do not turn. Remove cake to a
cookie sheet and keep warm in oven. Tops will be sticky. When cakes are all cooked,
top 1/2 of each round with the nut and fruit mix. Fold over the cake to form a pocket
and pinch edge to seal, adding a little milk if needed. Deep fry 2-3 stuffed cake at a
time in hot oil for a few minutes on each side until deep golden, then remove and
drain on paper towel. Dip hot cakes in cooled syrup (see below) and serve hot. To
make syrup: In a sauce pan mix all ingredients and bring to a boil. Boil for 3-4
minutes or until slightly thick.
KATAYIF.title: KATAYIF
KATAYIF.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Deep Fried Sweet Cakes)
KATAYIF.instructions: To make cakes: Mix together the nuts, raisins, sugar and cinnamon. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, stir remaining ingredients together, adding water 1/2 cup at a time until it is the consistency of pancake batter (can be poured but is not too thin). Heat a flat griddle and brush with a little vegetable oil or butter. Pour batter to form 5-inch diameter pancakes and cook until light golden brown. Do not turn. Remove cake to a cookie sheet and keep warm in oven. Tops will be sticky. When cakes are all cooked, top 1/2 of each round with the nut and fruit mix. Fold over the cake to form a pocket and pinch edge to seal, adding a little milk if needed. Deep fry 2-3 stuffed cake at a time in hot oil for a few minutes on each side until deep golden, then remove and drain on paper towel. Dip hot cakes in cooled syrup (see below) and serve hot. To make syrup: In a sauce pan mix all ingredients and bring to a boil. Boil for 3-4 minutes or until slightly thick.

raw_meal: Pour the cream, 1/2 cup of milk and the sugar in a medium sauce pan. Cook on
medium-low heat, stirring. At the same time, mix the corn starch with the other 1/2
cup of milk and then add to the cream mixture. Keep stirring on low until thick (coats
the back of a spoon). Set aside and let cool. To prepare the pastry, melt the butter and
brush a small amount on the bottom of a jelly roll pan. In a large mixing bowl, gently
pull apart the Konafa strands until fluffy. Put half of the dough onto the jelly roll pan
and press down firmly until the bottom of the pan is covered. Brush half of the butter
over the entire surface of the dough. Pour the cooled cream mixture over the dough in
the pan, spreading evenly. Then lightly place the rest of the Konafa dough over the
cream mixture and press down gently until the Konafa covers the cream. Brush the
rest of the butter over the top of the Konafa dough. Bake at 350 degrees for 40
minutes or until light golden brown and the edges begin to pull away from the pan. In
a small sauce pan mix the sugar, water and lime juice. Bring to a light boil, stirring
constantly until slightly thick. Let the sugar mixture cool then pour over the baked
Konafa. Cut into 2-inch squares and serve warm or cold. Note: Konafa is shredded
pastry dough and may be found with the Filo dough in the freezer section of Middle
Eastern stores.
KONAFA WITH CREAM.title: KONAFA WITH CREAM
KONAFA WITH CREAM.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pastry with Cream)
KONAFA WITH CREAM.instructions: Pour the cream, 1/2 cup of milk and the sugar in a medium sauce pan. Cook on medium-low heat, stirring. At the same time, mix the corn starch with the other 1/2 cup of milk and then add to the cream mixture. Keep stirring on low until thick (coats the back of a spoon). Set aside and let cool. To prepare the pastry, melt the butter and brush a small amount on the bottom of a jelly roll pan. In a large mixing bowl, gently pull apart the Konafa strands until fluffy. Put half of the dough onto the jelly roll pan and press down firmly until the bottom of the pan is covered. Brush half of the butter over the entire surface of the dough. Pour the cooled cream mixture over the dough in the pan, spreading evenly. Then lightly place the rest of the Konafa dough over the cream mixture and press down gently until the Konafa covers the cream. Brush the rest of the butter over the top of the Konafa dough. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until light golden brown and the edges begin to pull away from the pan. In a small sauce pan mix the sugar, water and lime juice. Bring to a light boil, stirring constantly until slightly thick. Let the sugar mixture cool then pour over the baked Konafa. Cut into 2-inch squares and serve warm or cold. Note: Konafa is shredded pastry dough and may be found with the Filo dough in the freezer section of Middle Eastern stores.

raw_meal: Grease a 9 x 12 baking dish. Loosen the konafa dough until fluffy. Place half of the
dough in the bottom of the baking dish and pat down. In a mixing bowl, mix the nuts,
coconut, raisins, sugar and cinnamon. Spread the nut mixture evenly over the dough
in the pan. Pour half of the melted butter over the nuts. Spread the rest of the konafa
dough over the nuts and pat down firmly. Pour the rest of the butter evenly over the
top of the dough. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 45 minutes or until
lightly golden brown. Vegetarian variation: Use shortening instead of butter.
While the pastry is baking, in a small saucepan, dissolve the sugar in the water, then
add the lime juice. Bring to a boil, then turn down to medium-low. Simmer for about
20 minutes, stirring occasionally until slightly thickened. Set aside and let cool
completely. Remove the Konafa from the oven and while hot, pour the cooled syrup
evenly over the top. Cut into 3- or 4-inch squares. Can be served warm or cold with
whipped cream topping. Note: Konafa is shredded pastry dough and can be found
with the Filo dough in the freezer section of Middle Eastern stores.
KONAFA WITH NUTS.title: KONAFA WITH NUTS
KONAFA WITH NUTS.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Sweet Pastry)
KONAFA WITH NUTS.instructions: Grease a 9 x 12 baking dish. Loosen the konafa dough until fluffy. Place half of the dough in the bottom of the baking dish and pat down. In a mixing bowl, mix the nuts, coconut, raisins, sugar and cinnamon. Spread the nut mixture evenly over the dough in the pan. Pour half of the melted butter over the nuts. Spread the rest of the konafa dough over the nuts and pat down firmly. Pour the rest of the butter evenly over the top of the dough. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 45 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Vegetarian variation: Use shortening instead of butter. While the pastry is baking, in a small saucepan, dissolve the sugar in the water, then add the lime juice. Bring to a boil, then turn down to medium-low. Simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally until slightly thickened. Set aside and let cool completely. Remove the Konafa from the oven and while hot, pour the cooled syrup evenly over the top. Cut into 3- or 4-inch squares. Can be served warm or cold with whipped cream topping. Note: Konafa is shredded pastry dough and can be found with the Filo dough in the freezer section of Middle Eastern stores.

raw_meal: Make baked pie shell according to recipe in This and That. Set aside to cool. In a
mixer, cream the butter and sugar. Add the 4 egg yolks and mix until creamy. Add the
whole eggs and mix until creamy. Pour egg mixture into a sauce pan and with a wire
whisk, mix in the lemon juice, lemon zest, and salt and cook on medium heat until
thick, stirring continuously. When done, remove from heat and cool. To make
meringue: In a large mixing bowl, mix the cream of tarter, salt and 4 egg whites and
mix. When creamy, add the sugar and mix on high until whites form medium peaks
(do not mix too long or mixture will be stiff and not creamy). To assemble, fill the pie
shell with the cold lemon mixture. In a large pastry bag with a wide, decorative tip,
pipe the egg whites over the lemon in a decorative pattern until completely covered.
(Or, spoon the egg whites over the lemon and smooth with spatula, making small dips
and peaks.) Bake pie at 425 degrees for 3-5 minutes until light brown on top. Chill
completely before serving.
LEMON MERINGUE PIE.title: LEMON MERINGUE PIE
ingredients: 1 baked pie shell (see recipe in This and
LEMON MERINGUE PIE.instructions: Make baked pie shell according to recipe in This and That. Set aside to cool. In a mixer, cream the butter and sugar. Add the 4 egg yolks and mix until creamy. Add the whole eggs and mix until creamy. Pour egg mixture into a sauce pan and with a wire whisk, mix in the lemon juice, lemon zest, and salt and cook on medium heat until thick, stirring continuously. When done, remove from heat and cool. To make meringue: In a large mixing bowl, mix the cream of tarter, salt and 4 egg whites and mix. When creamy, add the sugar and mix on high until whites form medium peaks (do not mix too long or mixture will be stiff and not creamy). To assemble, fill the pie shell with the cold lemon mixture. In a large pastry bag with a wide, decorative tip, pipe the egg whites over the lemon in a decorative pattern until completely covered. (Or, spoon the egg whites over the lemon and smooth with spatula, making small dips and peaks.) Bake pie at 425 degrees for 3-5 minutes until light brown on top. Chill completely before serving.

raw_meal: In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and the sugar in the warm water (110-115°). Let
the yeast sit for 5 minutes until it begins to bubble. In a large mixing bowl, combine
the flour, water, corn starch and yeast mixture. Mix well and let stand for about 1 hour
in a warm place to rise. In a deep medium-sized heavy sauce pan, heat the oil to
medium-high (around 365° F for Canola oil). Scoop about 1 tablespoon of dough with
a large spoon, and with another spoon, scrape and carefully drop into the hot oil.
Place several balls of dough in oil and cook until light golden brown. Turn over and
cook until all sides are golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and
set onto a paper towel to soak up extra oil. Dip into cooled syrup as directed.
While the dough is rising, in a small saucepan dissolve the sugar in the water and add
the lime juice. Bring to a boil then turn down to medium. Let simmer for about 20
minutes, stirring often, until slightly thickened. Set syrup aside to cool completely.
Dip cooked doughnut holes in cooled syrup and place all in a large mixing bowl. Pour
extra syrup over the top. Serve warm or cold.
LO'MITT EL ADI.title: LO'MITT EL ADI
LO'MITT EL ADI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Doughnut Holes)
LO'MITT EL ADI.instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and the sugar in the warm water (110-115°). Let the yeast sit for 5 minutes until it begins to bubble. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, water, corn starch and yeast mixture. Mix well and let stand for about 1 hour in a warm place to rise. In a deep medium-sized heavy sauce pan, heat the oil to medium-high (around 365° F for Canola oil). Scoop about 1 tablespoon of dough with a large spoon, and with another spoon, scrape and carefully drop into the hot oil. Place several balls of dough in oil and cook until light golden brown. Turn over and cook until all sides are golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and set onto a paper towel to soak up extra oil. Dip into cooled syrup as directed. While the dough is rising, in a small saucepan dissolve the sugar in the water and add the lime juice. Bring to a boil then turn down to medium. Let simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring often, until slightly thickened. Set syrup aside to cool completely. Dip cooked doughnut holes in cooled syrup and place all in a large mixing bowl. Pour extra syrup over the top. Serve warm or cold.

raw_meal: Mix the egg white and whipping cream together. Add the mango pulp and mix well.
Make the JELLO according to package directions (dissolve in hot water, then add
cold water). While JELLO is still warm, add the mango mixture and stir. Refrigerate
for 2-3 hours. Note: Canned mango pulp may be found at Indian food stores or use
fresh mango fruit, peeled and pureed in a food processor.
MANGO MOUSE.title: MANGO MOUSE
MANGO MOUSE.instructions: Mix the egg white and whipping cream together. Add the mango pulp and mix well. Make the JELLO according to package directions (dissolve in hot water, then add cold water). While JELLO is still warm, add the mango mixture and stir. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Note: Canned mango pulp may be found at Indian food stores or use fresh mango fruit, peeled and pureed in a food processor.

raw_meal: This cake has three layers. To make first layer, assemble and lightly grease a 9 inch
cake pan with insert (removable bottom). Sprinkle bottom with 2 T. crumbs and set
aside 2 T. more for topping. Mix the rest of the crumbs with the melted butter and
sugar and pack into the bottom of the pan. For the second layer, with a mixer, beat
cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually add vanilla, sugar and eggs-one at a time. Beat
for 5 or 6 minutes, until very creamy. Pour into cake pan and bake at 375 degrees for
20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 20 minutes. Increase oven
temperature to 475 degrees. For third layer, stir sour cream with vanilla and sugar.
Spread evenly over the top of the cake. Sprinkle top with remaining crumbs and bake
for 10 minutes. Cool at room temperature then refrigerate for several hours before
serving. To cut, dip a long knife in warm water and clean between slices.
NEW YORK STYLE CHEESE CAKE.title: NEW YORK STYLE CHEESE CAKE
NEW YORK STYLE CHEESE CAKE.instructions: This cake has three layers. To make first layer, assemble and lightly grease a 9 inch cake pan with insert (removable bottom). Sprinkle bottom with 2 T. crumbs and set aside 2 T. more for topping. Mix the rest of the crumbs with the melted butter and sugar and pack into the bottom of the pan. For the second layer, with a mixer, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually add vanilla, sugar and eggs-one at a time. Beat for 5 or 6 minutes, until very creamy. Pour into cake pan and bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 20 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 475 degrees. For third layer, stir sour cream with vanilla and sugar. Spread evenly over the top of the cake. Sprinkle top with remaining crumbs and bake for 10 minutes. Cool at room temperature then refrigerate for several hours before serving. To cut, dip a long knife in warm water and clean between slices.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Two at a time, bake the filo sheets until crispy (on
baking sheets for a few minutes at 350 degrees). When cooled, crumble the sheets
into a rectangular baking dish. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, mix the cream and half
and half. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the nuts, raisins, and coconut to
the milk mixture. Pour the milk mixture over the filo and bake at 350 degrees for 1/2
hour.
OM ALLI.title: OM ALLI
OM ALLI.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Bread Pudding)
OM ALLI.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Two at a time, bake the filo sheets until crispy (on baking sheets for a few minutes at 350 degrees). When cooled, crumble the sheets into a rectangular baking dish. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, mix the cream and half and half. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the nuts, raisins, and coconut to the milk mixture. Pour the milk mixture over the filo and bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour.

raw_meal: Heat oven to 375 degrees. In a large roasting or baking pan, combine brandy,
cinnamon, cloves, lemon juice and zest, brown sugar, and butter. Add the apples and
toss. Roast until apples are very soft and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Transfer
apples to a food processor and pulse until smooth. Stir in salt. Serve warm or cold.
Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.
OVEN-ROASTED APPLE SAUCE.title: OVEN-ROASTED APPLE SAUCE
ingredients: 1/4 c. plus 2 T. brown sugar, packed
OVEN-ROASTED APPLE SAUCE.instructions: Heat oven to 375 degrees. In a large roasting or baking pan, combine brandy, cinnamon, cloves, lemon juice and zest, brown sugar, and butter. Add the apples and toss. Roast until apples are very soft and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Transfer apples to a food processor and pulse until smooth. Stir in salt. Serve warm or cold. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.

raw_meal: To make mincemeat: Stir together all ingredients except pastry dough and chill in an
airtight container, stirring several times, for one day or overnight. To make pie: Make
pie dough for double pie crust (see recipe in This and That). Put oven rack in the
middle position. Put a large baking sheet on rack and preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Roll out the larger piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured
rolling pin into a 13-inch round. Roll dough onto rolling pin, lift and fit into a 9-inch
pie plate, carefully patting dough onto pie plate sides (careful not to pull or stretch
dough) and leaving a 1/4 inch overhang (trim if needed). Chill pie plate while rolling
out dough for top. Roll out smaller piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with
lightly floured rolling pin into a roughly 16- by 11-inch rectangle. Cut crosswise into
12 (1-inch wide) strips with a pastry wheel or a sharp knife. Stir mincemeat, then
spoon into shell in an even layer. Weave a lattice pattern over pie with pastry strips.
Trim edges of strips flush with edge of bottom crust. Fold bottom crust up over edges
of lattice and decoratively crimp to seal edge. Bake pie on hot baking sheet 20
minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees and cover edge of pie with a
pie shield or foil if it begins to brown too quickly. Continue to bake until crust is
golden brown and filling begins to bubble around edge, about 1 hour more. Transfer
pie to a rack and cool to warm or room temperature.
PEAR-CRANBERRY MINCEMEAT PIE.title: PEAR-CRANBERRY MINCEMEAT PIE
PEAR-CRANBERRY MINCEMEAT PIE.subtitle: (Meatless)
ingredients: 2 firm ripe pears, peeled, cored, and
2 T. finely grated fresh lemon zest
2 tsp. finely grated fresh orange zest
pastry dough for double pie crust (See
PEAR-CRANBERRY MINCEMEAT PIE.instructions: To make mincemeat: Stir together all ingredients except pastry dough and chill in an airtight container, stirring several times, for one day or overnight. To make pie: Make pie dough for double pie crust (see recipe in This and That). Put oven rack in the middle position. Put a large baking sheet on rack and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Roll out the larger piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round. Roll dough onto rolling pin, lift and fit into a 9-inch pie plate, carefully patting dough onto pie plate sides (careful not to pull or stretch dough) and leaving a 1/4 inch overhang (trim if needed). Chill pie plate while rolling out dough for top. Roll out smaller piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with lightly floured rolling pin into a roughly 16- by 11-inch rectangle. Cut crosswise into 12 (1-inch wide) strips with a pastry wheel or a sharp knife. Stir mincemeat, then spoon into shell in an even layer. Weave a lattice pattern over pie with pastry strips. Trim edges of strips flush with edge of bottom crust. Fold bottom crust up over edges of lattice and decoratively crimp to seal edge. Bake pie on hot baking sheet 20 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees and cover edge of pie with a pie shield or foil if it begins to brown too quickly. Continue to bake until crust is golden brown and filling begins to bubble around edge, about 1 hour more. Transfer pie to a rack and cool to warm or room temperature.

raw_meal: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a large baking
sheet with parchment paper. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly
flowered rolling pin into a 13-inch round. Transfer to baking sheet. Stir together
semolina flour and 2 T. sugar and spread evenly over dough, leaving a 1-inch border.
Halve and pit each plum, then cut each lengthwise into 8 wedges. Arrange plums
skin-side down in one layer over sugar mixture, then sprinkle plums with 3 T. sugar.
Fold in edge of dough to cover outer rim of plums, pleating dough as necessary. Bake
galette, loosely covered with a sheet of foil, 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake until
fruit is tender and juices are bubbling, about 5 minutes more. Transfer galette on
baking sheet to a rack and immediately brush hot juices over plums using a pastry
brush. Dust hot galette with confectioners sugar (sugar will melt and help glaze
galette). Cool to warm or room temperature.
PLUM GALETTE.title: PLUM GALETTE
ingredients: pastry dough for a single pie crust (see
PLUM GALETTE.instructions: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly flowered rolling pin into a 13-inch round. Transfer to baking sheet. Stir together semolina flour and 2 T. sugar and spread evenly over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Halve and pit each plum, then cut each lengthwise into 8 wedges. Arrange plums skin-side down in one layer over sugar mixture, then sprinkle plums with 3 T. sugar. Fold in edge of dough to cover outer rim of plums, pleating dough as necessary. Bake galette, loosely covered with a sheet of foil, 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake until fruit is tender and juices are bubbling, about 5 minutes more. Transfer galette on baking sheet to a rack and immediately brush hot juices over plums using a pastry brush. Dust hot galette with confectioners sugar (sugar will melt and help glaze galette). Cool to warm or room temperature.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream together the sugar and butter. Add all
the eggs one at a time and cream well until very smooth. Add flour 1 cup at a time
and mix well. Place in a floured cake or Bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour
or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool and sprinkle top
with a little powdered sugar.
POUND BUNDT CAKE.title: POUND BUNDT CAKE
POUND BUNDT CAKE.instructions: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream together the sugar and butter. Add all the eggs one at a time and cream well until very smooth. Add flour 1 cup at a time and mix well. Place in a floured cake or Bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool and sprinkle top with a little powdered sugar.

raw_meal: Cream the butter and sugar and add the eggs and vanilla. Mix in the flour, baking
powder and milk. Mix well. Pour into a floured cake pan and bake at 350 degrees for
45 minutes or until light golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes
out clean.
POUND CAKE.title: POUND CAKE
POUND CAKE.instructions: Cream the butter and sugar and add the eggs and vanilla. Mix in the flour, baking powder and milk. Mix well. Pour into a floured cake pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until light golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking soda, salt, and
sugar into an ungreased 8-inch square or a 9-inch round baking pan. In a 2-cup
measuring cup, measure and mix together the oil, water or coffee, and vanilla. Pour
the liquid ingredients into the baking pan and mix the batter with a fork or a small
whisk. When the batter is smooth, add the vinegar and stir quickly, until all the
vinegar is completely distributed in the batter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Set the cake
aside to cool.
Melt the chocolate in a small ovenproof bowl in the oven for about 15 minutes. Stir
the hot liquid and vanilla into the chocolate until smooth. Spoon the glaze over the
cool cake. Chill the glazed cake 20-30 minutes before serving.
QUICK CHOCOLATE CAKE.title: QUICK CHOCOLATE CAKE
ingredients: 1 c. cold water or brewed coffee
3/4 c. hot water, milk, or half-and-half
QUICK CHOCOLATE CAKE.instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking soda, salt, and sugar into an ungreased 8-inch square or a 9-inch round baking pan. In a 2-cup measuring cup, measure and mix together the oil, water or coffee, and vanilla. Pour the liquid ingredients into the baking pan and mix the batter with a fork or a small whisk. When the batter is smooth, add the vinegar and stir quickly, until all the vinegar is completely distributed in the batter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Set the cake aside to cool. Melt the chocolate in a small ovenproof bowl in the oven for about 15 minutes. Stir the hot liquid and vanilla into the chocolate until smooth. Spoon the glaze over the cool cake. Chill the glazed cake 20-30 minutes before serving.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl, slightly beat eggs then add the sugar and stir until dissolved.
Mix in the remaining ingredients in the order listed. Pour mixture into a 1 qt. buttered
casserole and place into a shallow plan with 1 inch of water. Bake in a preheated 325
degree oven for 1 and 1/2 hours. Serve warm.
RICE PUDDING.title: RICE PUDDING
RICE PUDDING.subtitle: (American Style)
RICE PUDDING.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, slightly beat eggs then add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Mix in the remaining ingredients in the order listed. Pour mixture into a 1 qt. buttered casserole and place into a shallow plan with 1 inch of water. Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 1 and 1/2 hours. Serve warm.

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan, mix the water and evaporated milk. Place the cinnamon stick
in the milk mixture and bring almost to a boil. Just before boiling, remove the
cinnamon, and add the rice and raisins. Simmer uncovered on medium to low, adding
1/2 cup milk every 10 minutes or so for 45 minutes to one hour, stirring every few
minutes to keep from burning. Cook rice until very soft and creamy. When rice is
completely cooked, add the sweetened condensed milk and stir well to incorporate.
Cook on low for another 15 to 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes. Remove from
heat and place in a serving bowl. Sprinkle top with the ground cinnamon. May be
served warm or cold with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
RICE PUDDING #2.title: RICE PUDDING #2
RICE PUDDING #2.subtitle: (Mexican Style)
RICE PUDDING #2.instructions: In a medium sauce pan, mix the water and evaporated milk. Place the cinnamon stick in the milk mixture and bring almost to a boil. Just before boiling, remove the cinnamon, and add the rice and raisins. Simmer uncovered on medium to low, adding 1/2 cup milk every 10 minutes or so for 45 minutes to one hour, stirring every few minutes to keep from burning. Cook rice until very soft and creamy. When rice is completely cooked, add the sweetened condensed milk and stir well to incorporate. Cook on low for another 15 to 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes. Remove from heat and place in a serving bowl. Sprinkle top with the ground cinnamon. May be served warm or cold with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

raw_meal: Combine the crumbs, 1/4 cup ginger, and butter. Pat crumb mixture evenly over
bottom of a removable-rim 8-inch cheesecake pan (at least 1 3/4-inch deep). Bake in a
350 degree oven until crust is slightly brown, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a
blender or food processor, whirl ricotta, egg whites, and lemon juice until very
smooth. In a separate bowl, mix the yogurt cheese, sugar, lemon peel, and vanilla.
Add ricotta mixture and stir until blended (the mixture is thin). Pour into hot or cool
crust. Bake in a 350 degree oven until center barely moves when cake is gently
shaken, 50 to 55 minutes. Run a thin-bladed knife between cake and pan rim.
Refrigerate cake, uncovered, until cool, at least 2 1/2 hours. Remove pan rim. Peel
kiwi fruit and slice crosswise. Arrange fruit slices in a ring around the top edge of
cake and sprinkle with remaining minced ginger.
RICOTTA AND YOGURT CHEESECAKE.title: RICOTTA AND YOGURT CHEESECAKE
ingredients: 1 c. yogurt cheese (see recipe in This and
1 2/3 c. ricotta cheese (see recipe in This
RICOTTA AND YOGURT CHEESECAKE.instructions: Combine the crumbs, 1/4 cup ginger, and butter. Pat crumb mixture evenly over bottom of a removable-rim 8-inch cheesecake pan (at least 1 3/4-inch deep). Bake in a 350 degree oven until crust is slightly brown, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a blender or food processor, whirl ricotta, egg whites, and lemon juice until very smooth. In a separate bowl, mix the yogurt cheese, sugar, lemon peel, and vanilla. Add ricotta mixture and stir until blended (the mixture is thin). Pour into hot or cool crust. Bake in a 350 degree oven until center barely moves when cake is gently shaken, 50 to 55 minutes. Run a thin-bladed knife between cake and pan rim. Refrigerate cake, uncovered, until cool, at least 2 1/2 hours. Remove pan rim. Peel kiwi fruit and slice crosswise. Arrange fruit slices in a ring around the top edge of cake and sprinkle with remaining minced ginger.

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan, bring rice and water to a boil, stirring constantly. Turn heat
down to medium- low and stir until water is almost gone. Turn heat to medium and
add 1/2 to 3/4 cup of milk at a time and continue stirring until rice mixture becomes
almost dry, then add more milk. Continue adding milk and stirring until rice is fully
cooked. Rice should be completely soft and not be al dente. Add sugar, raisin and
coconut and continue to stir on medium until almost boiling. Pour into serving dish
and sprinkle top with cinnamon. Refrigerate 5 to 6 hours before serving.
ROZ BIL LABAN.title: ROZ BIL LABAN
ROZ BIL LABAN.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Rice Pudding)
ROZ BIL LABAN.instructions: In a medium sauce pan, bring rice and water to a boil, stirring constantly. Turn heat down to medium- low and stir until water is almost gone. Turn heat to medium and add 1/2 to 3/4 cup of milk at a time and continue stirring until rice mixture becomes almost dry, then add more milk. Continue adding milk and stirring until rice is fully cooked. Rice should be completely soft and not be al dente. Add sugar, raisin and coconut and continue to stir on medium until almost boiling. Pour into serving dish and sprinkle top with cinnamon. Refrigerate 5 to 6 hours before serving.

raw_meal: In a sauce pan, melt the butter until bubbly. Stir in the cinnamon and then the orange
juice and liqueur, stirring constantly. When smooth, add sliced bananas and stir
quickly to coat, about 30 seconds. Remove from pan and serve over ice cream or
frozen yogurt.
frosting. Vegetarian variation: substitute the egg with 1/4 c. apple sauce and omit
frosting. Vegetarian variation: substitute the egg with 1/4 c. apple sauce and omit
frosting.
SAUTEED BANANAS.title: SAUTEED BANANAS
ingredients: 2 firm, ripe bananas, sliced in rounds or
SAUTEED BANANAS.instructions: In a sauce pan, melt the butter until bubbly. Stir in the cinnamon and then the orange juice and liqueur, stirring constantly. When smooth, add sliced bananas and stir quickly to coat, about 30 seconds. Remove from pan and serve over ice cream or frozen yogurt. frosting. Vegetarian variation: substitute the egg with 1/4 c. apple sauce and omit frosting. Vegetarian variation: substitute the egg with 1/4 c. apple sauce and omit frosting.

raw_meal: Place the frozen rolls in the bottom of a greased tube or bundt pan. In a small bowl,
combine sugar, pudding mix, and cinnamon. Sprinkle sugar mixture over rolls. Pour
butter over sugar mixture and sprinkle pecans on top. Cover with plastic wrap and let
rise in a warm place 5-6 hours, or until doubled in size. Bake in a 350 degree
preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and
turn out onto serving plate. Serve warm.
STICKY ROLLS.title: STICKY ROLLS
STICKY ROLLS.instructions: Place the frozen rolls in the bottom of a greased tube or bundt pan. In a small bowl, combine sugar, pudding mix, and cinnamon. Sprinkle sugar mixture over rolls. Pour butter over sugar mixture and sprinkle pecans on top. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place 5-6 hours, or until doubled in size. Bake in a 350 degree preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and turn out onto serving plate. Serve warm.

raw_meal: Dissolve Jello in the water, add the strawberries and stir until completely thawed. Mix
in the pineapple and bananas. In a 9 x 13 inch baking dish, pour half of the Jello
mixture into the bottom, cover with plastic and refrigerate for 2-3 hours, until set.
Spread sour cream evenly over the top of Jello, then pour remaining Jello over top.
Cover with plastic and return to refrigerator to chill for 2 or more hours. To serve, cut
into 3 or 4 inch squares and top with a dollop of whipped cream.
STRAWBERRY JELLO DESSERT.title: STRAWBERRY JELLO DESSERT
STRAWBERRY JELLO DESSERT.instructions: Dissolve Jello in the water, add the strawberries and stir until completely thawed. Mix in the pineapple and bananas. In a 9 x 13 inch baking dish, pour half of the Jello mixture into the bottom, cover with plastic and refrigerate for 2-3 hours, until set. Spread sour cream evenly over the top of Jello, then pour remaining Jello over top. Cover with plastic and return to refrigerator to chill for 2 or more hours. To serve, cut into 3 or 4 inch squares and top with a dollop of whipped cream.

raw_meal: In a mixer, cream the butter and sugar, then add the egg and mix until smooth. Add
the flour, baking soda, spices and tomatoes in small alternating batches, and mix until
creamy. In a small bowl, mix a pinch of flour with the raisins and nuts, then fold into
batter. Pour into greased and floured cake pans (or loaf pan or cup cake papers), and
bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool cake
completely before frosting. To make frosting: mix the cream cheese with the
powdered sugar adding the milk to make into a smooth spread. Top cake with
minutes or till edges are lightly browned.
TOMATO OR CARROT CAKE.title: TOMATO OR CARROT CAKE
ingredients: 1 1/2 c. solid pack canned tomatoes or
TOMATO OR CARROT CAKE.instructions: In a mixer, cream the butter and sugar, then add the egg and mix until smooth. Add the flour, baking soda, spices and tomatoes in small alternating batches, and mix until creamy. In a small bowl, mix a pinch of flour with the raisins and nuts, then fold into batter. Pour into greased and floured cake pans (or loaf pan or cup cake papers), and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool cake completely before frosting. To make frosting: mix the cream cheese with the powdered sugar adding the milk to make into a smooth spread. Top cake with frosting. Vegetarian variation: substitute the egg with 1/4 c. apple sauce and omit frosting.

raw_meal: Mix all ingredients together. Batter should not be too soft or too stiff. Split dough in
half and make two loaf shaped rectangles. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for
about 1/2 hour until golden brown. Let cool. Cut the short end of the rectangle into
pieces about 3/4 to one inch thick. Put cookies on two cookie sheets (spread out) on
their sides and bake in oven at 325 degrees until hard and golden brown. Turn biscotti
over after 25-30 minutes, and bake another 15 or 20 minutes. (Baking longer will
make harder biscotti.) Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.
ANISE BISCOTTI.title: ANISE BISCOTTI
ANISE BISCOTTI.instructions: Mix all ingredients together. Batter should not be too soft or too stiff. Split dough in half and make two loaf shaped rectangles. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 1/2 hour until golden brown. Let cool. Cut the short end of the rectangle into pieces about 3/4 to one inch thick. Put cookies on two cookie sheets (spread out) on their sides and bake in oven at 325 degrees until hard and golden brown. Turn biscotti over after 25-30 minutes, and bake another 15 or 20 minutes. (Baking longer will make harder biscotti.) Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.

raw_meal: Sift together the flour, cocoa and baking powder. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl or
stand mixer, beat together the egg, sugar, vanilla and water for 30 seconds. Increase
speed to high and beat until mixture has quadrupled in volume and is very thick,
about 10 minutes. Stop mixer every few minutes to scrape sides. Fold in the flour
mixture and then the butter. Spoon batter into Madeleine molds, filling each cup only
3/4 full. Bake 8 to 9 minutes in a preheated 400 degree oven. Remove cookies from
mold and cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.
CHOCOLATE MADELEINES.title: CHOCOLATE MADELEINES
ingredients: 4 T. unsalted butter, at room temperature
CHOCOLATE MADELEINES.instructions: Sift together the flour, cocoa and baking powder. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, beat together the egg, sugar, vanilla and water for 30 seconds. Increase speed to high and beat until mixture has quadrupled in volume and is very thick, about 10 minutes. Stop mixer every few minutes to scrape sides. Fold in the flour mixture and then the butter. Spoon batter into Madeleine molds, filling each cup only 3/4 full. Bake 8 to 9 minutes in a preheated 400 degree oven. Remove cookies from mold and cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Grease one or two cookie sheets. Cream the butter or
margarine and beat in the honey. Gradually mix in the flour, salt, and vanilla. Add the
pecans and mix gently. Wrap dough in plastic and chill for 1 hour. Form small balls
by hand, the size of quarters. Place 2 inches apart on the cookie sheets. Bake for 35 or
40 minutes. Remove from oven and as soon as the cookies are cool enough to touch,
roll in the powdered sugar. Allow to cool and roll again in sugar. Vegetarian
variation: Use margarine instead of butter.
BUTTERBALLS.title: BUTTERBALLS
ingredients: 8 T. sweet butter or margarine, softened
1 c. shelled pecans or walnuts, chopped
BUTTERBALLS.instructions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Grease one or two cookie sheets. Cream the butter or margarine and beat in the honey. Gradually mix in the flour, salt, and vanilla. Add the pecans and mix gently. Wrap dough in plastic and chill for 1 hour. Form small balls by hand, the size of quarters. Place 2 inches apart on the cookie sheets. Bake for 35 or 40 minutes. Remove from oven and as soon as the cookies are cool enough to touch, roll in the powdered sugar. Allow to cool and roll again in sugar. Vegetarian variation: Use margarine instead of butter.

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan combine the sugar, water, and butter and cook over medium
heat until the mix comes to a boil. Cook, stirring constantly until light brown, about 9
minutes after it begins to boil. Remove from heat and add the vanilla and chopped
nuts all at once, stirring very little. Pour into an 8 x 8 buttered pan. Cool until lightly
firm on top, then put the chocolate bars on top to melt. When melted, spread the
chocolate all over the top of the toffee and sprinkle with more chopped nuts. Cool
completely and break into small pieces. Store in a sealed container with wax paper
between layers.
ENGLISH TOFFEE.title: ENGLISH TOFFEE
ENGLISH TOFFEE.instructions: In a medium sauce pan combine the sugar, water, and butter and cook over medium heat until the mix comes to a boil. Cook, stirring constantly until light brown, about 9 minutes after it begins to boil. Remove from heat and add the vanilla and chopped nuts all at once, stirring very little. Pour into an 8 x 8 buttered pan. Cool until lightly firm on top, then put the chocolate bars on top to melt. When melted, spread the chocolate all over the top of the toffee and sprinkle with more chopped nuts. Cool completely and break into small pieces. Store in a sealed container with wax paper between layers.

raw_meal: In a mixing bowl beat the butter or margarine with an electric mixer on medium high
speed for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, the brown sugar, sugar, eggs,
vanilla, and baking soda. Beat mixture till thoroughly combined. Beat in the
remaining flour. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts (optional). Drop a large tsp. of dough
onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 8 - 10
CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES.title: CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES
CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES.instructions: In a mixing bowl beat the butter or margarine with an electric mixer on medium high speed for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, the brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and baking soda. Beat mixture till thoroughly combined. Beat in the remaining flour. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts (optional). Drop a large tsp. of dough onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 8 - 10 minutes or till edges are lightly browned.

raw_meal: In a heavy sauce pan, combine sugar, butter, and milk and bring to a rolling boil,
stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes over medium heat, stirring. Remove from heat,
add chocolate chips and stir well until completely incorporated. Add the marshmallow
cream, nuts, vanilla and fruit and mix thoroughly. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan.
Cool and cut into squares.
FANTASY FUDGE.title: FANTASY FUDGE
FANTASY FUDGE.instructions: In a heavy sauce pan, combine sugar, butter, and milk and bring to a rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes over medium heat, stirring. Remove from heat, add chocolate chips and stir well until completely incorporated. Add the marshmallow cream, nuts, vanilla and fruit and mix thoroughly. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Cool and cut into squares.

raw_meal: dough ( about 2 T.) and form into a ball. Put the softened piece of melban inside the
ball, cover the hole, flatten with your palms and place onto a cookie sheet. Make a
crisscross design ontop with a fork. Set cookies aside for about 1 hour to rise. Bake at
275-300 degrees for 20 minutes, or until very light golden brown. Let cool on pan.
When cookies are completely cool, dip each cookie twice into bowl of powdered
sugar until covered completely.
In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, mix together the sugar, oil, Crisco and orange
juice. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, anise seed and baking powder. Add
the flour mixture to the liquid mixture, a little at a time until well incorporated.
Lightly grease a large jelly roll pan and spread the cookie dough evenly in the bottom,
using a rolling pin to compress and flatten. With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut
cookies into rectangle or diamond shape, approximately 4 inches by 1 inch. Remove
the cookies one by one and place onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake cookies in
a pre-heated 350 degree oven for 10-15 minutes, turning each cookie every few
minutes so all sides are evenly toasted and medium golden brown.
FAYISH BIL YANSOUN.title: FAYISH BIL YANSOUN
FAYISH BIL YANSOUN.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Anise Seed Cookies)
FAYISH BIL YANSOUN.instructions: dough ( about 2 T.) and form into a ball. Put the softened piece of melban inside the ball, cover the hole, flatten with your palms and place onto a cookie sheet. Make a crisscross design ontop with a fork. Set cookies aside for about 1 hour to rise. Bake at 275-300 degrees for 20 minutes, or until very light golden brown. Let cool on pan. When cookies are completely cool, dip each cookie twice into bowl of powdered sugar until covered completely. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, mix together the sugar, oil, Crisco and orange juice. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, anise seed and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the liquid mixture, a little at a time until well incorporated. Lightly grease a large jelly roll pan and spread the cookie dough evenly in the bottom, using a rolling pin to compress and flatten. With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut cookies into rectangle or diamond shape, approximately 4 inches by 1 inch. Remove the cookies one by one and place onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake cookies in a pre-heated 350 degree oven for 10-15 minutes, turning each cookie every few minutes so all sides are evenly toasted and medium golden brown.

LEMON ANISE BISCOTTI.title: LEMON ANISE BISCOTTI
LEMON ANISE BISCOTTI.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk the eggs, sugar, oil, lemon peel, anise seeds, baking powder, extract and salt until smooth. Stir in the flour and nuts. Divide the dough into two and form each piece into a 12 x 1 1/2 inch log and place onto a greased cookie sheet. Keep 4 inches between logs. Bake logs 20 - 25 minutes. Transfer the logs to a cutting board and cut 1/2 inch slices. Place each piece in its side onto the cookie sheet and bake 10 - 15 minutes until golden. Cooking biscotti a few minutes longer will make them harder. Cool on wire rack.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter and egg white. Mix in the
powdered sugar 1 cup at a time. Mix in the flour one cup at a time. Take 2 tsps. of the
dough and form a ball. Place balls 1 inch apart on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12
minutes or until light golden brown.
GHORAIABA.title: GHORAIABA
GHORAIABA.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Butter Cookies)
GHORAIABA.instructions: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter and egg white. Mix in the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time. Mix in the flour one cup at a time. Take 2 tsps. of the dough and form a ball. Place balls 1 inch apart on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until light golden brown.

raw_meal: In a small bowl, mix the water, yeast and sugar. Set aside. Clarify the butter by
boiling, then boiling again until the milk solids are brown. Strain the butter. In a large
mixing bowl stir together the flour and the hot butter. Further mix the flour and butter
by taking a small handful of the mix and kneading it until very smooth (4-5 times).
Repeat with handfuls until all the dough is completely kneaded. Put all the handfuls
together and knead as a whole. Pour the yeast mixture over the dough and mix
thoroughly. Cover the bowl with a clean moist towel and let sit in a warm place for
1/2 hour. To form the cookies, take a small amount (1/2 tsp.) of the melban and with
buttered fingers, work between your fingers until smooth. Take a small amount of
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk the eggs, sugar, oil, lemon peel, anise seeds,
baking powder, extract and salt until smooth. Stir in the flour and nuts. Divide the
dough into two and form each piece into a 12 x 1 1/2 inch log and place onto a
greased cookie sheet. Keep 4 inches between logs. Bake logs 20 - 25 minutes.
Transfer the logs to a cutting board and cut 1/2 inch slices. Place each piece in its side
onto the cookie sheet and bake 10 - 15 minutes until golden. Cooking biscotti a few
minutes longer will make them harder. Cool on wire rack.
KHAHK.title: KHAHK
KHAHK.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Filled Cookies)
KHAHK.instructions: In a small bowl, mix the water, yeast and sugar. Set aside. Clarify the butter by boiling, then boiling again until the milk solids are brown. Strain the butter. In a large mixing bowl stir together the flour and the hot butter. Further mix the flour and butter by taking a small handful of the mix and kneading it until very smooth (4-5 times). Repeat with handfuls until all the dough is completely kneaded. Put all the handfuls together and knead as a whole. Pour the yeast mixture over the dough and mix thoroughly. Cover the bowl with a clean moist towel and let sit in a warm place for 1/2 hour. To form the cookies, take a small amount (1/2 tsp.) of the melban and with buttered fingers, work between your fingers until smooth. Take a small amount of dough ( about 2 T.) and form into a ball. Put the softened piece of melban inside the ball, cover the hole, flatten with your palms and place onto a cookie sheet. Make a crisscross design ontop with a fork. Set cookies aside for about 1 hour to rise. Bake at 275-300 degrees for 20 minutes, or until very light golden brown. Let cool on pan. When cookies are completely cool, dip each cookie twice into bowl of powdered sugar until covered completely.

raw_meal: Stir the 2 tsp. lemon juice into milk. Let stand 5 minutes. Beat butter or margarine
with an electric mixer for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, 3/4 c. of the sugar,
the egg, baking powder, soda, lemon peel, and milk mixture. Beat till thoroughly
combined, then beat in remaining flour. Drop by rounded tsp. 2 inches apart onto an
ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 -12 minutes or till edges are
lightly browned. Cool cookies on wire rack. Stir together the remaining sugar and the
2 T. lemon juice, brush cookies.
LEMON TEA COOKIES.title: LEMON TEA COOKIES
LEMON TEA COOKIES.instructions: Stir the 2 tsp. lemon juice into milk. Let stand 5 minutes. Beat butter or margarine with an electric mixer for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, 3/4 c. of the sugar, the egg, baking powder, soda, lemon peel, and milk mixture. Beat till thoroughly combined, then beat in remaining flour. Drop by rounded tsp. 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 -12 minutes or till edges are lightly browned. Cool cookies on wire rack. Stir together the remaining sugar and the 2 T. lemon juice, brush cookies.

raw_meal: This recipe uses 2-3 Madeleine molds. Put Madeleine pans in preheated 350 degree
oven to heat. Brush molds with melted butter or spray with non-stick cooking spray.
Sift flour and baking powder in a large bowl, then whisk in the zest. Split the vanilla
bean lengthwise with a sharp knife. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean with the
tip of knife and place in another bowl. Add the sugar and rub with seeds until well
incorporated. Whisk in the eggs, milk, honey and melted butter. Fold into the flour
mixture until combined. Spoon rounded tablespoons of batter into each mold. Bake
10-12 minutes until light golden, switching pans around and turning them around in
oven halfway through cooking time to cook evenly. Serve slightly warm. Best if
served the same day.
MADELEINES.title: MADELEINES
MADELEINES.instructions: This recipe uses 2-3 Madeleine molds. Put Madeleine pans in preheated 350 degree oven to heat. Brush molds with melted butter or spray with non-stick cooking spray. Sift flour and baking powder in a large bowl, then whisk in the zest. Split the vanilla bean lengthwise with a sharp knife. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean with the tip of knife and place in another bowl. Add the sugar and rub with seeds until well incorporated. Whisk in the eggs, milk, honey and melted butter. Fold into the flour mixture until combined. Spoon rounded tablespoons of batter into each mold. Bake 10-12 minutes until light golden, switching pans around and turning them around in oven halfway through cooking time to cook evenly. Serve slightly warm. Best if served the same day.

raw_meal: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In 9 x 13 inch baking pan, melt the butter in the oven
(or in a small glass bowl in the microwave). Sprinkle the graham cracker crumbs over
the butter in the bottom of the pan and mix until coated, then press down firmly
covering the bottom of the pan. Pour the milk evenly over the crumbs. Top with the
chocolate chips, then the coconut and the nuts. Press down firmly. Bake 25 - 30
minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Chill and cut into bars.
MAGIC COOKIE BARS.title: MAGIC COOKIE BARS
MAGIC COOKIE BARS.instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In 9 x 13 inch baking pan, melt the butter in the oven (or in a small glass bowl in the microwave). Sprinkle the graham cracker crumbs over the butter in the bottom of the pan and mix until coated, then press down firmly covering the bottom of the pan. Pour the milk evenly over the crumbs. Top with the chocolate chips, then the coconut and the nuts. Press down firmly. Bake 25 - 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Chill and cut into bars.

raw_meal: Cream the butter until smooth. Add the sugar and vanilla and stir until incorporated.
Add the flour and nuts and mix. Roll into small balls and place onto a greased cookie
sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and roll each ball in
powdered sugar while hot. Set aside and roll again in sugar when cool. Vegetarian
varation: Use margarine or shortening instead of butter.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt the butter; add the sugar and molasses and mix
thoroughly. Lightly beat the egg and add to the butter mixture; blend well. Sift the
flour with spices, salt and baking soda and add to first mixture. Mix; batter will be
wet. Lay a sheet of foil on a cookie sheet. Drop tablespoons of cookie batter on foil,
leaving 3 inches between the cookies. They will spread during cooking. Bake until
cookies start to darken, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on foil.
Makes 24 large flat cookies.
MEXICAN WEDDING CAKES.title: MEXICAN WEDDING CAKES
MEXICAN WEDDING CAKES.subtitle: (Also called Russian Tea Cakes)
MEXICAN WEDDING CAKES.instructions: Cream the butter until smooth. Add the sugar and vanilla and stir until incorporated. Add the flour and nuts and mix. Roll into small balls and place onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and roll each ball in powdered sugar while hot. Set aside and roll again in sugar when cool. Vegetarian varation: Use margarine or shortening instead of butter.

raw_meal: Cream the butter, brown sugar and sugar until smooth. Add each of the rest of the
ingredients in order and mix well. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the mix onto a cookie
sheet. Leave one to two inches between cookies. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes.
OATMEAL COOKIES.title: OATMEAL COOKIES
OATMEAL COOKIES.instructions: Cream the butter, brown sugar and sugar until smooth. Add each of the rest of the ingredients in order and mix well. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the mix onto a cookie sheet. Leave one to two inches between cookies. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes.

raw_meal: Remove the pulp from the inside of very soft, ripe persimmons. Beat the pulp, lemon
juice and baking soda together and let stand while mixing together egg, sugar and oil.
Add pulp to the egg mixture. Add salt, flour and spices. Fold in nuts and raisins. Pour
into a 9 x 13 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until toothpick
comes out clean when center is tested and edges pull away slightly from the pan. Cool
about 15 minute and glaze top with 1 cup powdered sugar mixed with 2 T. lemon
juice. Cool and cut into squares.
PERSIMMON BARS.title: PERSIMMON BARS
ingredients: 1/2 c. shortening, oil or melted butter
PERSIMMON BARS.instructions: Remove the pulp from the inside of very soft, ripe persimmons. Beat the pulp, lemon juice and baking soda together and let stand while mixing together egg, sugar and oil. Add pulp to the egg mixture. Add salt, flour and spices. Fold in nuts and raisins. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean when center is tested and edges pull away slightly from the pan. Cool about 15 minute and glaze top with 1 cup powdered sugar mixed with 2 T. lemon juice. Cool and cut into squares.

MOLASSES COOKIES.title: MOLASSES COOKIES
MOLASSES COOKIES.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt the butter; add the sugar and molasses and mix thoroughly. Lightly beat the egg and add to the butter mixture; blend well. Sift the flour with spices, salt and baking soda and add to first mixture. Mix; batter will be wet. Lay a sheet of foil on a cookie sheet. Drop tablespoons of cookie batter on foil, leaving 3 inches between the cookies. They will spread during cooking. Bake until cookies start to darken, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on foil. Makes 24 large flat cookies.

raw_meal: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter and add the eggs one at a time
mixing in between. Then add the vanilla, and the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time, and
mix until creamy. In a separate bowl mix the flour and baking powder, then add to the
butter mixture one cup at a time. Divide dough in half and mix one half with the
cocoa powder. Form small oval shapes about the size of your thumb. Press slightly
with the back of a fork to make a design. Bake cookies in a preheated 350 degree
oven for 6-8 minutes. Let cookies cool completely. To make sandwiches, take one
vanilla and one chocolate cookie, spread a little jam on one side and press together.
PETIT FOUR.title: PETIT FOUR
PETIT FOUR.subtitle: (Vanilla and Chocolate Sandwich Cookies)
ingredients: 1 c. orange marmalade or other jam
PETIT FOUR.instructions: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter and add the eggs one at a time mixing in between. Then add the vanilla, and the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time, and mix until creamy. In a separate bowl mix the flour and baking powder, then add to the butter mixture one cup at a time. Divide dough in half and mix one half with the cocoa powder. Form small oval shapes about the size of your thumb. Press slightly with the back of a fork to make a design. Bake cookies in a preheated 350 degree oven for 6-8 minutes. Let cookies cool completely. To make sandwiches, take one vanilla and one chocolate cookie, spread a little jam on one side and press together.

raw_meal: Cream the butter, sugar and eggs. Blend in the flour, cream of tarter, baking soda and
salt. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon. Form dough into 2-inch balls. Roll
the balls in the sugar mixture, then place on a cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake at 400
degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on wire rack.
SNICKERDOODLES.title: SNICKERDOODLES
SNICKERDOODLES.instructions: Cream the butter, sugar and eggs. Blend in the flour, cream of tarter, baking soda and salt. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon. Form dough into 2-inch balls. Roll the balls in the sugar mixture, then place on a cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on wire rack.

raw_meal: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. With a stand mixer, blend together the eggs and vanilla
until frothy. Mix in the baking soda, baking powder, and sugar until creamy. Add the
oil and mix one more minute. Add 2 cups of the flour to make a dough. Add more
flour as necessary to make a thick dough. Stir in the nuts and cherries by hand.
Remove dough and knead gently on floured surface for 2 minutes, adding flour as
necessary to keep from getting sticky. Divide the dough into two and create logs
about 12 x 1 1/2 inches and place onto greased cookies sheet. Flatten a little with wet
hands. Bake 45 minutes or one hour. Remove from oven and transfer to cutting board.
Cut into 3/4 inch slices and lay on their sites on cookie sheet. Bake 30 - 40 minutes.
Cool on wire rack.
PINE NUT AND CHERRY BISCOTTI.title: PINE NUT AND CHERRY BISCOTTI
ingredients: 1/3 c. oil (light olive or canola oil)
1 c. pine nuts or almonds, whole
PINE NUT AND CHERRY BISCOTTI.instructions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. With a stand mixer, blend together the eggs and vanilla until frothy. Mix in the baking soda, baking powder, and sugar until creamy. Add the oil and mix one more minute. Add 2 cups of the flour to make a dough. Add more flour as necessary to make a thick dough. Stir in the nuts and cherries by hand. Remove dough and knead gently on floured surface for 2 minutes, adding flour as necessary to keep from getting sticky. Divide the dough into two and create logs about 12 x 1 1/2 inches and place onto greased cookies sheet. Flatten a little with wet hands. Bake 45 minutes or one hour. Remove from oven and transfer to cutting board. Cut into 3/4 inch slices and lay on their sites on cookie sheet. Bake 30 - 40 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

raw_meal: Combine flour and sugar, then cut in the butter till mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Form the mixture into a ball and turn out onto a flat surface. Knead dough 6 or 7
times until smooth. On an ungreased cookie sheet, make a ball then flatten out with a
rolling pin into an 8-inch circle, keeping edges smooth and rounded. With your
fingers, make a scalloped edge. With a knife, cut the circle into 16 wedges. Leave
wedges in circle. (Or, cut small circles with cookie cutter.) Bake in a 325 degree oven
for 25 - 30 minutes or until light brown on bottom and center is cooked. Let sit for
five minutes then cool on a wire rack. Variations: Chop roasted salted nuts, sprinkle
with sugar and spread on top of cookies before baking; top cookies with a few
chocolate chips or one Hersheys kiss; substitute brown sugar for white sugar.
SHORTBREAD COOKIES.title: SHORTBREAD COOKIES
ingredients: 1 cube cold butter, cut into chunks
SHORTBREAD COOKIES.instructions: Combine flour and sugar, then cut in the butter till mixture resembles fine crumbs. Form the mixture into a ball and turn out onto a flat surface. Knead dough 6 or 7 times until smooth. On an ungreased cookie sheet, make a ball then flatten out with a rolling pin into an 8-inch circle, keeping edges smooth and rounded. With your fingers, make a scalloped edge. With a knife, cut the circle into 16 wedges. Leave wedges in circle. (Or, cut small circles with cookie cutter.) Bake in a 325 degree oven for 25 - 30 minutes or until light brown on bottom and center is cooked. Let sit for five minutes then cool on a wire rack. Variations: Chop roasted salted nuts, sprinkle with sugar and spread on top of cookies before baking; top cookies with a few chocolate chips or one Hersheys kiss; substitute brown sugar for white sugar.

raw_meal: In a medium sauce pan, bring water and all ingredients except walnuts to a boil,
stirring constantly until 236 degrees on a candy thermometer (soft ball stage).
Remove from heat and add walnuts. Stir until creamy. Turn out onto large baking
sheet lined with parchment or waxed paper, separating walnuts using two forks.
SPICED WALNUTS.title: SPICED WALNUTS
ingredients: 2 c. Walnut halves or large pieces
SPICED WALNUTS.instructions: In a medium sauce pan, bring water and all ingredients except walnuts to a boil, stirring constantly until 236 degrees on a candy thermometer (soft ball stage). Remove from heat and add walnuts. Stir until creamy. Turn out onto large baking sheet lined with parchment or waxed paper, separating walnuts using two forks.

raw_meal: In a medium bowl, combine the flour and salt. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer,
cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg and vanilla and beat until well mixed. Scrape
sides of bowl. Add the flour mixture and mix until just combined. Gather the dough
into a ball and wrap with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour. On a floured surface, with a
lightly floured rolling pin, roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness. with cookie cutters,
cut dough and place shaped cookies on ungreased cookie sheets. Decorate with
colored sugars. Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 13-15 minutes, watching
carefully so cookies do not brown. Remove from oven and place onto wire racks to
cool.
SUGAR COOKIES.title: SUGAR COOKIES
SUGAR COOKIES.instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the flour and salt. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg and vanilla and beat until well mixed. Scrape sides of bowl. Add the flour mixture and mix until just combined. Gather the dough into a ball and wrap with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour. On a floured surface, with a lightly floured rolling pin, roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness. with cookie cutters, cut dough and place shaped cookies on ungreased cookie sheets. Decorate with colored sugars. Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 13-15 minutes, watching carefully so cookies do not brown. Remove from oven and place onto wire racks to cool.

raw_meal: Cream together the cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add in flour until
incorporated. Chill dough for 15 minutes. Shape into 2 dozen 1-inch balls and place
each ball into a tiny 1 3/4 inch muffin cup. Press the bottom and sides into cups.
Beat together the egg, sugar and butter. Stir in the vanilla and salt and blend until
smooth. Divide the pecans in half and sprinkle a little into the bottom of each cup.
Spoon the sugar mixture over the nuts halfway up the side, then top with remaining
nuts. To avoid spilling over, do not fill cups to top. Bake at 325 degrees for 25
minutes, until set. Cool and remove from cups.
TASSY TARTS.title: TASSY TARTS
TASSY TARTS.subtitle: (Mini Pecan Pies)
ingredients: 2/3 c. pecans or walnuts, finely chopped
TASSY TARTS.instructions: Cream together the cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add in flour until incorporated. Chill dough for 15 minutes. Shape into 2 dozen 1-inch balls and place each ball into a tiny 1 3/4 inch muffin cup. Press the bottom and sides into cups. Beat together the egg, sugar and butter. Stir in the vanilla and salt and blend until smooth. Divide the pecans in half and sprinkle a little into the bottom of each cup.
