Spoon the sugar mixture over the nuts halfway up the side, then top with remaining nuts. To avoid spilling over, do not fill cups to top. Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes, until set. Cool and remove from cups.

raw_meal: Line a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan with foil all the way up to the top and over the
edges. Sprinkle the coarsely chopped nuts into the bottom of the pan. Butter the sides
of a large heavy saucepan. In saucepan melt the butter. Add sugar, corn syrup, and 3
T. water. Cook and stir over medium-high heat to boiling. With a candy thermometer,
cook and stir over medium heat to 290 degrees (about 15 minutes). Watch carefully
after 280 degrees to prevent burning. Remove saucepan from heat and remove
thermometer. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Let stand 5 minutes or till firm, then
sprinkle with chocolate pieces. Let stand 1 - 2 minutes, then spread chocolate over
mixture. Sprinkle top with nuts. Chill until firm, then lift candy out of pan, remove
foil and break into pieces.
TOFFEE BUTTER CRUNCH.title: TOFFEE BUTTER CRUNCH
ingredients: 1/2 c. toasted almonds or pecans, finely
TOFFEE BUTTER CRUNCH.instructions: Line a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan with foil all the way up to the top and over the edges. Sprinkle the coarsely chopped nuts into the bottom of the pan. Butter the sides of a large heavy saucepan. In saucepan melt the butter. Add sugar, corn syrup, and 3 T. water. Cook and stir over medium-high heat to boiling. With a candy thermometer, cook and stir over medium heat to 290 degrees (about 15 minutes). Watch carefully after 280 degrees to prevent burning. Remove saucepan from heat and remove thermometer. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Let stand 5 minutes or till firm, then sprinkle with chocolate pieces. Let stand 1 - 2 minutes, then spread chocolate over mixture. Sprinkle top with nuts. Chill until firm, then lift candy out of pan, remove foil and break into pieces.

raw_meal: In a mixing bowl or stand mixer cream the butter until smooth. Add remaining
ingredients and beat on medium speed until creamy. If too stiff, beat in a few drops of
milk.milk.milk.milk.
BUTTERCREAM FROSTING.title: BUTTERCREAM FROSTING
BUTTERCREAM FROSTING.instructions: In a mixing bowl or stand mixer cream the butter until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and beat on medium speed until creamy. If too stiff, beat in a few drops of milk.milk.milk.milk.

raw_meal: Peel and chop the eggs. Place all ingredients except oil in blend and blend until
smooth. While running, stream in the olive oil until dressing is emulsified. Use on
romaine or any type of lettuce.
CAESAR SALAD DRESSING.title: CAESAR SALAD DRESSING
CAESAR SALAD DRESSING.instructions: Peel and chop the eggs. Place all ingredients except oil in blend and blend until smooth. While running, stream in the olive oil until dressing is emulsified. Use on romaine or any type of lettuce.

raw_meal: In a medium bowl with mixer, cream the butter, then add the cocoa, sugar and milk.
Beat on medium until creamy. Then blend in vanilla. Note: Up to 3/4 cup cocoa can
be used for a stronger chocolate flavor.
CHOCOLATE FROSTING.title: CHOCOLATE FROSTING
CHOCOLATE FROSTING.instructions: In a medium bowl with mixer, cream the butter, then add the cocoa, sugar and milk. Beat on medium until creamy. Then blend in vanilla. Note: Up to 3/4 cup cocoa can be used for a stronger chocolate flavor.

raw_meal: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips 2 minutes on high. Stir to smooth and
set aside to cool. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat
until smooth. Add melted chocolate and continue beating until smooth.
CHOCOLATE SOUR CREAM FROSTING.title: CHOCOLATE SOUR CREAM FROSTING
CHOCOLATE SOUR CREAM FROSTING.instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips 2 minutes on high. Stir to smooth and set aside to cool. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add melted chocolate and continue beating until smooth.

raw_meal: Wash cucumbers well and soak in cold water overnight. Drain and pack into very
clean 1/2 quart pickling jars. Add about 6-8 slices of garlic, 1-2 hot pepper slices and
a piece of the dill head to each jar. Combine vinegar, water, salt and alum powder in a
large pot and bring to boil. Pour mixture over cucumbers and seal at once (with very
clean self-sealing canning lids and rings). Let pickles sit in a dark cool place for 3-4
weeks before eating. Pickles can stay good (as long as jar is sealed) up to six months.
Note: Alum powder can be purchased at most grocery or household supply stores.
Fresh dill heads are available in the fruit and vegetable section of most grocery stores,
especially in late summer. Be sure to wash thoroughly before placing into jars.
Additional garlic, hot peppers and dill may be added to each jar to make stronger or
hotter pickles. Cucumbers may be sliced into halves or quarters before packing into
jars. (Don't pack too tightly to allow enough vinegar mixture to pickle cucumbers.)
DILL PICKLES.title: DILL PICKLES
ingredients: 1 hot red or green pepper, chopped or
DILL PICKLES.instructions: Wash cucumbers well and soak in cold water overnight. Drain and pack into very clean 1/2 quart pickling jars. Add about 6-8 slices of garlic, 1-2 hot pepper slices and a piece of the dill head to each jar. Combine vinegar, water, salt and alum powder in a large pot and bring to boil. Pour mixture over cucumbers and seal at once (with very clean self-sealing canning lids and rings). Let pickles sit in a dark cool place for 3-4 weeks before eating. Pickles can stay good (as long as jar is sealed) up to six months. Note: Alum powder can be purchased at most grocery or household supply stores. Fresh dill heads are available in the fruit and vegetable section of most grocery stores, especially in late summer. Be sure to wash thoroughly before placing into jars. Additional garlic, hot peppers and dill may be added to each jar to make stronger or hotter pickles. Cucumbers may be sliced into halves or quarters before packing into jars. (Don't pack too tightly to allow enough vinegar mixture to pickle cucumbers.)

raw_meal: Combine all ingredients but oil into a blender or food processor and blend well until
smooth. Then, gradually add oil in a small stream with blender on until mixture is
thick and emulsified. Add a dash or two of Tabasco sauce, if hotter mayonnaise is
desired.
GARLIC MAYONNAISE.title: GARLIC MAYONNAISE
GARLIC MAYONNAISE.subtitle: (Hot)
GARLIC MAYONNAISE.instructions: Combine all ingredients but oil into a blender or food processor and blend well until smooth. Then, gradually add oil in a small stream with blender on until mixture is thick and emulsified. Add a dash or two of Tabasco sauce, if hotter mayonnaise is desired.

GRANOLA.title: GRANOLA
GRANOLA.instructions: In a large bowl, mix all ingredients except raisins. Spread out on a large baking sheet or jelly roll pan. Bake at 300 degrees for 45 or 50 minutes or until light golden brown, stirring every 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes, then add the raisins. Let cool completely occasionally stirring to prevent lumping. Store in a tightly covered jar or plastic bag. Vegetarian variation: Omit the non-fat dry milk.

raw_meal: In a heated saute pan, add the oil and the chopped vegetables. Cook on medium until
soft. Add the tomatoes and the fresh basil and cook for 30 minutes on medium low,
stirring every few minutes. Let mixture cool, then puree in a food processor. Pour into
clean jars, cover and refrigerate for up to 1 week, or use immediately.
HOMEMADE TOMATO SAUCE.title: HOMEMADE TOMATO SAUCE
HOMEMADE TOMATO SAUCE.instructions: In a heated saute pan, add the oil and the chopped vegetables. Cook on medium until soft. Add the tomatoes and the fresh basil and cook for 30 minutes on medium low, stirring every few minutes. Let mixture cool, then puree in a food processor. Pour into clean jars, cover and refrigerate for up to 1 week, or use immediately.

raw_meal: Wash cucumbers and jalapeno peppers well. Fill a clean 4 qt. jar with cucumbers,
jalapenos, garlic, red pepper and vinegar. In a sauce pan, mix the salt with enough
water to fill jar and stir until dissolved. Pour water over cucumbers and top jar with a
tight lid. Shake to distribute salt and leave to pickle 3-4 days.
KHIAR MECHALEL.title: KHIAR MECHALEL
KHIAR MECHALEL.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Pickled Cucumbers)
KHIAR MECHALEL.instructions: Wash cucumbers and jalapeno peppers well. Fill a clean 4 qt. jar with cucumbers, jalapenos, garlic, red pepper and vinegar. In a sauce pan, mix the salt with enough water to fill jar and stir until dissolved. Pour water over cucumbers and top jar with a tight lid. Shake to distribute salt and leave to pickle 3-4 days.

raw_meal: Increase or reduce ingredients depending on how many jars you want to make. In the
bottom of a large sterilized jar, place the beet slices. Wash turnips, cut off ends, and
peel any brown spots. Place the turnips into the jar until almost filled. Mix the salt and
water and pour over the turnips and cover tightly with lid. Place in the refrigerator for
one month (put a sticker with the date on the outside of the jar). Pickles will be light
pink and not mushy when done.
LIFTLIFTLIFTLIFT.title: LIFT
LIFTLIFTLIFTLIFT.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Turnip Pickles)
LIFTLIFTLIFTLIFT.instructions: Increase or reduce ingredients depending on how many jars you want to make. In the bottom of a large sterilized jar, place the beet slices. Wash turnips, cut off ends, and peel any brown spots. Place the turnips into the jar until almost filled. Mix the salt and water and pour over the turnips and cover tightly with lid. Place in the refrigerator for one month (put a sticker with the date on the outside of the jar). Pickles will be light pink and not mushy when done.

raw_meal: In a large bowl, mix all ingredients except raisins. Spread out on a large baking sheet
or jelly roll pan. Bake at 300 degrees for 45 or 50 minutes or until light golden brown,
stirring every 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes, then
add the raisins. Let cool completely occasionally stirring to prevent lumping. Store in
a tightly covered jar or plastic bag. Vegetarian variation: Omit the non-fat dry milk.
Blend together flour, butter, shortening and salt in a bowl with your fingertips or a
PIE DOUGH.title: PIE DOUGH
ingredients: 3/4 stick cold unsalted butter, cut into
PIE DOUGH.instructions: Blend together flour, butter, shortening and salt in a bowl with your fingertips or a pastry blender (or pulse in a food processor) just until mixture resembles coarse meal with some small butter lumps. Drizzle 3 T. ice water evenly over mixture. Gently stir with fork (or pulse) until incorporated. Squeeze a small handful of dough: If it doesn't hold together, then add more ice water 1/2 T. at a time, stirring (or pulsing) until incorporated. Do not overwork dough, or pastry will be tough. Turn dough onto a work surface. Divide dough into 4 portions and with heel of your hand, smear each portion once or twice in a forward motion to help distribute fat. Gather all dough together with a pastry scraper. Press into a ball then flatten into a 5-inch disk. Wrap disk in plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 1 hour. Vegetarian variation: Use shortning instead of butter. To make a baked pie shell, roll chilled dough on a lightly flouered surface with a lightly floured rolling pin to 1/4 inches larger than pie plate. Roll dough around pin and unroll onto pie plate. Gently press bottom and sides being careful not to pull or stretch dough. Fold the extra dough under the rim and crimp. Chill pie for 15 minutes. Bake pie shell for 8-10 minutes at 450 degrees or until light golden brown.

raw_meal: Set a strainer over a deep bowl, leaving at least 2 inches space at bottom of bowl. Line
strainer with 2 layers of cheesecloth. Dump the yogurt (made without gelatin) into the
cloth. Enclose strainer and bowl with plastic wrap to make airtight. Chill for 2 or up
to 4 days, draining off liquid occasionally. Scrape cheese from cloth and use
immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 5 more days.
YOGURT CHEESE.title: YOGURT CHEESE
ingredients: 3 - 4 c. plain reduced or non-fat yogurt
YOGURT CHEESE.instructions: Set a strainer over a deep bowl, leaving at least 2 inches space at bottom of bowl. Line strainer with 2 layers of cheesecloth. Dump the yogurt (made without gelatin) into the cloth. Enclose strainer and bowl with plastic wrap to make airtight. Chill for 2 or up to 4 days, draining off liquid occasionally. Scrape cheese from cloth and use immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 5 more days.

raw_meal: In a large bowl or bucket, add the olives and enough water to cover. Every few hours
drain the water and add fresh water to cover olives. Do this for 3 days. To make brine,
bring 1 qt. fresh water to a boil (or enough to almost fill jar), then let cool. Carefully
place the whole raw egg into the water and add 1 cup of salt, stirring to dissolve. To
determine the correct amount of salt, add 1/4 c. salt to water and stir to dissolve.
When egg floats, enough salt has been added; remove egg from brine. Drain water
from olives. Fill very clean canning jar almost to top with olives, jalapenos, garlic,
and celery, then fill jar half way with lemon juice. Pour brine into jar to fill 1/2" from
top. Gently pour olive oil into jar to cover the top. Cover jar with lid. Keep in
refrigerator to pickle for 1 or 2 months.

ZETOON MEKHALEL.title: ZETOON MEKHALEL
ZETOON MEKHALEL.subtitle: (Egyptian Style Picked Olives)
ZETOON MEKHALEL.instructions: In a large bowl or bucket, add the olives and enough water to cover. Every few hours drain the water and add fresh water to cover olives. Do this for 3 days. To make brine, bring 1 qt. fresh water to a boil (or enough to almost fill jar), then let cool. Carefully place the whole raw egg into the water and add 1 cup of salt, stirring to dissolve. To determine the correct amount of salt, add 1/4 c. salt to water and stir to dissolve. When egg floats, enough salt has been added; remove egg from brine. Drain water from olives. Fill very clean canning jar almost to top with olives, jalapenos, garlic, and celery, then fill jar half way with lemon juice. Pour brine into jar to fill 1/2" from top. Gently pour olive oil into jar to cover the top. Cover jar with lid. Keep in refrigerator to pickle for 1 or 2 months.

raw_meal: Line a large sieve with a layer of heavy-duty (fine-mesh) cheesecloth and place it
over a large bowl. In a 6 quart sauce pan, slowly bring the milk, cream, and salt to a
rolling boil over moderate heat, stirring occasionally to prevent scorching. Add the
lemon juice, then reduce heat to low and let simmer, stirring constantly, until the
mixture curdles, about 2 minutes. Pour the mixture into the lined sieve and let it drain
1 hour. Discard the liquid in the bowl, and chill the ricotta, covered and use within 2
days. Can be used in any recipe calling for Ricotta or served simply with a little honey
and cinnamon for dessert.
RICOTTA CHEESE.title: RICOTTA CHEESE
RICOTTA CHEESE.instructions: Line a large sieve with a layer of heavy-duty (fine-mesh) cheesecloth and place it over a large bowl. In a 6 quart sauce pan, slowly bring the milk, cream, and salt to a rolling boil over moderate heat, stirring occasionally to prevent scorching. Add the lemon juice, then reduce heat to low and let simmer, stirring constantly, until the mixture curdles, about 2 minutes. Pour the mixture into the lined sieve and let it drain 1 hour. Discard the liquid in the bowl, and chill the ricotta, covered and use within 2 days. Can be used in any recipe calling for Ricotta or served simply with a little honey and cinnamon for dessert.
